title: Head of Group Accounting
description:
**About the job** 




 We’re on a journey to change the way the world uses energy and accelerate the transition to renewable energy through our market-leading energy storage systems. We operate in nearly every continent, and the cornerstone for our company’s rapid growth is making products that matter for society. In our international team, you’ll have a key responsibility to develop our company’s processes, create new ways of working, and maintain our business excellence across different verticals.
 



  





***Responsibilities:***




 In the role as Head of Group Accounting, you will have overall responsibility for the Group's accounting, financial reports and its processes. The group includes handful legal entities that you must independently consolidate, and the work is done in the group reporting system Cognos Controller. You will work closely with finance functions within the Polarium Group both in Sweden and internationally, as well as with the parent company's finance function. You will be based in central Stockholm with our office located in Hagastaden.
 



  





***Your main tasks will be:***



* Consolidation and quality assurance of the Group's legal monthly, quarterly and annual financial statements (IFRS)
* Preparation of key figures and reporting
* Annual Report and Interim Reports in accordance with IFRS
* Responsible for tax from a consolidated financial perspective, including transfer-pricing
* System owner for the group reporting system Cognos Controller
* Implement and improve routines, processes and working methods
* Accounting projects at group level
* Regulatory issues
* Contact with external auditors



  





***Who are you:***




 To succeed in the role of Head of Group Accounting at Polarium, you must be driven, analytical, and goal-oriented, with a profound interest in accounting. You should have a can-do attitude and the ability to create structure in a fast-paced environment. Strong communication skills, both verbal and written, are essential, as well as a collaborative nature that thrives in dialogue with others in the finance function. You thrive in environments where you are given the opportunity to be involved in various accounting projects and are driven by continuing to improve routines, processes and working methods. When it comes to your experience, we see that you have an academic degree in economics and have subsequently worked for several years with group accounting, where you have had overall responsibility.
 



  





 An academic degree and solid experience of IFRS is a requirement. Knowledge of the Cognos Controller is an advantage, but not a requirement. You are proficient in English and Swedish in both speech and writing.
 



  





**We offer** 



* Bonus system
* Wellness contribution
* Five extra flexibility days



  





 Kindly submit your application through the provided apply button in the advertisement on our careers page, as we are unable to accept any applications via email in compliance with the GDPR regulations.
 



  





 At Polarium, creating change in the energy industry starts with our team. We believe a diverse workplace brings creativity, innovation and better represents our customers, and the many communities they serve, around the world. A positive work-life balance is what supercharges our teamwork and a sustainable personal journey throughout our careers.
 



  





 Since Polarium launched in 2015, we’ve been on a mission to redesign the energy industry. We’re unlocking the massive potential of energy storage systems through our wide range of intelligent and digital services. Our passion for solving challenges is what drives our next generation of premium energy storage products in use on all continents and in all climate zones. Today, we power businesses, optimize energy usage, and reduce carbon dioxide emissions to create a cleaner future in energy.
 



  





 We look forward to receiving your application!
 



  





**Building a Sustainable Future Together** 




 We are a Swedish company dedicated to providing the best-performing, safe, and sustainable energy storage solutions built on lithium-ion technology. Today, our market-leading solutions are in use on all continents and in all climate zones. We ensure that the flow of energy never stops, while enabling our customers to reduce their energy costs and carbon footprint.
 



  





 Do you share our vision for a smart and sustainable future? Join our team!

title: Solution Specialist till e-ID teamet
description:
Beskrivning av tjänsten
   

  

 Visste du att CGI levererar viktiga tjänster som utgör ryggraden i Sveriges digitala ekosystem med legitimationslösningar som BankID, Freja eID, eIDAS, Telia och SITHS! Med över 30 miljoner e-ID transaktioner per månad är vi marknadsledande i Sverige.
   

  

 Vi söker nu en Solution Specialist till vårt teknikteam för eID som idag består av fem medarbetare. Vi vidareutvecklar vår eID-tjänst kontinuerligt och vi anpassar den både avseende legala krav och utefter marknadsmässiga önskemål. Dessutom utvecklas tjänsten också utifrån alla goda idéer som kommer från våra medarbetare!
   

  

 Placeringsort: Stockholm, Örebro, Sundsvall , Malmö eller Östersund
   

  

 Dina framtida arbetsuppgifter
   

  

 I den här rollen får du möjligheten att forma en teknisk framtid och ständigt höja ribban för våra tjänster. Varje dag är en chans att inte bara hantera den dagliga driften och finjustera vår infrastruktur, utan även att vara arkitekten bakom kontinuerlig innovation och vidareutveckling av vår tjänst.
   

  

 I din roll som specialist kommer du att möta utmaningar i form av tekniska frågor och förfrågningar från kunder. Det innebär bland annat att öppna dörrar till kreativa lösningar för kunder både i text och genom möten.
   

  

 Att vara en del av våra affärsprojekt innebär att delta i och vara en katalysator för förändring. Det innebär även att arbeta sida vid sida med kompetenta kollegor inom utveckling och affärsprojektledning där vi tar fram underlag till anbud eller förfrågningar som innebär förändring.
   

  

 I denna roll får du stort eget ansvar och möjlighet att ta egna initiativ. Du kommer att arbeta med att förstå och lösa komplexa utmaningar, där din analytiska förmåga blir avgörande. En viktig del av ditt arbete är att dokumentera och beskriva förändringar på ett tydligt och noggrant sätt, vilket gör att din erfarenhet av dokumentation och ditt öga för detaljer kommer väl till pass.
   

  

 Du kommer också att bidra aktivt i samarbetet med kollegor, där du utmanar och inspirerar till nya lösningar. Din struktur och självgående arbetssätt hjälper dig att hantera flera uppgifter samtidigt och driva ditt arbete framåt med engagemang.
   

  

 Kvalifikationer för att bli framgångsrik denna roll
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har en teknisk bredd då arbetsuppgifterna kommer att spänna över ett brett spektrum. Vi har idag en fin gemenskap i teamet och lägger därför stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper så som, god kommunikationsförmåga, engagemang och problemlösningsförmåga.
   

  

 Vi ser gärna att du har:
   

  

* Relevant utbildning med inriktning mot IT eller motsvarande arbetslivserfarenhet
* Teknisk kommunikation/nätverkskunskap
* Goda kunskaper i Linux
* Grundläggande kunskaper i PKI
* Tidigare erfarenhet av stark autentisering
* Svenska och engelska i tal och skrift


**För den här tjänsten är svenskt medborgarskap ett krav.**
 Meriterande är erfarenhet inom något eller några av följande områden:
   

  

* Hantering av databaser, framför allt PostgreSQL och MongoDB
* Kunskap inom Containermiljöer, speciellt Docker
* Webb-portaler och kundkommunikation
* Minst ett script-/programmeringsspråk, särskilt Bash, Perl, Python eller Java
* Kunskap kring PTS, DIGG:s och eIDAS uppdrag kring eLegitimationer
* Erfarenhet av ledarskap
* Erfaranhet av lösningsarkitekt inom SAML/OIDC


**Vill du veta mer?**
 Vill du vara med och ta fram nästa generations e-legitimationslösningar? Då ska du söka den här tjänsten! Om du har några frågor eller funderingar kontakta gärna Patrik Kosowski, Manager Consuling Delivery via mail patrik.kosowski@cgi.com
   

  

 Mer information om eID-tjänsten hittar du här:
   

  

 https://www.cgi.com/se/sv/business-process-services/elektronisk-identifiering-och-underskrift/e-id-och-e-legitimation
   

  

**Mer information om våra förmåner:**
* Aktieprogram och delägarskap: Som delägare har du möjlighet att påverka och i vårt aktieprogram matchar CGI ditt bidrag, krona för krona upp till 3% av din månadslön.
* Friskvårdsbidrag: Vi erbjuder ett årligt friskvårdsbidrag på 4 000 kr.
* Föräldralön: Vi betalar upp till cirka 90% av din lön under den första tiden hemma.
* Trygg anställning: Våra konsulter anställs med kollektivavtal och försäkringar.
* Pensionslösningar: Vi erbjuder attraktiva och förmånliga pensionslösningar.
* Personalbil: Personalbilen används som en privatbil men leasas av CGI.


**Låt oss som ägare omvandla verklig insikt till handling – tillsammans.**
 Livet på CGI bygger på ägande, lagarbete, respekt och tillhörighet. Tillsammans med oss kommer du att kunna nå din fulla potential.
   

  

 Du är inbjuden att ta ägandeskap redan från första dagen i vårt arbete med att förverkliga vår dröm om att skapa en arbetsmiljö där vi trivs med att arbeta tillsammans och bidrar till framgången för vårt företag. Det är därför vi kallar oss CGI Partners snarare än anställda. Vi drar nytta av vår kollektiva framgång och tillsammans får vi möjlighet att aktivt forma vår företagsstrategi och inriktning.
   

  

 Ditt arbete skapar värde. Du kommer att vara med att utveckla innovativa lösningar och bygga relationer med medarbetare och kunder samtidigt som du får tillgång till globala möjligheter att skala upp dina idéer, omfamna nya möjligheter och dra nytta av gedigen bransch- och teknikexpertis.
   

  

 Du kommer att forma din karriär tillsammans med ett företag som är byggt för att växa och bestå. Du får stöd av ledare som bryr sig om din hälsa och ditt välbefinnande och ger dig möjligheter att fördjupa dina kunskaper och vidga dina vyer.
   

  

 Bli en del en av världens största leverantörer av IT- och affärskonsulttjänster.

title: Hybrid Account Director - Talent Solutions, Nordics
description:
**Company Description**
 LinkedIn is the world’s largest professional network, built to create economic opportunity for every member of the global workforce. Our products help people make powerful connections, discover exciting opportunities, build necessary skills, and gain valuable insights every day. We’re also committed to providing transformational opportunities for our own employees by investing in their growth. We aspire to create a culture that’s built on trust, care, inclusion, and fun – where everyone can succeed.
   

  

 Join us to transform the way the world works.
   

  

**Job Description**
 This role will be based in Stockholm
   

  

 At LinkedIn, our approach to flexible work is centered on trust and optimized for culture, connection, clarity, and the evolving needs of our business.
 *The work location of this role is hybrid, meaning it will be performed both from home and from a LinkedIn office on select days, as determined by the business needs of the team*
 We are looking for an Hybrid Account Director to join our team and generate new opportunities and handle current strategic customers within the Academic and Government Sector. You will have proven experience selling complex solutions directly or with partners to Academic and Government Sector in the Nordic Region. You will be responsible for responding to inbound inquiries as well as generating your own leads through outbound activity. You will strategically approach municipalities, local governments, health care and higher education institutions to build solutions helping them hire the best candidates in a cost-effective and time-efficient way. Although you strive to meet and exceed quota, you will always act in the best interest of the client.
   

  

**Responsibilities** 
 :
   

  

* Manage multiple complex sales processes simultaneously
* Generate new opportunities within the Academic and Government Sector, both directly and through partners
* Articulate LinkedIn Talent Solutions value proposition to senior leaders within the public sector
* Prospect relentlessly to build pipeline and build strong personal relationships with prospects
* Create reliable forecasts and be completely transparent with management on the pipeline status
* Close new business consistently at or above quota level
* Close renewals of your existing customers
* Develop and execute on a strategic plan for the territory and document and distribute competitive information
* Invest in colleagues and give coaching and advice when you see an opportunity for improvement
* Work to develop and circulate the set of best practices that will be the foundation of this team
* Listen to the needs of the market and share insights with product and marketing teams
* Be proactive about solving problems even if it’s outside of your area and be ready to take on additional initiatives and responsibilities as they emerge
* Seek out opportunities to be a leader and do everything you can to help the company achieve its larger objectives


**Qualifications**
**Basic Qualifications** 
 :
   

  

* 5+ years of applicable closing sales experience
* Fluency in Swedish and English


**Preferred Qualifications** 
 :
   

  

* Fluency in Finnish, Norwegian, or Danish
* Knowledge and experience in managing a highly complex sales process
* Experience selling to the Academic and Government Sector, both directly and through partners
* Executive presence and business acumen
* Experience selling SaaS solutions
* Knowledge of software contract terms and conditions with the ability to create fair transactions
* Demonstrated negotiation and accurate forecasting skills
* Ability to find, manage and close high-level business in an evangelist sales environment
* Ability to assess business opportunities and use data to inform decision making and persuade others
* Ability to manage a large number of prospect situations simultaneously while positioning company products against direct and indirect competitors


**Suggested Skills:** 

  

  

* Analytical Skills
* Forecasting
* Negotiation


**Additional Information**
**Global Data Privacy Notice for Job Candidates**
 Please follow this link to access the document that provides transparency around the way in which LinkedIn handles personal data of employees and job applicants: https://legal.linkedin.com/candidate-portal.

title: Volkswagen Finans Sverige AB söker en Business & Data Analyst
description:
Hos oss på Volkswagen Finans Sverige AB händer det grejer– inte minst inom vår Fleetverksamhet!
   

  

 Som
 **Business & Data Analyst** 
 inom Volkswagen Finans Sverige får du en stimulerande utmaning där du ansvarar för affärsanalys och datakvalitet. Arbetet bedrivs i nära samverkan med försäljningsteamet, affärsutvecklare och marknadskoordinator.
   

  

 Tjänsten är en heltidstjänst på vårt huvudkontor i Södertälje, endast 30 minuter från Stockholm. Som anställd hos oss kan vi utöver ett engagerande arbete med goda utvecklingsmöjligheter erbjuda dig ett antal generösa anställningsförmåner som exempelvis prestationsbonus, personalbil och friskvårdsbidrag. Hos oss har du har du möjlighet till ett flexibelt arbetssätt genom att kombinera arbete på distans med arbete i våra nyrenoverade lokaler.
   

  

**I rollen ingår följande:**
* Ansvar för datakvalitet i bilkonfiguratorn Fleet CC (läs mer om Fleet CC nedan)
* Delaktig vid karvställning av ny och befintlig funktionalitet i samband med utveckling av bilkonfiguratorn Fleet CC
* Ansvara för månadsrapportering av bl.a. säljprovisioner, internationella företagsaffärer, försäkringsrapporter och säljinformation etc.
* Vid behov assistera vid framtagande av verksamhetspresentationer
* Uppdatera säljfokuserad data och distribuera i organisationen
* Förvaltning av systemkopplingar relaterat till bonus och incitament för ÅF
* Stötta Försäljningschef vid uppdateringar av fleet support ramavtal
* Underhålla och upprätta relevanta rapporter i Sales Force och Power BI
* Stötta Fleet ledning och avdelningen med att ta fram underlag och analyser avseende Fleet-affären.


 Fleet CC är ett centralt kundverktyg inom Fleet Support. Verktyget ger kunderna möjlighet att bygga bilar i en online-konfigurator som täcker stora delar av den svenska bilmarknaden. Även märken utanför Volkswagen Group. Systemet är byggt på en komplex grund och kräver förståelse i hur data samlas in och presenteras på ett lättförståeligt vis. Programmeringskunskaper är dock ej nödvändiga.
   

  

 Vi ser att du har god erfarenhet av arbete med analysverktyg samt att du är en van användare av Excel och PowerPoint. Du bör ha god förståelse för finansiella processer och data. Du har hög uppmärksamhet för detaljer och kan leverera inom snäva tidsramar och deadlines. Du är också en analytisk och strategisk tänkare, samt har hög kommersiell insikt att fatta beslut både från data och ett sunt omdöme. Du har utmärkt kommunikationsförmåga, både skriftligt och muntligt.
   

  

 Organisatoriskt tillhör du funktionen Fleet Sales & Business Development. Teamet utgörs av 11 personer där du rapporterar till Head of Fleet Sales & Business Development. Det är viktigt att bygga en stark relation med de närmaste medarbetarna inom avdelningen.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har relevant högskoleutbildning. Du har goda språkkunskaper i engelska vilket är ett krav. Erfarenhet efter avslutad högeskoleutbildning är inte ett krav men ett par års erfarenhet kan vara meriterande. Avslutningsvis trivs du i en leveransfokuserad miljö.
   

  

**Ansökan och kontakt**
 Vill du veta mer om tjänsten är du välkommen att ringa rekryterande chef
 *Edward Kairenius, Head of Fleet Sales & Business Development -* 
 kontaktuppgifter nedan.
   

  

**Låter detta intressant? Tveka inte att söka redan idag!**
 Besök vår hemsida för mer information om oss som företag samt hur vi hanterar dina personuppgifter i rekryteringsförfarandet. Vi undanber oss kontakt med säljare från bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag.

title: Styrelse - till nytt fackförbund
description:
Cham Consulting AB rekryterar för kunds räkning.
 



  





**Plattformsarbetstagarnas Förbund söker styrelsemedlemmar** 




  





 Vi söker nu en engagerad styrelse på totalt fyra personer: en ordförande och tre styrelseledamöter.
 



  





 Är du en engagerad person med praktisk erfarenhet från plattformsarbete, giggjobb, konsultarbete eller tidsbegränsade arbeten? Vill du vara med och skapa ett nytt fackförbund som fokuserar på att stärka rättigheter, friheter och arbetsvillkor för Sveriges plattformsarbetstagare? Då kan det här vara din chans att göra skillnad!
 



  





 Plattformsarbetstagarnas Förbund är ett initiativ för att skapa trygga, fria och rättvisa arbetsvillkor för människor som arbetar som plattformsarbetstagare. Målet är att fastställa arbetsvillkoren i ett kollektivavtal, utveckla det systematiska arbetsmiljöarbetet och säkerställa plattformsarbetstagares rättigheter till att få del av socialförsäkringarna samt ta fram attraktiva medlemserbjudanden.
 



  





**Styrelsens och ombudsmannens uppdrag:** 




 Som en del av styrelsen får du chansen att påverka arbetsmarknaden och stärka villkoren för plattformsarbetstagare. Uppdraget omfattar bland annat:
 


* **Genomföra förbundets beslutade handlingsprogram:** 
  Inleda och genomföra en process för att för att ta fram ett handlingsprogram där ett centralt mål är att fastställa trygga och fria arbetsvillkor i ett kollektivavtal.
* **Samarbeta med andra aktörer:** 
  Bygga relationer med arbetsgivare tillika plattformsarbetsgivare,, politiker och andra fackförbund för att driva förbundets frågor och påverka beslut på arbetsmarknaden.
* **Utveckla förbundet:** 
  Skapa attraktiva medlemserbjudanden, driva medlemsrekrytering och erbjuda utbildningar för medlemmar.
* **Fokusera på arbetsmiljö och trygghet:** 
  Driva systematiskt arbetsmiljöarbete och sociala skyddsnät för medlemmarna.



  





**De olika rollerna** 




 Du kan bli antingen ordförande eller styrelseledamot. I din ansökan kan du ange vilken av rollerna du är mest intresserad av (ordförande eller styrelseledamot) och hur din bakgrund matchar detta uppdrag eller så låter du oss avgöra vilken roll som passar dig bäst baserat på din bakgrund och erfarenhet.
 



  





**Ordförande:** 
  Som ordförande leder du styrelsens arbete, representerar förbundet externt och har en nyckelroll i att driva strategiska och operativa frågor framåt. Du ansvarar för att arbetet följer förbundets vision, handlingsprogram och stadgar.
 



**Styrelseledamöter:** 
 Som styrelseledamot bidrar du med din praktiska erfarenhet från plattformsarbete, giggjobb, konsultarbete eller tidsbegränsade uppdrag. Dina insatser är viktiga både i det strategiska och operativa arbetet. Vi ser gärna att du har kunskap inom områden som arbetsrätt, medlemsrekrytering eller specifika branscher.
 



  





**Vilka söker vi?** 




 Vi söker personer som:
 


* Har erfarenhet av plattformsarbete, giggjobb, konsultarbete eller tidsbegränsade arbeten. exempelvis inom last mile delivery, media, IT eller andra branscher där tidsbegränsade uppdrag är vanliga.
* Är samhällsintresserade, drivna och engagerade i att skapa förändring.
* Är kommunikativa och bekväma med att föra sin talan i till exempel paneler, debatter eller media.
* Har en stark kommunikativ förmåga och kan arbeta både självständigt och i team.
* Kan balansera idealism med pragmatism.



 Tidigare styrelseerfarenhet och kunskap inom arbetsrätt är meriterande, men inte ett krav.
 



  





**Ersättning och placering:** 




**Ordförande eller styrelseledamot:** 
  Styrelsearvode.
 



**Placering och arbetstid:** 
  Flexibelt, huvudsaklig förläggning under ordinarie kontorstider. Vi ser gärna att du bor i Stockholmsområdet eller har möjlighet att resa dit vid behov.
 



  





**Varför ska du söka?** 




 Var med från start och skapa något nytt och betydelsefullt. Du får chansen att påverka arbetsmarknaden för en växande grupp arbetstagare och förbättra deras villkor.

title: Sr. Solutions Architect Enterprise
description:
**Description**
 Are you passionate about cloud technology and helping customers innovate?
   

  

 Join our AWS Solutions Architecture team in Sweden and empower large enterprises across industries to innovate at speed and scale with cloud technologies.
   

  

 Solutions Architects work hand in hand with AWS customers to help them make the most of the Cloud. They are at the crossroads of business and technology and engage with organizations at all stages of cloud adoption. Solutions Architects are responsible for creating and presenting technical content and sharing best practices.
   

  

 They work to understand the customer's business needs and give prescriptive guidance on how to create business value with technology. They help customer's validate their initiatives from ideation to proof of concept. Solutions Architects lead activities such as architecture reviews, white-boarding sessions, demos and technical workshops. They collaborate with other teams such as account management, professional services, Industry experts, support, service teams and the AWS partner ecosystem.
   

  

 Amongst others you will be part of design and building reference architectures, proof of concepts and deploy production workloads on AWS. Provide thought leadership and recommendations on cloud architecture, migration, modernization and operation. Build strong technical relationships acting as the voice of the customer internally to influence AWS service roadmaps.
   

  

 Come build the future with us.
   

  

 AWS Sales, Marketing, and Global Services (SMGS) is responsible for driving revenue, adoption, and growth from the largest and fastest growing small- and mid-market accounts to enterprise-level customers including public sector. The AWS Global Support team interacts with leading companies and believes that world-class support is critical to customer success. AWS Support also partners with a global list of customers that are building mission-critical applications on top of AWS services.
   

  

**About The Team**
 The Solutions Architecture team is a diverse group of technologists from a variety of backgrounds. Practical knowledge of the AWS platform is desired but not required, provided you have a sound technical foundation and a desire to learn. You will have the support to grow your expertise. Every day you will learn something new from your customers, your peers and your own experiments. At AWS you will be encouraged and rewarded for doing what is right for the long-term success of the customer. We value your passion to discover, invent and build on behalf of customers.
   

  

 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS?
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
   

  

 Mentorship & Career Growth
   

  

 We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why flexible work hours and arrangements are part of our culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* Background in Cloud Architecture, Systems Design, Software Development, Infrastructure Architecture, Data Engineering or DevOps across industries.
* Technical Degree (Computer Science, Maths, Engineering or equivalent) and/or relevant tech experience
* Experience in managing complex sales processes with both technical and non-technical stakeholders
* Demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, product and technical challenges
* English business level communication skills written and verbal


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Prior domain experience in enterprise cloud adoption and operating production workloads on AWS
* Knowledge of cloud native design patterns, DevOps practices and AWS services
* Experience with or understanding of common enterprise regulations, security and compliance standards
* Public speaking experience or passion for creating technical content


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

 Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.
   

  

  

**Company** 
 - AWS EMEA SARL (Sweden Branch)
   

  

 Job ID: A2902217

title: Senior Accountant
description:
Are you excited about accounting and passionate about leveraging digital innovation and automation? Join Instabridge—a fast-growing tech company, with over 10 million monthly users, on a mission to provide free internet access to everyone.
 



  





**Why You’ll Love It Here** 



* **High-Impact Projects** 
 : Drive our transition from K3 to IFRS, ensure global compliance, and help lead our finance department toward non-touch accounting through AI and automation.
* **Meaningful Mission** 
 : Work at the forefront of democratizing internet access for millions worldwide, contributing directly to our vision of a free global internet.
* **Fast Growth & Stability** 
 : We’re profitable, growing quickly, and set to exceed SEK +300m in revenue for 2024—over 5x last year’s earnings.



  





**What You’ll Do** 



* **Manage Daily Accounting** 
 : Oversee bookkeeping, VAT reporting, and month-end close processes as we expand our global footprint.
* **Improve & Automate** 
 : Collaborate with our small, dynamic team to streamline accounting workflows using AI and modern digital tools.
* **Ensure Accuracy & Compliance** 
 : Keep a keen eye on relevant laws and reporting needs, meeting deadlines without sacrificing precision.



  





**Who You Are** 



* **Experienced & Independent** 
 : You’ve got at least 2–3 years of accounting experience and can confidently handle month-end close and VAT reporting.
* **Detail-Oriented** 
 : You plan your work meticulously, maintaining high accuracy and meeting tight deadlines.
* **(Bonus) IFRS & Automation** 
 : Experience with IFRS, international VAT, and digital automation tools is a major plus.
* **(Bonus) Exceptional Achievements** 
 : We love hearing about standout accomplishments—sports, hobbies, or other personal feats.



  





**Your challenge** 



* **Our vision of “non-touch” accounting:** 
 At Instabridge, we strive for a forward-thinking approach to accounting, built on the belief that AI and automation are rapidly reshaping how we work. Our vision is rooted in the “non-touch” accounting model, where technology takes center stage in streamlining and optimizing processes. This aligns with our company-wide KPI measured as million dollar in annual revenue per employee (currently at 1.6m)
* **Build your accounting skills for the future** 
 : As our new Senior Accountant, we hope you’ll bring a curious and innovative mindset, eager to explore fresh opportunities for process. The way we approach accounting today will change in the next one to three years, and we are committed to staying ahead of the curve. Together, let’s lead the change in automation.



  





**What We Offer** 



* **Competitive Compensation** 
 : Including a yearly bonus of 1–2 months’ salary if company targets are met.
* **Flexibility & Work-Life Balance** 
 : Choose to work from home or our office (or both).
* **Health & Wellness** 
 : Access to an on-site gym, wellness allowance, and daily breakfast in the office.
* **Retirement & Security** 
 : Pension according to ITP1, giving you peace of mind for the future.
* **Positive Culture** 
 : Our team values a supportive, friendly atmosphere where everyone can thrive and have fun.



  





**Ready to Take the Next Step?** 




 We’re actively recruiting and will get back to you within five days of your application. Click “Easy Apply” now and start your journey at Instabridge—where your accounting expertise will help deliver free internet to the world!

title: Director, Consult Partner--Application Services
job_function: Sales, Business Development, and Customer Service
description:
**Who We Are**
 At Kyndryl, we design, build, manage and modernize the mission-critical technology systems that the world depends on every day. So why work at Kyndryl? We are always moving forward – always pushing ourselves to go further in our efforts to build a more equitable, inclusive world for our employees, our customers and our communities.
   

  

**The Role**
 Kyndryl Consult is the fastest growing business within the organization and instrumental to the company’s strategic growth objectives. You will play a key leadership role across multi-disciplinary teams, guiding them through complex consulting engagements and be responsible for creating and positioning strategic change agendas within Kyndryl's largest accounts across the C-suite, spanning the intersection between complex Business and IT customer solutions, transformations that impact across the entire customer Eco-system.
   

  

 As a Consult Partner, you will have a pivotal role in driving profitable growth, leveraging our comprehensive capabilities to build strong client relationships, and leading your team to success. This role demands a strong presence, industry expertise, and the ability to cultivate relationships with CXO-level clients. Your leadership will be critical in fostering talent development and innovation within the organization.
   

  

 This role will also be leading the overall client engagement and delivering high quality client work alongside senior client stakeholders. Working in a transaction environment which may be pre or post deal, planning post deal implementation, and ultimately supporting execution. Partners will be focused on financial impact, utilization and contribution, client impact and leadership.
   

  

 Contribute to Profitable Growth:
   

  

* Drive significant financial outcomes through signings and revenue targets
* Ensure sustained growth and profitability, managing margin expectations and backlog growth
* Support the identification, pursuit and conversion of a pipeline of business development opportunities
* Undertake scoping and fee negotiation on engagements, while enduring profitability and understanding and containing risk


 Client Engagement:
   

  

* Build and maintain deep relationships with client CXOs and be seen as the 'go to' person and a trusted advisor by senior executives
* Leading C-level client interactions and consulting initiatives, deliverables and outputs of a deal engagement
* Demonstrate credibility and experience to advise and deliver on complex consulting engagement
* Enhance client satisfaction, as measured by Net Promoter Score (NPS) and new relationship development; Secure client references


 Operational Excellence:
   

  

* Achieve individual and team utilization targets
* Lead the design of complex engagements and take responsibility for oversight of delivery, ensuring high performance and customer satisfaction


 Leadership, Management, People
   

  

* Lead by example; Fostering a culture of continuous personal and professional development and challenging our people to be curious and innovative and supportive for each other. At the same time ensuring that all outcomes are commercially focused, value adding and effectively executed


 Strategic Contribution:
   

  

* Utilize industry and technology expertise to shape and drive the company’s strategic initiatives.
* Align with Kyndryl’s strategic vision and contribute to its execution.
* Drive external eminence and innovation, establishing a strong personal and organizational brand in the industry.
* Proactively develop thought leadership and intellectual capital


**Who You Are**
 Who You Are
   

  

 You’re good at what you do and possess the required experience to prove it. However, equally as important – you have a growth mindset; keen to drive your own personal and professional development. You are customer-focused – someone who prioritizes customer success in their work. And finally, you’re open and borderless – naturally inclusive in how you work with others.
   

  

**Required Skills And Experience**
* 15+ years of experience in IT consulting and Sales, with focus on application services
* Extensive experience in client engagement and relationship management at the CXO level
* Demonstrable ability to build and commercialize relationships with senior executives
* Proven track record of leading and executing complex projects with multi-disciplinary teams in a consulting, corporate or public sector environment
* Effective financial acumen with experience in driving revenue growth and managing margins
* Experience of managing or supporting high-value business development activities with senior stakeholders
* Deep understanding of industry trends and technology
* Sound personal brand and presence in the industry
* Demonstrated ability to innovate and drive change
* Industry experience in Retail & Industrial Sectors
* Proven track record in pre-sales activities and solution design for large-scale Application Services engagements


**Preferred Skills and Experience:**
* Bachelor's degree or Master’s degree
* Sales experience in technical solutions


**Being You**
 Diversity is a whole lot more than what we look like or where we come from, it’s how we think and who we are. We welcome people of all cultures, backgrounds, and experiences. But we’re not doing it single-handily: Our Kyndryl Inclusion Networks are only one of many ways we create a workplace where all Kyndryls can find and provide support and advice. This dedication to welcoming everyone into our company means that Kyndryl gives you – and everyone next to you – the ability to bring your whole self to work, individually and collectively, and support the activation of our equitable culture. That’s the Kyndryl Way.
   

  

**What You Can Expect**
 With state-of-the-art resources and Fortune 100 clients, every day is an opportunity to innovate, build new capabilities, new relationships, new processes, and new value. Kyndryl cares about your well-being and prides itself on offering benefits that give you choice, reflect the diversity of our employees and support you and your family through the moments that matter – wherever you are in your life journey. Our employee learning programs give you access to the best learning in the industry to receive certifications, including Microsoft, Google, Amazon, Skillsoft, and many more. Through our company-wide volunteering and giving platform, you can donate, start fundraisers, volunteer, and search over 2 million non-profit organizations. At Kyndryl, we invest heavily in you, we want you to succeed so that together, we will all succeed.
   

  

**Get Referred!**
 If you know someone that works at Kyndryl, when asked ‘How Did You Hear About Us’ during the application process, select ‘Employee Referral’ and enter your contact's Kyndryl email address.

title: CyberArk IT Security Senior Consultant
description:
Locations
   

 Warsaw (PL) or Malmo (SE) or Stockholm (SE) or Gothenburg (SE) or Oslo (NO) or Helsinki (FI) or Tampere (FI) or Lodz (PL) or Cracow (PL) or Copenhagen (DK)
   

  

 Remote
   

 75%
   

 Assignment period
   

 03 Mar 2025
   

 30 Jun 2025
   

  

 Assignment description
   

 For our client we are looking for CyberArk IT Security Senior Consultant.
   

  

 ﻿
   

  

 Description:
   

  

 Full scope on-boarding of applications and platforms to our CyberArk solution which includes building custom connection components and password managers.
   

  

 ﻿
   

  

 Description of knowledge and experience:
   

  

 Several years of proven experience working PAM solutions, preferably with CyberArk
   

 Knowledge of identity security best practices, for both on-premise and cloud environments
   

 Knowledge of fundamental security approaches and principles (such as SoD, Least Privilege, Zero Trust)
   

 Previous experience working in a DevOps team in Agile/Scrum setup
   

 Understanding of IT processes and system development life cycle
   

 Familiarity with Cyber Security controls and frameworks (such as CIS, COBIT, NIST, ISO 2700x)
   

 Great collaboration and negotiation skills for working with various stakeholders within company
   

 Strong technical analytical and documentation skills
   

 A structured and organised way of working with the ability to deliver results with high quality
   

 The ability to do conversion between business and technical context
   

 A strong can-do attitude and self-driven approach
   

 Fluency in English (spoken and written)
   

  

  

 Required skills
   

 SOD
   

 Stakeholder Management
   

 Least Privilege
   

 ZeroTrust
   

 Cyber Security controls and frameworks
   

 CyberArk
   

 Languages
   

 English
   

 (Proficient)

title: Enterprise Account Director (Staffing Sector) - Talent Solutions, Nordics
description:
**Company Description**
 LinkedIn is the world’s largest professional network, built to create economic opportunity for every member of the global workforce. Our products help people make powerful connections, discover exciting opportunities, build necessary skills, and gain valuable insights every day. We’re also committed to providing transformational opportunities for our own employees by investing in their growth. We aspire to create a culture that’s built on trust, care, inclusion, and fun – where everyone can succeed.
   

  

 Join us to transform the way the world works.
   

  

**Job Description**
 This role will be based in Stockholm
   

  

 At LinkedIn, our approach to flexible work is centered on trust and optimized for culture, connection, clarity, and the evolving needs of our business.
 *The work location of this role is hybrid, meaning it will be performed both from home and from a LinkedIn office on select days, as determined by the business needs of the team*
 We are looking for an Enterprise Account Director to join our team as a trusted advisor and partner to our customers in the Staffing/Recruitment industry. You will help them understand the financial value of our solutions, work with them to help measure that value, and build long-term relationships that secure ongoing revenue growth for both parties.
   

  

 Although you possess a strategic approach to selling and strive to meet/exceed revenue goals, you will always have your clients’ best interest in mind and act as their internal advocate to ensure they are set up for success.
   

  

**Responsibilities** 
 :
   

  

* Builds relationships with decision makers and stakeholders across a dedicated customer base
* Drives customer decision making by achieving shared vision and proactively considering the value props that tie all stakeholders together
* Drives Customer growth by proactively identifying opportunities to deliver greater customer value
* Researches Customer’s business and prepares thoughtful questions and insights in advance of customer meetings
* Asks layered, open-ended questions to understand and clarify Customer’s objectives and challenges beyond surface-level detail
* Shifts communication style and content to fit the needs of different stakeholders
* Leads with Solutions, not products, when making recommendations aligned to Customer objectives
* Sells with Integrity
* Thinks commercially and applies business acumen when crafting & negotiating commercial agreements
* Uses data and insights to support investment recommendations or overcome customer objections
* Proactively mitigates churn risk by adopting a smart, customer-centric approach
* Engages customers throughout to confirm and clarify value and adapts a strategy when needed to optimize ROI
* Applies business acumen in Account Planning by considering economic, industry, and company factors with a Customer-centric lens
* Maps all key stakeholders in an account to assess the strength of the account relationship and create account outreach strategy
* Agrees to joint accountability with colleagues and cross-functional teams for optimal customer success
* Practices humility and asks for help from colleagues when faced with a challenge or unknown
* Is disciplined in Territory and Account Planning, Forecasting, and Quota Attainment
* Follows best practices when using CRM and other Sales tools in order to manage the Sales and Buyer cycles


**Qualifications**
**Basic Qualifications** 
 :
   

  

* 5+ years of applicable closing sales experience
* Fluency in Swedish and English


**Preferred Qualifications** 
 :
   

  

* Fluency in Finnish, Norwegian, and/or Danish
* Knowledge and experience in managing a highly complex sales process
* Experience selling to the Staffing Sector, both directly and through partners
* Executive presence and business acumen
* Experience selling SaaS solutions
* Knowledge of software contract terms and conditions with the ability to create fair transactions
* Demonstrated negotiation and accurate forecasting skills
* Ability to find, manage and close high-level business in an evangelist sales environment
* Ability to assess business opportunities and use data to inform decision making and persuade others
* Ability to manage a large number of prospect situations simultaneously while positioning company products against direct and indirect competitors


**Suggested Skills:** 

  

  

* Analytical Skills
* Forecasting
* Negotiation


**Additional Information**
**Global Data Privacy Notice for Job Candidates**
 Please follow this link to access the document that provides transparency around the way in which LinkedIn handles personal data of employees and job applicants: https://legal.linkedin.com/candidate-portal.

title: Jr. Social Media Manager / Content Creator
description:
Are you ready to elevate a timeless Scandinavian brand and redefine what engaging social media looks like? This is your chance to join this renowned Swedish brand known for its elegant jewelry and watches, as they expand their online presence. With a focus on affordable luxury, sustainability, and empowering women, they’re looking for a passionate Junior Social Media Manager / Content Creator to join their growing team.
   

  

 If you’re creative, organized, and love experimenting with fresh ideas, this is the role for you. You’ll have the freedom to create content seen by thousands of customers worldwide while working in a collaborative and supportive environment.
   

  

**YOUR MISSION**
 To create engaging, high-quality content for the brand’s social media channels and support the execution of their social media strategy. You’ll help grow their Instagram, TikTok, Pinterest, and other platforms by producing visuals, videos, and copy that resonate with their audience.
   

  

***This is a full-time role with flexible working hours and the option to work hybrid from their Stockholm office.***
**What’s In It For You**
* Creative Freedom: Experiment with new ideas and grow in your role while working with a growing Scandinavian brand
* Growth Opportunities: Opportunities for personal and professional development in a supportive work environment
* Flexibility: Enjoy hybrid/remote work options and flexible working hours
* Team Spirit: Join a collaborative team that encourages innovation and new ideas
* Exclusive Experiences: Continue to expand your network by working with different celebrities and influencers, and attending high-profile events


**What You’re Getting Into**
* Manage and grow the brand’s social media presence by overseeing Instagram, TikTok, Pinterest, and Facebook accounts, ensuring consistent posting schedules, and engaging with the community to foster brand loyalty
* Optimize content performance by tracking social media metrics, analyzing engagement data, and refining strategies to increase reach and audience interaction
* Produce high-quality, on-brand content including photos, videos, and written copy that showcases the brand’s products and values, driving engagement and brand awareness
* Create compelling short-form video content (Reels, TikToks) and assist in product photoshoots to highlight the brand’s lifestyle appeal and attract new followers
* Support campaigns and product launches by developing social-first content that aligns with seasonal promotions and marketing goals, ensuring cohesive messaging across platforms
* Collaborate with content creators by preparing briefs, negotiating partnerships, and managing deliverables to amplify the brand’s reach and credibility
* Stay ahead of social media trends by researching and implementing new content formats, creative campaigns, and best practices to keep content fresh and relevant


**Who You Are**
* Experience: At least 1 year of experience in social media management or content creation (internships or freelance work count!).
* Skills: Strong organizational skills, excellent communication, and a knack for creative problem-solving.
* Mindset: Entrepreneurial, detail-oriented, and self-motivated with a passion for fashion, lifestyle, and social media trends.
* Languages: Fluent in Swedish and English, with exceptional writing and speaking abilities.
* Tools: Proficient with photo and video editing tools (e.g., Adobe Photoshop, Lightroom, Premiere Pro, Canva) and a solid understanding of social media analytics.


**What Success Looks Like**
* 30 Days: You’ve familiarized yourself with the brand voice, social media strategy, and content creation processes
* 60 Days: You’re independently creating and scheduling content, engaging with the community, and contributing fresh ideas for campaigns
* 90 Days: You’ve built a strong understanding of the brand’s audience, optimized content performance, and established yourself as a key player in their social media growth


**READY TO BE PART OF SOMETHING EXTRAORDINARY?**
 If you’re passionate about social media, fashion, and lifestyle, and thrive in a culture of creativity and innovation, apply now and join the brand as they take their online presence to the next level.

title: Head of Remote Radios
description:
Join our Team
   

  

**About this opportunity:**
 We are now looking for the next Head of Remote Radios to join Product Line Radio. As Head of Remote Radios, you report to Head of Product Line Radio, is part of the unit’s leadership team, and have Profit & Loss as well strategic responsibility for one of Ericsson’s key segments.
   

  

 In this role you are responsible for segment’s business plan, strategy definition, execution, and life cycle management and will be an ambassador for Ericsson’s Radio Portfolio – both internally and externally towards customers and market areas. The task is to continuously exceed the expectations from the market, while at the same time considering dependencies and prioritizations within Ericsson. This is a highly demanding position and to succeed you should be inspired by high pace, rapidly changing conditions and navigating complex organizational environments.
   

  

 This is a Line Manager Position with 11 direct reports. It is based in Kista, Sweden. As you will be operating in a highly complex environment, strong and proven leadership skills & experience is a requirement.
   

  

**What you will do:**
 Be a strong and experienced leader. You will be managing a team of experienced Strategic Product Managers (SPMs) and interface multiple organizations on their behalf. Coaching and growing talents will be one of the key responsibilities.
   

  

* Responsible for PLCM of the Remote Radio product portfolio End-to-End
* Responsible for the strategy definition and execution of the Remote Radio portfolio ensuring Ericsson’s long-term competitive positioning and to satisfy our customer’s needs.
* Owner of the Strategic Product Plan for the Remote Radios
* Remote Radio segment business plan including Cost of Sales
* Develop the business in accordance with current and future customers’ needs in line with Ericsson strategic goals.
* Owner of the alignment with Supply and Sourcing to ensure that the overall strategy is aligned with Ericsson goals.


**The skills you bring:**
* Strong leader with ability to attract and develop talent within the organization.
* 5+ year experience from product management/development environment.
* Deep understanding of the BNEW portfolio. Background in R&D, RAN project/program management, KAM CTO office.
* Excellent knowledge of the global telecom market and its transformation – especially RAN aspects.
* Good knowledge of RAN product requirements and how they are evolving with the market.
* Techno-commercial competence – which means strong technology /product knowledge married with excellent business acumen
* Excellent in formulating strategies and manage portfolio, defining long-term product roadmaps and translating these strategies into actions.
* Strong capability to manage high levels of complexity and difficult investment tradeoffs
* Strong influencing / negotiation skills, strategic thinking, and strong ability to lead others both direct & indirect
* You are strong in Business Acumen, Enabling People, Courageous Leadership, Uncompromising Integrity and Customer Excellence
* Challenger mindset - Business insight to customer value, Solution mindset - End to end function ownership
* Excellent communication and presentation skills.
* Understanding of R&D process and challenges.
* Energy, drive and commitment
* Experience as a leader in a product management/development environment.


**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden (SE) || Stockholm
   

  

**Req ID:** 
 758877
   

  

 ]]>

title: Senior Teknisk Projektledare
description:
**Vi växer och vill gärna ha in flera härliga kollegor som vill utvecklas och få möjligheten att jobba med oss!**
 Frontwalker är en växande IT-koncern med bred geografisk spridning i Sverige. Frontwalker Stockholm tillsammans med Frontwalker Group är idag 50+ anställda och vi finns på fem orter i landet. Hos oss hittar du vassa medarbetare inom systemutveckling, IT Management, kravanalys, test och mycket mer. Du blir en del av ett gäng där vi tillsammans arbetar för att driva och utveckla digitala affärer, mjukvara och människor.
   

  

 I rollen som Projektledare hos oss erbjuds du ett omväxlande, utmanande och kundnära arbete. Du kommer få en varierande arbetsdag hos någon av våra kunder och rollen kommer vara föränderlig beroende på uppdrag.
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 För att lyckas i den här rollen har du några års erfarenhet som projektledare inom IT med en tidigare bakgrund som systemutvecklare. Du har tidigare erfarenhet av konsultrollen, gärna medelstort bolag. Du har god förståelse för agil utvecklingsmetodik, exempelvis SAFe eller Scrum. Då många av våra kunder befinner sig inom den offentliga sektorn är det meriterande om du har erfarenhet av PM3, XLPM, eller annan projektstyrningsmodell. Du har god vana av att arbeta i Jira eller liknande. Erfarenhet som produktägare eller analys av krav är mycket meriterande.
   

  

 Du har en relevant examen från en högskole- eller universitetsutbildning. Du har en förmåga att samarbeta och kommunicera på både svenska och engelska.
   

  

 I denna rekrytering lägger vi stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper och söker dig som har en god problemlösningsförmåga och är flexibel. Du är kommunikativ och har lätt för att skapa förtroende. Som person delar du gärna med dig av dina kunskaper till andra och du är öppen för nya insikter och lärdomar.
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig**
* En inkluderande arbetsplats
* Work-life balance kultur
* Interna utvecklingsmöjligheter samt kompetensutveckling
* Marknadsmässig lön
* Bra förmåner i form av friskvård, försäkringar osv
* Flexibla arbetstider
* Sist men inte minst – att ha kul på jobbet


 Hos oss ingår du i en grupp med duktiga kollegor och du får möjlighet att arbeta i spännande projekt inom såväl olika myndigheter som inom det privata näringslivet.
   

  

 Vi har flera gemensamma aktiviteter och värdesätter att umgås med varandra, både för att utbyta kompetens men likaså att dela med oss av vår senaste kulturupplevelse. Vårt interna kontor ligger centralt beläget i Stockholm med bara någon minuts promenad från T-Centralen.
   

  

**Vill du vara en Frontwalker?**
 Vad väntar du på? Skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt då urval sker löpande. Vid frågor om rekryteringen är du välkommen att kontakta rekryteringsansvarige Carolina Gustavson på 073 505 42 34 eller mejla till rekrytering@frontwalker.se. Notera att vi inte tar emot några ansökningar via mail.
   

  

 Varmt välkommen att höra av dig!

title: Contract Manager
description:
At Iver, we make the same promise to our colleagues as we do to our customers. The promise is to always be “beside you”, “behind you” and “before you”. We call it “The Iver way”. We are now looking for a Contract Manager to join our growing team,
   

  

 who wants to be part of Iver and who wants to contribute to better IT solutions that make a difference for our customers! Are you our new colleague?
   

  

**About Iver**
 Iver is a leading Nordic full-service provider of cloud-based IT services with cutting-edge expertise in operations, cybersecurity, cloud and innovation. Our services are critical not only for our customers – but for the digitalization of society at large. Headquartered in Stockholm, Iver operates primarily in the Nordic region with an agenda to continue expanding. Iver has a turnover of just over SEK 3 billion and has approximately 1,500 employees working in one of our 25 offices in the Nordic region.
   

  

**Your Role**
 Iver is looking for a Contract Manager to join our growing team. In this key role, you will work closely with the sales and customer teams throughout both the pre- and post-signature phases, ensuring that our contracts are managed effectively and that all processes run smoothly.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Lead the implementation of contract lifecycle management processes across Iver.
* Oversee and guide the contract management activities for assigned accounts, ensuring a seamless execution of contract terms.
* Collaborate with delivery teams to support contract management tasks, including contract changes.
* Work with the legal team to resolve more complex matters.
* Provide training to key account teams on contract management processes and controls.


**Why join us?**
 Iver - We empower our Nordic society. At Iver you get the opportunity to work with the latest technology and be part of an exciting growth journey. At Iver we are inclusive and strive for genuine collaboration where we work towards common goals. Within Iver there are great opportunities for development and we stand behind you when you want to learn more - within your specialist area, leadership or new areas. At Iver you are also part of an ambitious and innovative company, which means that improving, testing, evaluating and daring to change how we do things are important ingredients and we are convinced that this is how we develop.
   

  

**Who are we looking for?**
 We believe that you have experience in commercial contract management, or similar roles, and preferably experience with IT outsourcing contracts. You have an ability to handle complex and high-pressure environments and prioritize tasks accordingly and you aim to drive impacts (vs. activities) and have a focused mindset.
   

  

**We Also Believe That You Have**
* Experience in cross-functional roles such as bid support, legal, sales or procurement.
* An education in business administration, law, finance or other relevant areas.
* Fluent in both Swedish and English.


**Desired Attributes**
* You are consistent and durable in a fast moving and at times unclear environment with multiple stakeholders.
* Curious, self-motivated, and committed to continuous learning.
* You have a strong ability to establish trustworthy relationships and collaborate with people at all levels within the organization.
* You believe in trust, openness and honesty and are not afraid to take the initiative.
* We believe you are analytical and have a problem-solving attitude with the capability to effectively handle complex tasks and priorities.
* A good understanding of what creates business value and have a supportive mindset.


**Location:**
 Iver has 25 offices around Sweden and Norway. For this position you will be based in our Headquartered in Solna.
   

  

**Join us!**
 Selection is ongoing, the position can be filled before the application deadline. Iver strives for an even gender distribution and values ethnic and cultural diversity. Desired start is as soon as possible or by agreement. Application deadline is 2025-02-28. You are welcome to contact recruiting manager, Selma Becirbegovic (selma.becirbegovic@iver.se) if you have any questions or concerns about the position.
   

  

**We empower our Nordic society** 
 . Iver är en ledande nordisk helhetsleverantör av molnbaserade IT-tjänster med spetskompetens inom drift, cybersäkerhet, cloud och innovation.
   

  

**Våra tjänster är kritiska inte bara för våra kunder – utan för digitaliseringen av samhället i stort.** 
 Vi säkerställer att sjukvården har tillgång till rätt patientdata, att samhällskritiska system aldrig ligger nere och att flygplanen landar säkert. Som en lyhörd och affärsnära helhetspartner möjliggör vi våra kunders innovation – idag och imorgon.

title: Sap Solutions Architect
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting, Business Consulting and Services, and Manufacturing
description:
We are seeking a highly experienced
 **Enterprise Architect** 
 specializing in
 **SAP** 
 within the
 **Manufacturing Domain** 
 . The ideal candidate will possess deep expertise in SAP architecture, a strong understanding of manufacturing business processes, and the ability to design and implement robust SAP solutions that align with organizational goals. This role requires over 20 years of experience and will be based in Sweden / EU with a hybrid work arrangement.
 



**Key Responsibilities:** 



* **Architectural Design:** 
 Develop and maintain the overall SAP architecture strategy for the manufacturing domain, ensuring alignment with business objectives and technology standards.
* **Solution Development:**
