title: Business Analyst
description:
*Are you capable of working with data and creating insights that inform important business decisions? Are you looking for a role where you can collaborate with a skilled team and shape decisions?*
 We’re looking for a
 **Business Analyst** 
 to join our Commercial team at GlobalConnect. In this role, you’ll analyze data, develop models, and create clear recommendations to support business strategies. You’ll work closely with Business Managers, Product Managers, and others to ensure our decisions are backed by actionable insights. Whether you’re reviewing trends, preparing reports, or delivering presentations, your input will direct the way we move forward as a company.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Business Analyst, your day-to-day work will focus on analyzing a large variety of data sets, developing financial models, and presenting your findings in a way that makes decision-making easier. You’ll be at the heart of our decision-making process, collaborating with a skilled team to guide key business strategies and initiatives.
   

  

 On a typical day, you might:
   

  

* Collaborate with Business Managers to turn data into insights that guide key decisions.
* Build financial models to simulate business scenarios and evaluate opportunities.
* Conduct market research and analyze trends to find new opportunities for growth.
* Use Power BI or similar tools to visualize and present data clearly and intelligibly.
* Deliver professional, persuasive presentations in PowerPoint, tailoring your insights for stakeholders at every level.


 This is a key
 **role** 
 where you’ll also need practical problem-solving skills to work through tasks like managing large datasets, ensuring models meet business needs, and navigating a shifting industry environment.
   

  

**To Be Proficient in This Role, You’ll Need:**
* Experience as a Business Analyst or in a similar analytical role such as management consultant—backgrounds in telecom, real estate, or other relevant industries are beneficial.
* Advanced analytical skills, with the ability to break down complex data, identify trends, and draw actionable conclusions using Excel (advanced level); experience with Power BI or similar tools is a plus.
* Notable presentation skills, with the ability to create clear and meaningful insights using PowerPoint or other storytelling methods.
* Fluency in both Swedish and English, written and spoken.


*You are collaborative, curious, and thrive in roles where you can turn data into real-world business decisions.*
**Why Join Us?**
 At GlobalConnect, we don’t just analyze data—we use it to support our decision-making. In your first 6–12 months, you’ll:
   

  

* Develop proficiency in our business models and analytical tools.
* Deliver insights that directly influence our strategies and decisions.
* Collaborate with a skilled team to refine and improve our analytical models.


 This is your chance to join a forward-thinking company where your work will generate meaningful results across the Nordics.
   

  

**Interested?**
 No personal letter is required unless you have something remarkable to share beyond your CV or LinkedIn profile. Apply now and let’s connect!

title: Juniora konsulter | Riskhantering
description:
Vill du starta din karriär på ett av världens ledande revisions- och rådgivningsföretag? På PwC motiveras vi av att använda vår uppfinningsförmåga, erfarenhet och den senaste tekniken för att skapa värde för våra kunder. Drivet finns hos alla som jobbar hos oss och tillsammans löser vi komplexa uppgifter, utvecklar företag och har en positiv påverkan på samhället. Om du har en positiv inställning, har vi tusentals möjligheter att bidra till en bättre morgondag.
   

  

**Bli en del av PwC:s riskhanteringsteam**
 Alla verksamheter, oavsett om de är privata, offentliga eller ideella, står inför olika risker. Som en del av PwC:s riskhanteringsteam inom Risk Assurance identifierar och stöttar du våra kunder att hantera risker inom affärsprocesser och IT-säkerhet. Du kommer att spela en central roll i att stödja företag och organisationer med att säkerställa effektiva styrnings- och kontrollsystem. Dina projekt kan variera från att kartlägga IT- och affärsprocesser till att granska och testa interna kontroller.
   

  

 Din arbetsdag är mångsidig; ibland fungerar du som rådgivare och ibland som en del av ett revisionsteam. Du arbetar alltid nära engagerade kollegor för att lösa komplexa uppgifter och hitta långsiktiga lösningar för våra kunder. Arbetet är varierande och sker ofta i team, med tid spenderad hos kunden, på kontoret eller där det bäst passar uppgiften bäst.
   

  

 Du kan förvänta dig ett arbete fyllt med goda möjligheter till utveckling och karriär. Du tränas i viktiga konsultfärdigheter och får kontinuerlig feedback för att utvecklas i din roll, allt för att möta de förväntningar som finns inom Risk Assurance och för att bygga en stabil grund för din framtida karriär på PwC. Vi värdesätter inte bara våra medarbetare och kunder utan strävar också efter att bidra till ett mer hållbart samhälle. Läs mer om våra tjänsteområden inom revision.
   

  

**Som medarbetare på Risk Assurance kommer du att arbeta inom något av följande team:**
* Controls Assurance Som en del av vårt team kommer du att arbeta med att säkerställa att företagsprocesser och kontroller är både effektiva och hållbara, med fokus på affärsprocesser samt IT- och cybersäkerhet. Du deltar i revisionsuppdrag, där du granskar, identifierar risker och testar interna kontroller för att säkerställa att allting är i linje med branschstandarder och lagkrav. Utöver det erbjuder vi även tredjepartsgranskningar, där du som en oberoende expert hjälper till att utfärda intyg som bekräftar att företagsprocesser och kontroller, inklusive säkerhetssystem, är väl etablerade. Intygen är viktiga för att bygga förtroende hos kunder och partners och visar att företagen upprätthåller högsta standarder för säkerhet och riskhantering. Sammanfattningsvis är Controls Assurance en central funktion som guidar företag att navigera i komplexa riskmiljöer samt att upprätthålla integriteten i deras verksamhetsprocesser.
* Internal Audit Internrevision ger trygghet för styrelse och ledning och ger bättre kontroll över verksamheten. En internrevision genomlyser en mängd områden inom verksamheten och ger styrelse och ledning en tydlig bild av hur väl processer och rutiner fungerar. Eftersom en internrevision utvärderar nuläge och föreslår åtgärder för att öka effektiviteten inom ledningsprocesser, riskhantering, intern styrning och kontroll bidrar den till att organisationen uppnår målen mer effektivt och att resultatet därmed ökar.
* Cyber Cyberteamet arbetar med en riskbaserad approach för att stötta bolag inom alla sektorer och storlek med ett systematiskt cybersäkerhetsarbete. Vi berör allt från lagar, regler och förordningar, internationella ramverk och teknisk arkitektur, alltid med utgångspunkt i våra kunders behov och typ av verksamhet. I vårt arbete ingår att undersöka och förstå uppdragsgivarens nuläge och att hjälpa dem till nästa nivå, ibland på kort sikt och ibland med mer långtgående strategiskt arbete. Vår vardag och våra uppdrag präglas av mycket rådgivning och guidning, hur man som verksamhet går från styrande dokument, till operativt arbete och inte minst kring hur tekniken kan bidra till att skydda något av det viktigaste ett bolag har - information.
* Governance, Risk & Controls Inom Governance, Risk & Controls på PwC arbetar vi för att stärka våra kunders verksamheter genom att implementera effektiva kontroller, processer och strategier. Vi hjälper företag att navigera genom nya standarder, hantera förändringar och säkerställa att de efterlever gällande regelverk. Vid förberedelser inför börsnotering erbjuder vi stöd i utformningen och införandet av ramverk och rutiner för intern kontroll och riskhantering. Dessutom ger vi rådgivning inom bolagsstyrning, riskhantering och internkontroll för att stötta företag att uppnå långsiktig hållbarhet och framgång.


**Beroende på kundens behov, projektets karaktär och komplexitet kommer du exempelvis arbeta med:**
* Granskning och testning av IT- och verksamhetsprocesser
* Sammanställning av information i form av rapport
* Förbereda inför och hantera kundmöten
* Presentationer i projekt
* Projektledning
* Offertarbete


**Kvalifikationer För Tjänsten**
* Du har en kandidatexamen inom exempelvis ekonomi, systemvetenskap, civilingenjör eller statsvetenskap
* Mycket god muntlig och skriftlig kommunikativ förmåga inom både svenska och engelska
* Du har ett gott självledarskap och en vana att ta dig an nya möjligheter


**Det Är Meriterande Om Du Har**
* Master inom relevant område
* Erfarenhet vid sidan av studierna genom exempelvis praktikplatser eller extrajobb
* Engagemang i studentförening eller ideellt arbete
* Erfarenhet av system som Workiva eller SQL


 ,
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Välkommen med din ansökan till oss senast den 23 februari 2025.
   

  

**Tillträde:** 
 Augusti 2025
   

  

**Vi ber dig bifoga följande handlingar med din ansökan:**
* CV
* Personligt brev
* Betyg från universitet/högskola (bifoga detta under “övrigt”)
* Ange i din ansökan till vilken/vilka orter du söker och vilket/vilka team som är av störst intresse för dig.


**Rekryteringsprocessen**
 Vi tror på möjligheterna i att ha en rekryteringsprocess som gäller för alla. Som en del av urvalet använder vi oss därför av arbetspsykologiska tester med syfte att säkerställa ett inkluderande, fördomsfritt och rättvist urval. Testerna är ett första steg i vår urvalsprocess. Du får en länk till dessa när vi har tagit emot din ansökan.
   

  

 Vi värdesätter det personliga mötet för att se vilket värde just du kan tillföra PwC men också vad vi kan erbjuda dig. Intervjuprocessen består vanligtvis av flera steg och olika typer av intervjuer. När du träffar HR, har du en kompetensbaserad intervju där vi tittar på personlighetstestet som du genomfört innan intervjun. Vid intervjun med verksamheten får du möjlighet att träffa det aktuella teamet för att gå igenom rollen.
   

  

 För frågor gällande tjänsten eller rekryteringsprocessen vänligen kontakta ansvarig rekryterare nedan.

title: Account Executive
company_industry: Software Development and Human Resources Services
description:
**Job Title** 
 : Sales Exec / Account Exec
 



**Location** 
 : Stockholm, Sweden - hybrid
 



**Job Type** 
 : Full-Time Permanent
 



  





**About the Role:** 




 As a Sales-/Account Exec, you will be instrumental in driving our clients transition from using a white label solution and partnerships to building their own sales function to directly approach their customers. Your role will be pivotal in building the new customer-facing sales organization from scratch.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Identify and engage with IT Managers (and/or other decision makers) actively seeking an IT lifecycle platform for procurement and asset management.
* Achieve and exceed assigned sales quotas, driving initiatives to meet and surpass performance expectations.
* Tailor solutions effectively based on client needs and challenges.
* Showcase their capabilities to potential clients, emphasizing the platform's value for businesses and their employees.
* Guide clients through the features and benefits of the solution.
* Establish and nurture strong relationships with clients, ensuring long-term satisfaction.
* Collaborate with the team to optimize sales processes and deliver an exceptional experience to customers.
* Navigate the sales process from initial contact to contract negotiation and successful closure.
* Report sales performance to senior management and share customer insights with product teams.



  





**Qualifications:** 



* +5 years' exp. in similar roles within the IT or software industry (e.g., Account Executive, Business Development Manager, Account Manager).
* Proven exp. consultative IT sales and/or SaaS B2B sales.
* Track record of meeting and exceeding sales targets.
* Strong understanding of IT/technology sales (hardware, software, and services).
* Proven exp. in IT sales, IT asset management, HR/HCM and/or SaaS solutions
* Exp. setting up a sales organization from scratch is a plus
* Excellent communication and presentation skills in English and also Swedish, Danish, or Norwegian.



  





**What We Offer:** 



* Competitive salary and benefits package with equity
* Dynamic and supportive work environment.
* Opportunities for professional growth and development.



  





 Apply now. Interviews are ongoing!

title: Test Manager
description:
**Job Description** 




 High competence and education in the relevant area. 5-9 years of experience in the area, has participated in or carried out several similar assignments in the relevant area with high quality. Is a role model for other consultants at a lower level. Takes responsibility for a sub-area, can lead a small group. Can work independently.
 



  





**Mission description:** 




 We are looking for a Technical Tester with test management experience to work within one of our strategic programs. The consultant will be responsible for testing and coordinating the work on the technical issues to be able to exchange data with the Nordic system operators, information security requirements, technical requirements in the interface with the systems affected by deliveries from the program.
 



 The consultant will work together with internal resources within IT and operations as well as other consultants. You are responsible for testing functionality developed by the agile team. The tasks also include customary test manager activities such as planning, leading, coordinating and administering the project or team's testing work through all project phases. Anchoring the testing work within the project organization and handing over a set test procedure suitable for handover to a management organization.
 



  





**Requirements specification:** 




**Mandatory requirements** 




 Education (Svenska kraftnät may require proof of education or certificates upon request):
 



 College/university education 120p/180hp in IT/Data or at least 5 years of working experience in IT and Data
 



 ISTQB certification or diploma course in test management
 



 The consultant must speak and write Swedish and English fluently.
 



  





**Competence and experience:** 




 At least 5 years of work experience as a test manager of IT systems within the last 10 years
 



 At least 5 years of experience as a test manager with IT systems based on UNIX/LINUX/Windows platforms
 



 At least 3 years of work experience as a tester of mission-critical or operationally critical systems within the last 5 years
 



 At least 2 years of experience as both tester and test leader in an international project with data flows between different countries during the last 8 years.
 



  





**Value-added requirements** 




 At least 1 year of work experience with Azur DevOps and/or Jira as a testing tool
 



 At least 1 year of experience working with flow-based processes
 



 At least 1 year of experience with transmission systems
 



 At least 2 years of work experience at an authority within the last 10 years

title: Technical Architect
description:
*Digital Customer Offering (DCO) is a business function within Fortum Consumer Solutions, where business and technology come together. At DCO, we create superior digital offerings and experiences for our 2,4 million consumer and enterprise customers. We innovate and find new ways to digitalize our offerings and processes. We collaborate closely with our stakeholders and external partners. Through cross-functional collaboration, agility and sustainability focus, we strive to make our customers’ increasingly digital lives easier with our services. We serve clients in the Nordics as well as Poland and Spain.*
 We are looking for a talented and passionate individual to join our newly formed Secure Operations & Data Solutions team. As a Technical Architect, you will be responsible for designing and implementing robust, scalable, and high-performance systems. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure that our technology solutions align with business goals and meet the highest standards of quality.
   

  

**In this role, you will:**
* Design and lead the technical architecture work
* Own part of the IT landscape from an architecture perspective
* Ensure that technical architecture work is aligned with solution architecture
* Consult with applications and infrastructure development (projects) to fit systems to architecture
* Keep documentation of technical architecture up to date
* Ensure that the solutions follow Fortum’s privacy and cyber security policies, manuals, and guidelines
* Ensure the scalability, performance, and security of systems
* Provide technical guidance and mentorship to development teams
* Stay up to date with emerging technologies and industry trends


**To excel in this role, you should have:**
* A bachelor's or master's degree in computer science, business administration, or another relevant area
* One year of relevant experience in IT
* Preferably a good understanding of the business/industry
* Knowledge of technology cyber security architecture
* Experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud)
* Regularly maintain role-based cyber security training


**Ready to Join Us?**
 Don't miss out on this exciting opportunity! Submit your application by 07.03.2025 at the latest. If you have any questions or would like to learn more about the position, feel free to reach out to Antti Heimonen via email at antti.heimonen@fortum.com. We're here to help and look forward to hearing from you!
   

  

 To be selected for the position, the applicant must go through background clearance and a health examination including drug testing.
   

  

**We are Fortum**
 Fortum is a Nordic energy company. Our purpose is to power a world where people, businesses and nature thrive together. We are one of the cleanest energy producers in Europe and our actions are guided by our ambitious environmental targets. We generate and deliver clean energy reliably and help industries to decarbonise their processes and grow. Our core operations in the Nordics comprise of efficient, CO2-free power generation as well as reliable supply of electricity and district heat to private and business customers. For our :5 000 employees, we commit to be a safe, and inspiring workplace. Fortum's share is listed on Nasdaq Helsinki. fortum.com

title: D365 Functional Specialist

description:

 The D365 Functional Specialist serves as the subject matter expert for Microsoft Dynamics 365 applications, bridging the gap between business requirements and technical solutions.  Proven expertise in configuring and supporting Microsoft Dynamics 365 modules

**Communication:**

description:

title: Teknisk systemförvaltare – Telge AB
description:
***Välj Telge – här får du kombinera affärsmässighet med samhällsnytta och som medarbetare får du frihet under ansvar och möjlighet att påverka.***
 Vi tror på dig som individ och utgår ifrån att du bär på din alldeles egna unika förmåga att kunna göra skillnad. Vi tror också på att det är bra att vi har olika bakgrunder och erfarenheter för att vi tillsammans ska kunna göra skillnad. Modig är ett av våra fyra kärnvärden och tillsammans med våra tre andra kärnvärden – öppen, enkel och personlig – ­präglar de mycket av det vi gör. För att du ska må bra och nå din fulla potential, så vet vi att du behöver en god balans mellan arbete och fritid.
   

  

 Så Här Säger Göran Hellström, Chef För Digitalisering Och Kundlösningar IT, Rekryterande Chef Om Rollen
   

  

*”På DigIT arbetar cirka 25 motiverade och specialiserade medarbetare i en stark gemenskap. Vi arbetar med drift, support, arkitektur, utveckling och förvaltning. Våra viktiga tjänster nyttjas av medarbetare, elever och medborgare, samt besökare till Tom Tits Experiment och våra kunder till Södertälje Hamn. Välkommen att bli en av oss!”*
**Arbetsuppgifter och ansvar**
 I rollen som teknisk systemförvaltare hos oss har du det huvudsakliga portföljansvaret för flera av koncernens bolag. Du utvecklar och förbättrar IT-lösningarna för en av portföljerna som huvudsakligen består av verksamhetskritiska applikationer och plattformar för Telge, eller hela kommunkoncernen. Rollen är komplex och lösningsorienterad och du förvaltar, vidareutvecklar, löser problem och dokumenterar portföljens IT-lösningar. Det är du som har överblick över hur förändringarna påverkar helheten och att de genomförs på ett bra sätt. I arbetsuppgifterna ingår även att föra dialoger med övriga verksamheter i Telge, för att ytterligare förbättra deras IT-lösningar.
   

  

**Vi är Telge AB**
 Telge AB är moderbolaget i Telgekoncernen vars uppdrag är att vara ett aktivt ägarbolag med ett långsiktigt helhetsperspektiv. Här samlar vi kompetenser inom ekonomi och verksamhetsstyrning, HR, innovation och utveckling, hållbarhet, kommunikation och IT. Vi är ett viktigt strategiskt och operativt stöd till våra dotterbolag så att de kan ägna sig åt det de kan bäst – sin kärnaffär.
   

  

**Vår önskelista**
 Vi vill gärna lära känna dig och veta lite mer om vad du kan. För att lyckas i rollen behöver du ha arbetat flera år med förvaltning och vidareutveckling av IT-lösningar. Vi ser det som självklart att du har högskoleutbildning med inriktning på IT eller motsvarande kunskaper som du har förvärvat på annat sätt.
   

  

 Eftersom vårt koncernspråk är svenska förutsätter vi att du talar och skriver svenska obehindrat, samtidigt som det är viktigt att du talar och skriver engelska utan svårigheter. Vi arbetar med M365-plattformen och tar för givet att du är van att arbeta i den eller i liknande digitala plattformar.
   

  

 Som person är du självständig, uthållig och kan jobba målmedvetet mot överenskomna leveransmål. Du är också ansvarsfull, har förmågan att prioritera och se helheten ur ett koncernperspektiv.
   

  

**Plus i kanten**
 Vi Begär Inte Att Du Ska Kunna Allt, Men Om Du Har Erfarenhet Av Någon Eller Några Av Följande Är Det Ett Plus
   

  

 Om du har arbetat som tjänsteägare IT, produktägare IT eller motsvarande är det en bonus. Har du dessutom kunskap och/eller erfarenhet av något eller flera av följande blir vi extra glada: arkitektur, SQL, Itil, SAFE, Pm3, XLPM och/eller IT-säkerhet. Är du dessutom flerspråkig är det ytterligare plus i kanten.
   

  

**Mångfald, inkludering och trygghet**
 Vi på Telge arbetar aktivt för mångfald och inkludering och välkomnar därför medarbetare med olika erfarenheter, bakgrunder och kompetenser. En trygg och säker arbetsmiljö är vår högsta prioritet. Arbetspsykologiska tester ingår i våra rekryteringsprocesser till chefs- och specialisttjänster och vi genomför återkommande, slumpmässiga drogtester bland alla våra medarbetare.
   

  

**Sista ansökningsdatum**
 3 mars 2025
   

  

**Några frågor?**
 I den här rekryteringen samarbetar vi med Experis IT. Vid frågor är du välkommen att kontakta ansvarig rekryteringskonsult Pia Boström, 0703-14 68 66, pia.bostrom@se.experis.com. Fackliga kontaktpersoner är Robert Holm för Vision eller Anders Lindgren för SACO, du når båda på 08 550 220 00.
   

  

**Välkommen hit, du med!**
 Telgekoncernen ägs av Södertälje kommun och består av nio helägda bolag med cirka 900 medarbetare som fördelas över drygt 250 olika yrkesgrupper. Inom Telgekoncernen finns en stor bredd av bolag och de som ingår är Södertälje Hamn, moderbolaget Telge AB, Telge Bostäder, Telge Fastigheter, Telge Inköp, Telge Nät, Telge Tillväxt, Telge Återvinning och Tom Tits Experiment. Det som binder ihop oss och är gemensamt för oss alla är att vi jobbar för att förena affärer med samhällsnytta, samtidigt som vi har kul på jobbet. Hållbarhet genomsyrar allt vi gör och för oss handlar hållbarhet om social, miljömässig och ekonomisk hållbarhet. Vi planerar långsiktigt och agerar kortsiktigt för att nå vara hållbarhetsmål.
   

  

 Vår bas finns i Södertälje - här är ambitionsnivån hög, expansionstakten snabb och utvecklingsviljan stor. Vi är familjära och hälsar på varandra när vi möts i korridoren eller vid kaffemaskinen. Bolagens variation gör att du med rätt personlighet och attityd kan komma långt. Det finns många olika karriärvägar att välja mellan. Vi arbetar tillsammans för att följa vår strategi och nå koncernens hållbarhetsmål med ambitionen att göra det så bra vi kan för de som bor och verkar i Södertälje.
   

  

 Teknisk systemförvaltare – Telge AB
   

  

 https:/ / www.telge.se/ jobba-hos-oss/ lediga-tjanster/ jobb/ 3461453
   

  

 ,

title: IT Architect (Distribution Business)
description:
Om tjänsten
   

  

 Vattenfall is recognized as one of the first movers in the energy transition – and by that power climate smarter living for all our customers.
   

  

 Yet, our investment power, innovation, and ambitious change agenda to become fossil free in one generation, can only be met if the Swedish grid is ready to deal with this electrification revolution. To face this challenge we invest in our people and we continue to employ exceptional IT talent. With our team, we are advancing the Distribution business area in Vattenfall as a data driven company allowing them to optimize decision making and investment planning.
   

  

 This means we are architecting:
   

  

* Full IT/OT convergence to ensure frictionless transfer of data (near) real time
* Advanced solutions to deliver real-time insights into the performance of our grid, substations, transmission lines to lower maintenance costs
* IT infrastructure and solutions that are hyper-scalable and reliable to meet Distribution reliability and growth target
* Seamless and secure market communication and open data sharing to support Europe’s vision for an interconnected grid.
* Strategic solutions/landscapes to meet Distribution’s Strategic Targets (Distribute twice the amount of electricity, and distribute with 99.99% continuity)


 Our team requires true Business facing Solution architects; You know how to use technology to make Distribution run as
 *clockwork* 
 , you act as
 *timer* 
 to ensure we meet our ambitious goals and be an
 *alarm* 
 if we can do better! We have a large SAP and Microsoft footprint, with more than 20.000 users in six countries
   

  

 Our Group IT Architecture team of 30 enterprise / solution architects is involved in around 100+ key projects at any time, focusing on enterprise architecture and solution architecture for all Vattenfall business units. We act as the hub to understand business needs and to see the bigger Vattenfall picture to help our teams securely adopt the technologies of tomorrow.
   

  

 Your main responsibilities:
   

  

* You will join the larger strategic projects, to guide them into successful execution based on fit-for-purpose architecture
* You will consult and educate the Distribution business on IT strategy, integration strategy, data strategy etc
* You have a solid understanding of IT security and will support Distribution in fit-for-purpose adoption.
* You will have (or build up) Distribution domain knowledge to become the go-to point how Distribution should advance its IT landscape.
* You will, in dialogue with business, drive a further adoption of data mesh
* You will help us grow our Enterprise thinking and establish standards and architecture principles. You will be our trusted advisor towards our Distribution and other business area’s to enable their operating model by technology – also if that is that means radical change!


 Din bakgrund
   

  

 We are looking for a seasoned Architect, with experience preferably as architect or consultant in water or energy utilities, manufacturing, or automotive.
   

  

 You feel comfortable communicating with both IT and non-IT colleagues on different levels in the organization. You enjoy being in an ever-changing environment. Furthermore you:
   

  

* Have an academic degree in IT or related study
* Have worked in an international environment and you speak Swedish and English
* Have deep IT knowledge and experience with IT architecture and frameworks
* Ideally bring experience from an asset intensive industry – and you understand security considerations, IEC 62443, ISO27001 etc.
* Have experience with Microsoft Azure Well Architected Framework
* You enjoy producing enterprise ready architecture documents
* And you have the skills to direct complex problems into concise Management Board action
* And… we love architects who talk business and know TOGAF, rather than those that talk TOGAF and know business …


**Location:** 
 for this position you will be based in Sweden, with some travelling to the office (Stockholm, Solna). Occasionally also travel to Distribution locations, like Trollhattan or Amsterdam and Berlin for team events. Travel will be approximately once month for two days.
   

  

 Mer information
   

  

**Our Offer**
* Become part of a massive transformative purpose – not on paper, but in real-life – whereby you can influence the outcome!
* We offer a challenging and international work environment and the possibility to work with some of the best in the field.
* You will work in an interdisciplinary team with other senior IT Architects – so we do this together!
* A professional environment where your experience, knowledge and attitude will bring us one step further and the opportunity for you to grow further.
* A central office location with easy access by public transport.
* Furthermore, a healthy work-life balance (smart working) and time to develop your profession
* At Vattenfall you get the opportunity to work for a clean energy company that aims for creating fossil free energy within one generation.
* And last but not least; International and multi-cultural work environment with energetic, motivated colleagues that like to have fun as well!


**More information**
 We welcome your application in English, including CV and cover letter via our website. For information about the position, please contact recruiting manager Emile Das, +31 6 5250 4359. For more information about the recruitment process, you are welcome to contact Recruiter Folmer Koper +31 6 38710915.
   

  

 At Vattenfall, we are convinced that striving for diversity helps building a more profitable, efficient and attractive company. We continue to seek a harmonious balance of employees in terms of gender, age, ethnic and cultural backgrounds.
   

  

 Since Vattenfall is a part of the Swedish critical infrastructure, many of our services are security classed. If this position is security classed the final candidates might be subjected to a security vetting process, according to the Swedish legislation.
   

  

 Om oss
   

  

 Vattenfall is one of Europe’s largest producers and retailers of electricity and heat. Our main markets are Sweden, Germany, the Netherlands, Denmark, and the UK. The Vattenfall Group has approximately 20,000 employees. We have been electrifying industries, powering homes and transforming life through innovation for more than 100 years. We now want to make fossil free living possible within one generation and we are driving the transition to a sustainable energy system.

title: Associate Operations Manager - Strategy & Operations
description:
**Job Description**
 Join a forward-leaning and agilent team at Wolt as an Associate Operations Manager in region North!
   

  

 As an Associate Operations Manager in the Regional Strategy & Operations team, you will be responsible for driving innovation, implementation and execution across all aspects of our operations. This particular role will have a major focus on leading our ambitions to make autonomous deliveries a natural part of our operations across the region. It will also include working with other key areas and challenging problems while spearheading the innovation for new ideas; whether it is a new courier partnership model, a new sustainability project or a new delivery mode all together. In this, you will be responsible for bringing structure to ambiguous situations and own the forward progress. You will collaborate across individuals, teams and functions, bringing your natural knack for ownership, execution and problem-solving.
   

  

 Reporting directly to the Regional Head of Strategy & Innovation as part of Regional Operations, your role is crucial in achieving ambitious targets in all countries and all business lines that we operate in.
   

  

**What You’ll Be Doing**
 This is a multi-faced and highly varied role, but the major areas of responsibilities including tasks are:
   

  

* Own the operational part of autonomous deliveries - incl. vision & strategy, partnership negotiations, feasibility studies, unit economics, product development coordination and scale-up of operations.
* Identify and suggest new business and project opportunities within the scope Strategy & Innovation, based on industry insights and data driven hypotheses
* Utilize your analytical skills to create data driven hypotheses of how to solve complex problems involving all sides of the Wolt platform and business environment.
* Lead and own responsibility areas in focus that you oversee from ideation to implementation and follow-up, with the potential of leading a team in the future
* Effectively collaborate with internal and external stakeholders across all functions of the company to ensure progress for your specific responsibility areas including but not limited to product, marketing, legal, policy, local and global business teams.
* Monitor KPIs and conduct analysis to unpack why performance is what it is and devising strategies to meet or exceed the targets for region North


**Our humble expectations**
* Strong sense of ownership and accountability for end results
* Experience from operational autonomy development and implementation
* Proactive "doer" mentality, with willingness to fail and open to learn from mistakes
* Self-driven and able to fill your own and team members’ work weeks with tasks, based on agreed purposes and end-states for the direction of the team and the company
* Solves problems independently and proactively
* Experienced manager, that has led both big and small projects and teams before with successful, measurable results
* Passionate about new technology and innovative ways to operate
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English (Nordic languages fluency is a plus)
* Proficient in digital collaboration tools like GSuite, Slack, and Zoom


**Next Steps**
 If you have any further questions about the position before submitting an application, you can turn to:
   

  

 Laura Ilioaea - Talent Acquisition Partner
   

  

 laura.ilioaea@external.wolt.com
   

  

 Please note that we do not accept applications coming in via email. Please submit your application in English via our career page.
   

  

 This role does not include relocation assistance. If you are applying from abroad, you will need to be fully prepared to handle all aspects of your relocation independently, including securing work authorization (if applicable) and covering relocation expenses.
   

  

**About Wolt**
 Wolt is a Helsinki-based technology company that provides an online platform for consumers, merchants and couriers. It connects people looking to order food and other goods with people interested in selling and delivering them. To enable this, Wolt develops a wide range of technologies from local logistics to retail software and financial solutions – as well as operating its own grocery stores under the Wolt Market brand. Wolt’s products include Wolt+ (subscription service for customers), Wolt for Work (meal benefits and office deliveries for companies), Wolt Drive (fast last-mile deliveries for merchants) and Wolt Self-Delivery (service for merchant partners with their own delivery staff). Wolt’s mission is to make cities better by empowering and growing local communities. Wolt was founded in 2014 and joined forces with DoorDash in 2022. DoorDash operates in 29 countries today, 25 of which are with the Wolt product and brand.
   

  

**So, why work at Wolt?**
**At Wolt, We’re About Getting Things Done.**
 You’ll probably enjoy it here if you like taking ownership, developing yourself and being around friendly, humble and ambitious people.
   

  

 We work hard to make cities into better places, and it’s pretty cool seeing us grow every week. If you’re passionate about building things that just… work, Wolt might be for you.
   

  

**Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion**
 We want to have all sorts of people in our team – people like you and me, and people different from you and me. To be able to work with diverse teammates – when it comes to gender, age, ethnicity, life background, sexual orientation, political views, religion, or any other personal trait – we consciously aim to offer equal opportunity for everyone to work with us. This is because we believe diverse teams make the most thought-through decisions and build things in the most inclusive way.
   

  

***Join us today to build Wolt together.***

title: Team Manager - Solution Architects Team
description:
Produktbolaget Hypergene växer och vi söker nu dig som vill vara en del av och bidra till Hypergene’s tillväxtresa, där ditt driv och engagemang bidrar till att fortsätta utveckla medarbetare, kund och affär! I din roll har du personalansvar för en grupp lösningsarkitekter där du utövar ett nära ledarskap genom att vara tillgänglig, coachande och insatt i de projekt och uppdrag där dina medarbetare ingår.
 



  





**Om rollen** 




 Du blir Teamchef för Hypergene Lösningsarkitektteam och är en del av chefsgruppen inom services och verkar i denna konstellation för att utveckla våra arbetssätt och processer inom lösningsarkitektur. Du ansvarar för de finansiella mål som finns för ditt team och verkar för att skapa förutsättningar för ditt team så att de kan nå uppsatta mål. Du säkerställer också att teamet har rätt verktyg och metoder till sitt förfogande.
 



  





 Utveckling är en av våra ledstjärnor och för att lyckas med det är feedback viktigt. Som Teamchef jobbar du både med positiv och konstruktiv feedback. Du genomför inom ramen för detta ansvar utvecklings- och uppföljningssamtal samt lönesamtal. Hypergene är ett företag i stark tillväxt där rekrytering och introduktion av nya medarbetare är en viktig uppgift för dig som teamchef.
 



  





 Du bidrar dagligen till att skapa underlag för utveckling av våra kunder och våra affärer och har leveransansvar inom ett av segmenten vi verkar i – och förstås alltid med ett intresse för att öka kundnöjdheten. Du genomför kreativa kundutvecklingsmöten i syfte att skapa förståelse, engagemang och bestående värde i såväl relation som produktens genomslag. Våra kunder och projekt skapas ofta genom olika affärsprocesser och upphandlingar. Det är inte ovanligt att du medverkar i dessa sammanhang som säljstöd till affärsansvarig. Du stöttar även teamet i komplexa tekniska diskussioner och vägleder i enlighet med företagets strategi och riktning.
 



  





**Om dig** 




 Ditt ledarskap bygger på affärsmannaskap, att skapa förutsättningar, mod och att få andra att växa. Du är självgående och resultatinriktad men samtidigt en lagspelare som gillar att arbeta i team tillsammans med kollegor. Du har lätt för samarbete och god förmåga att skapa förtroende och underhålla relationer. Man trivs i ditt sällskap! Hos dig finns förmågan att tänka långsiktigt och se helheter, särskilt i komplexa tekniska landskap.
 



  





 Som person är du proaktiv, lösningsorienterad och strukturerad men samtidigt lyhörd och har lätt för att anpassa dig utifrån nya förutsättningar och vägval. Din planering och struktur utgör ett värdefullt stöd i till ditt teams konsultvardag. Du har en passion för teknik och delar gärna med dig av din kunskap.
 



  





 Vi söker dig som:
 


* Har erfarenhet av att ha arbetat som ledare och chef, gärna i en konsultorganisation.
* Har erfarenhet av att leda och utveckla ett team av tekniska experter.
* Har erfarenhet av att arbeta med komplexa IT-lösningar och systemintegrationer.
* Har erfarenhet av att arbeta i en agil miljö.
* Har relevant högskole- eller universitetsutbildning inom IT eller motsvarande.
* Är van vid att formulera dig muntligt och skriftligt på svenska och engelska.



  





**Om oss** 




 Hypergene är ett Tech-bolag på marknaden för beslutsstöd och verksamhetsstyrning – med en molnbaserad (SAAS) produkt för planering, uppföljning och analys. Med vår hjälp kan kunder styra mot sina mål och nå en ny, högre nivå av prestation och effektivitet. Våra kunder finns både inom privat och offentlig sektor.

title: Full Stack Developer & Startup Founder (March 2025)
job_function: Information Technology, Business Development, and Strategy/Planning
company_industry: Venture Capital and Private Equity Principals
description:
**Note: This Opportunity Does Not Offer Employment, but rather an opportunity to build your own VC-backed startup!** 




  





**Who you are:** 




 You are a highly accomplished full-stack software developer with a demonstrated ability to deliver innovative solutions. Your exceptional programming skills and experience in building complex applications position you to tackle significant challenges within the tech industry. You possess a strong problem-solving aptitude and a passion for pioneering cutting-edge technologies. Driven to make a real impact, you're eager to leverage your expertise in building disruptive tech ventures.
 



  





**About Antler** 




 Antler is the world's most active venture capital firm, providing funding from pre-seed to Series C. We invest in Founders who seek to define our tomorrow and reshape the world we live in with groundbreaking technological innovation. Every year, we handpick the strongest Founders from more than 135,000 applicants across our 27 locations on the globe, which has led us to work with more than 7,000 founders to date and a portfolio of more than 1,000 startups.
 



  





**The Antler Founder Residency** 




 Join a dynamic cohort of 200+ highly motivated entrepreneurs for an immersive 12-week program. Visit our website for a detailed breakdown of how we'll support your startup launch.
 


* 12-Week full-time Immersive Journey: Kicking off March, 2025, in Stockholm.
* Co-Founder Discovery: In the first 10 weeks, collaborate with fellow Founders to find your co-founder(s).
* Pitch to Invest: Present your team and business idea to the Antler Investment Committee. Secure a net cash investment of EUR 100k for 10% equity.
* Accelerate Growth: If funded, we work closely with you to make your startup a success



  





**Program Details** 



* **Start Date:** 
 March 3rd, 2025
* **Location:** 
 Onsite at our Stockholm office
* **Compensation:** 
 While participants don't receive financial compensation during the program, pre-seed investment is available to jumpstart your venture.
* **Visa Sponsorship:** 
 Due to the non-employment nature of the program, visa sponsorship is unavailable.



  





**For our March 2025 cohort, we’re looking for someone who:** 



* Having the autonomy to develop sophisticated software solutions to address real-world challenges, merging ingenuity with functionality.
* Exceptional problem-solving and analytical skills, capable of breaking down complex issues and bringing structure into business cases
* Providing leadership, whether it’s directing a development team or managing comprehensive product delivery.
* You have an idea that you believe can solve a problem you are deeply interested in. You understand that you need co-pilots who share your vision and values.



  





**Application Process** 




 Our streamlined application process takes only 2-3 weeks:
 


1. Apply through our website.
2. Participate in an introductory interview.
3. Progress to an in-depth interview with our partners.
4. Receive a potential offer.



  





**Antler Success Stories** 




 Several companies built through the Antler program have received pre-seed investment and have gone on to secure significant funding rounds. Here are just a few examples:
 


* **Wingbits:** 
 A community-driven flight data tracking platform
* **Two:** 
 A comprehensive B2B payment suite simplifying sales for online and offline businesses.
* **Evyon:** 
 A developer of eco-friendly battery energy storage systems.
* **Glint Solar:** 
 Software accelerating the identification of optimal solar installation sites.
* **PerPlant:** 
 AI-powered sensor systems creating a gateway to sustainable agriculture.

title: Regional Partner Manager, Nordics
description:
Vectra® is the leader in AI-driven threat detection and response for hybrid and multi-cloud enterprises.
   

  

 The Vectra AI Platform delivers integrated signal across public cloud, SaaS, identity, and data center networks in a single platform. Powered by patented Attack Signal Intelligence, it empowers security teams to rapidly prioritize, investigate and respond to the most advanced cyber-attacks. With 35 patents in AI-driven threat detection and the most vendor references in MITRE D3FEND, organizations worldwide rely on the Vectra AI to move at the speed and scale of hybrid attackers. For more information, visit www.vectra.ai.
   

  

**About the Role**
 We are currently looking for a Regional Partner Manager to be based in Sweden; while working remotely you focus on the allocated region. As part of an amazing team, based regionally.
   

  

 The RPM will own and maintain the relationships in the channel landscape, including Distribution, VARs, System Integrators and Referral partners. All aspects of partner recruitment, partner enablement, business planning, sales, sales forecasting, joint marketing activities, et al. will be the Partner Manager's responsibility.
   

  

**Your Role at a Glance**
 You will work closely with Partners to identify, recruit & enable new Partners, that match the ideal partner profile. The RPM maintains contracts, pricing updates, and drives net new contracts! You develop and implement a partner account plan in close coordination with the sales team. This will include strategic direction and goals, business planning, account mappings, lead and pipeline generation as well as knowledge transfer.
   

  

* Drive all financial aspects of the Channel Partner relationship including revenue, renewals rate, margin, rebate.
* Own the pipeline together with the partners, assisting the partner with required resources and closing the deals.
* Collaborate actively with the Regional Sales Managers on regional channel strategies to achieve the key goals of Vectra AI and their Partners.
* Present effectively and selling solutions.
* Position Vectra AI solutions and articulate Vectra AI strategies and value propositions at events and customer meetings.


 What Will Impress Us
   

  

 To be successful in this role, the RPM has fun and brings experience, generating new business through the channel network and develop and maintain strong and lasting partnerships, ideally in the ecosystem of cybersecurity or related industries. We need our RPM to have an excellent network in the security channel landscape across region and proven experience selling via channel partners; with a willingness and ability to work autonomously, be self-motivated and a strong doer and an excellent partner to Vectra's customer base and drive expansion opportunities inside of existing accounts.
   

  

* Bring a strong closing mentality using a Win/Win philosophy with peers, distributors and partners.
* Bring a track record of meeting sales quota successfully and consistently.
* Have sold and worked with partners strategically with a long-term orientation.
* Be aware of how procurement works and ensuring that a procurement path is established and viable.
* Understand Cybersecurity, especially in the net-security space.
* Be an outstanding teammate and have strong interpersonal skills and desire to work in a multifaceted and fast-pace environment.
* Excellent verbal and written business-fluency in English and Swedish.
* A Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in business-focused studies
* Some experience with sales tools (e.g. Salesforce, DiscoverOrg)


 Sounds like this could be a match? We are looking forward to receiving your application!
   

  

 Vectra provides a comprehensive total rewards package that supports the financial, physical, mental and overall health of our employees and their families. Compensation includes competitive base pay, incentive plan eligibility, and participation in the employee equity plan (stock options). Specific benefits offered varies by location, but commonly include health care insurance, income protection / life insurance, access to retirement savings plans, behavioral & emotional wellness services, generous time away from work, and a comprehensive employee recognition program.
   

  

 Vectra is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.
   

  

 We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.

title: Senior Development Manager
description:
*Cambio is one of the Nordics' leading suppliers in eHealth with a comprehensive offering for the entire health and care chain. Our eHealth solutions support healthcare professionals in their daily work and offer patients safer and more easily accessible care. We are proud to be an important part of Swedish healthcare. We are growing continuously and now have about 1 000 employees in several countries.*
**The position**
 We are seeking a Senior Development Manager to strengthen our team in R&D. The ideal candidate will possess a strong technical background, great leadership skills, and the ability to communicate effectively with a diverse range of stakeholders. In this role, you will be responsible for ensuring our Inhabitant Engagement solutions are scalable, secure, and provide a superior user experience, empowering citizens to participate in their healthcare actively.
   

  

 As Senior Development Manager, your role will include developing and executing our Inhabitant Engagement roadmap, ensuring scalability, reliability, and cost-effectiveness. This area includes functionalities aimed at supporting both professionals and inhabitants, such as
   

  

* Access to shared patient information
* Self-care and health management tools
* Administrative self-service features
* Integration of patient-generated data into healthcare workflows


 You will work closely with our product management team and other teams within R&D to define and prioritize features that enable greater patient autonomy and engagement in their own care.
   

  

 We expect you to build, mentor, and lead a high-performing development team while fostering a culture of innovation, collaboration, and continuous improvement. Ensuring the timely and high-quality delivery of projects will be a key responsibility. Additionally, you will present project updates, technical concepts, and business cases to stakeholders in a clear and compelling manner, ensuring alignment between the development team and business objectives.
   

  

 Leadership at Cambio builds on trust, openness and safety. It is important for us to treat everyone with dignity, respect and fairness. We use failures as learning opportunities and a way to stimulate development.
   

  

 Our leaders must always “walk the talk” and lead by example.
   

  

**About You**
 You are a leader who encourages new ways of thinking and working to drive progress and improvements. Your results-oriented mindset ensures that you consistently focus on delivering value in everything you do. Adaptable, resilient and you thrive in dynamic environments. You excel in collaboration, building strong relationships across the organization to achieve common goals.
   

  

**Requirements** 
  

  

* 10+ years of experience in software development roles
* Excellent leadership and team management skills.
* Strong background in software development and architecture.
* Ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.
* Experience managing development budgets and resources.
* Excellent communication skills in both Swedish and English
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, or a related field (Master’s degree preferred).


**It’s** 
**a bonus if you**
* Have an understanding of regulatory requirements from the Healthcare industry
* Demonstrated experience in commercializing digital health solutions.
* A proven track record in healthcare technology and patient engagement.


**Place of employment** 
 : Linköping or Stockholm
   

  

 At Cambio we value a healthy work-life balance, and to encourage that we apply a hybrid working-model. Together with your team you decide which days you work at the office. On the remaining days you can work remotely from home, but you are always more than welcome to work at the office too.
   

  

**Scope** 
 : Full time
   

  

**Form of employment:** 
 Permanent employment, 6 months trial period
   

  

**Other:** 
 We screen the applications and hold interviews continuously so please send your application as soon as possible via the link.
   

  

 We encourage and eagerly welcome all applications, but we will only consider candidates who are located and have the legal right to work in
 **Sweden.** 
 We will ask for verification during the process.
   

  

**We look forward to receiving your application!** 
  

  

 Read more about us
 **here!**
 Are you interested in Cambio but you don’t feel that this position is the perfect match? Check out our other open positions at the career site
 **here!**
 Cambio Healthcare Systems is Sweden’s leading suppliers of healthcare information systems and a growing player in the European market with just over 100,000 users across general and university hospitals, specialist units and outpatient units. Through the use of our integrated solutions, our customers provide services to 4 million patients.

title: Arbetsledare
description:
**Är du en driven ledare med erfarenhet av ROT-projekt? Trivs du med att arbeta mot tydliga mål och ser lösningar där andra ser hinder? Vill du arbeta i en organisation där kvalitet, ordning och resultat går hand i hand? Då kan du vara den arbetsledare vi söker!**
**Om rollen**
 Som arbetsledare hos oss blir du en nyckelspelare i våra byggprojekt. Du ansvarar för att planera, leda och följa upp arbetet på plats – alltid med kvalitet, säkerhet och effektivitet i fokus. Du är platschefens ögon och öron på bygget och säkerställer att Husabs krav på kvalitet och leverans upprätthålls.
   

  

**Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter:**
 ✔ Planera produktionen tillsammans med platschef och hantera tidplaner
   

  

 ✔ Leda och fördela arbetet på byggarbetsplatsen
   

  

 ✔ Samordna och följa upp underentreprenörer
   

  

 ✔ Säkerställa arbetsmiljö och säkerhet genom att agera BAS U
   

  

 ✔ Göra materialinköp
   

  

 ✔ Genomföra ronder och rapportera avvikelser
   

  

 ✔ Arbeta aktivt med KMA i projektet
   

  

**Vem du är**
 Vi letar efter dig som har en stark känsla för ordning och reda, är en problemlösare som ser möjligheter även i pressade situationer samt har en god samarbetsförmåga och skapar starka relationer på arbetsplatsen. Du har också:
   

  

 ✔ Erfarenhet från liknande projekt inom entreprenadverksamhet
   

  

 ✔ Relevant utbildning och/eller gedigen kunskap inom byggteknik
   

  

 ✔ Vana vid att arbeta med dator och IT-system
   

  

 ✔ Flytande kommunikationsförmåga på svenska och kan göra dig väl förstådd även på engelska.
   

  

**Varför jobba hos oss?**
 Husab erbjuder en dynamisk och familjär arbetsmiljö där du får vara med och påverka. Här finns möjligheter till utveckling och spännande projekt att sätta tänderna i. Vi värdesätter engagemang, samarbete och målmedvetenhet – och vi letar efter dig som vill vara en del av vårt framgångsrika team. Vi erbjuder konkurrenskraftiga villkor och bra förmåner.
   

  

 Låter det som något för dig?
   

  

 Läs mer om Husab på www.husab.se och skicka in din ansökan redan idag - urval och intervjuer sker löpande. Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!

title: SAP Solution Architect
description:
* Help design, build and continuously improve the clients online platform.
* Research, suggest and implement new technology solutions following best practices/standards.
* Take responsibility for the resiliency and availability of different products.
* Be a productive member of the team.


**Requirements**
* 15+ years of experience.
* Knowledge of trade compliance and country of origin regulations


**Job Description – Detailed:**
* 10 to 15 years of experience with SAP Technologies (Functional/Technical/Basis).
* Experience with SAP system architecture.
* Expertise in building apps and integrating solutions with SAP BTP.
* Knowledge of SAP GRC (Governance, Risk, and Compliance) and IAM (Identity and Access Management).
* Strong communication skills and the ability to collaborate effectively with stakeholders from both business and IT.
* Familiarity with SAP Supply Chain modules, such as SAP Ariba, SAP Business Network, and SAP GTS (Global Trade Services), is a plus.


**Benefits**
* A challenging, innovating environment.
* Opportunities for learning where needed.

title: Financial Planner I
description:
**Work Location:**
 Brampton, Ontario, Canada
   

  

****Hours:****
 37.5
   

  

****Line Of Business:****
 TD Wealth
   

  

****Pay Details:****
 $60,000 - $70,000 CAD
   

  

 This role is eligible for commission based earnings.
   

  

 TD is committed to providing fair and equitable compensation opportunities to all colleagues. Growth opportunities and skill development are defining features of the colleague experience at TD. Our compensation policies and practices have been designed to allow colleagues to progress through the salary range over time as they progress in their role. The base pay actually offered may vary based upon the candidate's skills and experience, job-related knowledge, geographic location, and other specific business and organizational needs.
   

  

 As a candidate, you are encouraged to ask compensation related questions and have an open dialogue with your recruiter who can provide you more specific details for this role.
   

  

****Job Description:****
**Department Overview:**
 TD Wealth takes a sophisticated and holistic goals discovery approach to wealth planning and protection to provide highly personalized advice, solutions and service to clients. The Financial Planning team understands that helping clients set and achieve their financial goals while delivering a legendary customer experience is what drives our business success, new business and client loyalty. We do this by knowing our clients, offering the most professional and personalized solutions and building award-winning, high-performing teams.
   

  

 We have a long and growing history in wealth management leadership and are poised for even greater future success. Feel welcome, challenged and rewarded. Trust us, you'll be busy, but never bored.
   

  

****Job Description:****
 Are you an experienced professional skilled at providing mass affluent investing clients with comprehensive financial planning and advice? If so, then apply for the position of Financial Planner today to assist clients in meeting their financial goals and objectives.
   

  

 With a focus on relationship management, advice and business development, you will:
   

  

* Identify your client's life and financial goals, provide comprehensive reviews and build long-term relationships through financial planning expertise, relationship building and ongoing services
* Conduct reporting and relevant analysis using results to draw conclusions, make recommendations and continually assess the effectiveness of programs, policies and practices
* Contribute to team and department goals while strengthening customer service and dedication
* Monitor service, productivity and assess efficiency and implement continuous improvements
* Be knowledgeable of best practices and procedures and stay ahead of emerging trends
* Acquire and apply expertise, provide mentorship, assistance and direction to others
* Maintain a culture of risk management and control, supported by aligned risk appetite
* Participate fully as a member of the team, support a positive and service-oriented work environment


****Educational Requirements:****
* University Degree (preferred)
* 3 – 5 years within the financial services industry managing client relationships, providing financial advice and tailored investment solutions (preferred)
* Canadian Securities Course (CSC) or CFA Level 1 (or higher) required before start date
* Complete Conduct & Practices Handbook (CPH) within first 90 days in role
* CIRO Registered Representative (RR) license within first 90 days in role
* Complete Wealth Management Essentials (WME) within first 30 months in role
* Achieve Certified Financial Planner (CFP) designation within first 3 years in role
+ CFP Eligibility requirements: University Degree OR meet one of the following:
- Up to 10 years of qualifying work experience
- Have been a QAFP professional in good standing for a minimum of 5 years at the time of applying


****Skills You Will Require:****
* Passion for financial planning and driven to help clients reach their financial & life goals
* Possess an entrepreneurial spirit to prospect external business development opportunities through networking and have experience in high value sales and business development
* Deep understanding of the industry, competitive landscape, economic market issues, and the regulatory environment
* You have excellent people and problem-solving skills that help you build and maintain client relationships
* Strong communication skills with ability to work collaboratively and independently, provide assistance and build relationships


****Who We Are:****
 TD is one of the world's leading global financial institutions and is the fifth largest bank in North America by branches/stores. Every day, we deliver legendary customer experiences to over 27 million households and businesses in Canada, the United States and around the world. More than 95,000 TD colleagues bring their skills, talent, and creativity to the Bank, those we serve, and the economies we support. We are guided by our vision to Be the Better Bank and our purpose to enrich the lives of our customers, communities and colleagues.
   

  

 TD is deeply committed to being a leader in customer experience, that is why we believe that all colleagues, no matter where they work, are customer facing. As we build our business and deliver on our strategy, we are innovating to enhance the customer experience and build capabilities to shape the future of banking. Whether you’ve got years of banking experience or are just starting your career in financial services, we can help you realize your potential. Through regular leadership and development conversations to mentorship and training programs, we’re here to support you towards your goals. As an organization, we keep growing – and so will you.
   

  

**Our Total Rewards Package**
 Our Total Rewards package reflects the investments we make in our colleagues to help them and their families achieve their financial, physical, and mental well-being goals. Total Rewards at TD includes a base salary, variable compensation, and several other key plans such as health and well-being benefits, savings and retirement programs, paid time off, banking benefits and discounts, career development, and reward and recognition programs. Learn more
   

  

****Additional Information:****
 We’re delighted that you’re considering building a career with TD. Through regular development conversations, training programs, and a competitive benefits plan, we’re committed to providing the support our colleagues need to thrive both at work and at home.
   

  

 Please be advised that this job opportunity is subject to provincial regulation for employment purposes. It is imperative to acknowledge that each province or territory within the jurisdiction of Canada may have its own set of regulations, requirements.
   

  

**Colleague Development**
 If you’re interested in a specific career path or are looking to build certain skills, we want to help you succeed. You’ll have regular career, development, and performance conversations with your manager, as well as access to an online learning platform and a variety of mentoring programs to help you unlock future opportunities. Whether you have a passion for helping customers and want to expand your experience, or you want to coach and inspire your colleagues, there are many different career paths within our organization at TD – and we’re committed to helping you identify opportunities that support your goals.
   

  

**Training & Onboarding**
 We will provide training and onboarding sessions to ensure that you’ve got everything you need to succeed in your new role.
   

  

**Interview Process**
 We’ll reach out to candidates of interest to schedule an interview. We do our best to communicate outcomes to all applicants by email or phone call.
   

  

**Accommodation**
 Your accessibility is important to us. Please let us know if you’d like accommodations (including accessible meeting rooms, captioning for virtual interviews, etc.) to help us remove barriers so that you can participate throughout the interview process.
   

  

 We look forward to hearing from you!
   

  

****Language Requirement (Quebec Only):****
 Sans Objet

title: PROCESS OWNER PRE TRAVEL
description:
**Process Owner**
 SAS Customer Service annually manages millions of customer contacts in 12 languages via the help of our external partners and our own contact centers. Our exciting journey to build the future’s customer service has started and we aim to meet the changing demands of our customers. The journey will consist of many initiatives, with a strong focus on digitalization, automation, and process development. To support us on this journey we need a process owner for our Process Development team in Customer Service.
   

  

**Challenges You Will Work On**
 As a process owner you will have the overall strategic responsibility for processes within Customer Service. You are expected to make required changes related to reaching set goals and achieving the needed objectives by efficiently and continuously improving processes. You will work very closely with stakeholders in Customer Service to understand, define, improve, and develop our processes. As a process owner you also be a main contact point for other departments within SAS’ regarding changes in product and service concepts.
   

  

**As a Process Owner at SAS, you will work on:**
* Maintaining a strategic perspective on Customer Service’s processes within the area of Pre-Travel
* Driving the Pre-Travel cross-functional team within customer service
* Securing standardized customer handling and process adherence
* Using data and analytics to measure and evaluate our processes and improve process efficiency
* Defining technical needs to product owners to implement process improvements
* Prioritizing between possible process improvements
* Ensuring that efficiency and quality targets are met. Example of KPI’s: Cost and Customer Satisfaction Index
* Using a “lean” way of working to optimize processes and reduce cost
* Collaborating with internal stakeholders, such as Vendor Management, Sales and Operating Centers


**To Be Successful, We Believe You Should Have**
* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent education in a relevant field
* Experience in defining and deploying future-state processes and in identifying solutions from a customer, people, and technology perspective
* Experience of cross-functional collaboration
* Experience in prioritizing improvements based on impact of cost and customer satisfaction
* Experience in working with diverse team and internal stakeholders
* Good at expressing yourself in English, both verbally and in writing


**Experience We Consider Meriting**
* Process owner role
* Leading a team as a project manager or team lead
* Working with data and KPI-driven improvements
* Customer service processes and technology
* Lean
* Digitalization and automation
* Salesforce
* Working with reservation related systems
* Airline industry


**As a person we believe you are….**
 Interested in both people and technology and passionate about finding the most efficient way of working as well as building a network within SAS. We see that you have a natural drive of prioritizing, planning, and getting things done. You are a curious and unafraid problem solver down to the core and are driven to find the root cause of the problem.
   

  

**This is how we make your journey at SAS matter:**
* Purposeful: We are heading into a future where change is never-ending, and the need to rethink and rebuild is too. A future of conscious thoughts and sustainable innovation. A future we make possible. We fly because the world is moving, and it needs our help to stay in motion.
* Flexible: Office, Home, Norway, Copenhagen – wherever you are, Scandinavia is your home and flexibility is at our core
* Adventurous: We grow by making the world smaller. Discounted airline tickets providing you, your family and friends possibility to travel the world at great prices.
* Personal: Ingenuity and creativity are central to our work, We offer an opportunity to work on many challenges and initiatives
* Innovative: The restless pulse of our world offers endless possibilities to develop new customer solutions and new avenues for personal and professional growth. Working at SAS means contributing to and benefiting from a fast-paced, dynamic environment and playing a leading role by transforming aviation.
* Ownership: Opportunity of bringing initiatives from ideas into end-point delivery


**Other Of Importance**
* This position is located in Stockholm (SAS Head office in Solna/Frösundavik)
* Type of employment: Full time (100%)
* Desired starting date of employment: As soon as possible


**Does this sound like you?**
 Please send us your resume and cover letter as soon as possible, but no later than March 5th. Should you have any inquiries regarding the position, feel free to reach out to our Talent Acquisition Specialist, Rakhi Romarker (rakhi.romarker@sas.dk)
   

  

**We look forward to hearing from you!**

title: HR Generalist
description:
Are you an HR professional looking for a role where you can make an impact by co-creating and implementing HR strategies in a values-driven organization? As an HR Generalist at Greenpeace Nordic, you will be at the heart of shaping a positive work environment for employees across the Nordic region, supporting our people strategy, and driving our mission to protect the planet. You will have the opportunity to work alongside diverse teams, contribute to key People & Culture initiatives, and ensure the systems and processes are in place to help our people succeed.
 



  





**What We Believe In** 




 We are an equal opportunity employer with a longstanding commitment of providing a work environment that respects the dignity and worth of each individual. We value the benefits and strengths that diversity brings, and we thrive in an environment that encourages respect and trust. We promote equity, diversity and inclusion in our workplace and welcome applications from all sections of society. As a member of our team and organisation you naturally share and champion these values.
 



  





**About the Role** 




 In this role, you will work alongside the HR Director and another HR Generalist, ensuring smooth HR operations while supporting our strategic People & Culture initiatives. As part of our small, collaborative team, you will take ownership of key administrative processes, including payroll, data management, contract management, and reporting. You will engage directly with managers and employees, providing HR support, guidance, and advice. Additionally, you will contribute to projects aimed at enhancing efficiency and the employee experience, with a focus on areas like health, well-being, work environment, collaboration, and inclusion.
 



  





 A key priority for 2025 will be the continued implementation and optimization of our new HR system (HiBob), supporting the organization in driving efficiency gains.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 



* **HR Operations:** 
 Serve as the first point of contact for HR queries, manage employee data and systems, ensuring accessibility and compliance with Nordic labor laws.
* **Payroll & Benefits:** 
 Collaborate with payroll providers to prepare and manage monthly payroll across the Nordic region.
* **HR Projects:** 
 Support continuous improvement of our HR system (HiBob), including driving adoption, optimization, and integration with other systems.
* **Manager Support:** 
 Advise and support managers on employee-related matters, ensuring alignment with organizational goals.
* **Collaboration:** 
 Partner with IT, Finance, and other departments to streamline HR processes and provide expert support, ensuring seamless operations across the organization.



  





**What We Are Looking For** 




**Skills & Experience:** 



* Solid understanding of key HR processes and Nordic labor law
* Fluent in English and ideally one Nordic language (spoken & written)
* Experience in HR and payroll administration and coordination
* Strong ability to effectively use, implement, and optimize HR systems, ideally with experience supporting end users through change management
* Experience leading or contributing to HR projects and initiatives
* Experience in managing health & safety, driving ED&I efforts, or overseeing integrity initiatives (e.g., Code of Conduct training, case handling) is a particular advantage, as is interest or experience in agile methodologies



  





**Behaviors & Attributes:** 



* **Collaborative & Team-oriented:** 
 You excel in working within a diverse, inclusive team, sharing knowledge, and collaborating across functions. You build trust-based relationships to achieve common goals.
* **Organized & Structured:** 
 You are detail-oriented and efficient, able to prioritize and manage multiple tasks to meet organizational needs.
* **Proactive & Results-driven:** 
 You take initiative and deliver results, driving continuous development through consistent, practical action.
* **Adaptable & Flexible:** 
 You thrive in dynamic environments, adjusting quickly to meet evolving organizational needs.
* **Trustworthy & Professional:** 
 You handle sensitive information with integrity, maintaining confidentiality and the highest standards of professionalism.



  





**About Us** 




 Greenpeace is a global network of campaigning organizations working for a green and peaceful future. It comprises 26 independent national/regional Greenpeace organizations in over 55 countries, as well as a coordinating organization, Greenpeace International. We expose global environmental problems and drive positive change through research, lobbying, and non-violent direct action. For more information, please visit www.greenpeace.org.
 



  





**Why Greenpeace Nordic** 



* **Be part of a mission:** 
 Work in an organization that is making a tangible impact on global environmental issues.
* **Expand your expertise:** 
 Build on your existing HR knowledge, working alongside experienced professionals and gaining insights on a wide range of people-related matters.
* **Collaborative culture:** 
 Join a team that thrives on trust, openness, and mutual support, where your voice is heard and valued, and where you are also connected to colleagues in the Global Greenpeace Network.



  





**Additional Information** 




 This is a temporary position, starting as soon as possible (April 1, 2025 – June 30, 2026). The starting date can be flexible for the right candidate. Location: Stockholm, Copenhagen, Helsinki, or Oslo, with a slight preference for Stockholm, where the rest of the HR team is based.
 



  





 If you have any questions, feel free to contact Kim Lind (Nordic HR Business Partner) at kim.lind@greenpeace.org.
 



  





 We have a collective bargaining agreement between Fremia and Unionen / Akademikerna in Sweden. If you want to contact our local Union Club representatives, please email them on gpn.unionenklubben@gmail.com.
 



  





 Do not hold back on your application. We are eager to hear from you!

title: Financial Controller
description:
Do you want to help us unleash the secret to how happy employees create a happy business? We are an innovative, agile, and continuously growing modern tech company on a path to improving the work lives of millions around the world.
   

  

**We develop workforce management solutions** 
 - software that makes scheduling and time reporting more smooth and more flexible for almost a million users worldwide!
   

  

****We value passion, quality, innovation, trust, and collaboration** 
 .** 
 You’ll be given the opportunity to make an impact and directly contribute to our success, bring new ideas, and have full ownership of your area.
   

  

 Are you curious and ready to take the first steps on an awesome journey and make magic happen with us? As a member of Quinyx, you will be part of an inclusive and diverse workplace where everyone is allowed to be themselves and thrive.
   

  

*We have a hybrid working set up and therefore you will be required to attend our Stockholm office minimum twice per week.*
**About The Role**
 As a Financial Controller you will be responsible for the accurate and timely reporting of financial information within the group. With Quinyx's strong growth, you will also be a central part of the continued development of Quinyx's global financial processes and routines. You will manage different finance related development projects and processes to improve our way of working.
   

  

 The Finance team is mainly concentrated to Stockholm, although we work across all of our geos. We are working on a hybrid model where you can decide on where you prefer to work, but we make sure to meet our colleagues in our office at least twice per week.
   

  

 We are a social bunch of people who likes to hang out and typically you will see most of your 10 Stockholm Finance collogues in the office. Our main gathering event will be the team breakfast on Friday mornings, even though none of us would say no to a spontaneous fika any day of the week.
   

  

 Your colleagues will be masters in the fields of accounting, revenue controlling and business controlling. You will also work close with other teams in Quinyx, such as HR, Implementation, Sales, Marketing and Product Development and guide them in their interpretation of financial numbers.
   

  

**What You’ll Be Doing**
* Proactively develop, implement and improve Quinyx's financial processes, routines and working methods together with the CFO, Head of Accounting and Business Controller to enable the company's strong growth and international expansion. In particular, actively improve the use and implementation of our financial systems including accounting and FP&A.
