title: (Senior) Presales Consultant Sweden (m/f/d)
description:
#### **Your mission**


As a Presales Consultant for Strategic Customers, you will be the technical face of Matrix42, providing solution leadership in Enterprise Service Management, Endpoint & Security Management, Mobile Device Management, Asset Management, and ITIL practices. Working alongside our top-tier Sales and Presales teams, you will take ownership of strategic customer engagements, ensuring they receive the best solutions tailored to their needs. With our strong annual growth, this role also presents opportunities for future development.

  

* Take full technical responsibility for managing and expanding relationships with strategic customers (both existing and new).
* Design and present architecture blueprints tailored to complex enterprise environments (whiteboarding included!).
* Collaborate closely with stakeholders such as architects, service managers, and decision-makers in large organizations.
* Act as a thought leader and evangelist, driving our technical vision and strategy.
* Identify and design opportunities to expand customer relationships through innovative solutions.
* Help your colleagues to meet quarterly sales targets and objectives effectively
* Build the Matrix42 brand by presenting, promoting, and selling Matrix42 solutions within the marketplace
* Use a value-based selling strategy to demonstrate the financial and operational advantages of Matrix42 solutions to prospects and customers
* Cultivate and maintain strong relationships with assigned customers and prospects
* Foster trusted partnerships with local partners and integrators to drive growth, enhance value, and ensure customer satisfaction
* Collaborate closely with Pre-Sales and the broader ecosystem to deliver superior experience throughout the sales lifecycle
* Showcase product functionalities via on-site and remote demonstrations for customers, partners, and prospects.
* Develop long-term, tailored solutions for customers, fostering innovation and growth.
* Assist local sales teams and partners in crafting strong RFI/RFP responses and proposals.
* Lead proof-of-concept implementations to showcase real-world application and impact.
* Stay up to date with product developments, industry trends, and competitor insights.
* Represent Matrix42 at conferences, roadshows, technical workshops, and webinars.
* Act as a bridge between customers and Product Management, relaying valuable feedback to improve our solutions.

#### **Your profile**

**MUST HAVES**

  

* Solid experience in **Presales, Solution Engineering, Consulting, or Technical Sales** within Service and Endpoint Management.
* Strong ITSM/ITIL background, with knowledge of **Cloud Computing, IT Operations Management, Automation, Orchestration, and Hybrid Cloud Management**.
* A hands-on, team-oriented approach with a strong sense of reliability.
* Willingness to travel as needed.
* Fluent Swedish & English required, with strong presentation and communication skills

  

**NICE TO HAVES**  

* Ability to drive our vision through powerful storytelling and technical evangelism.
* Capability to design and guide customers through long-term technical strategies.
* Broad expertise in APIs, integrations, and system connectivity to enhance customer ecosystems.

#### **Our Benefits**


We could tell you all about the free fruit and drinks in the office, that you will have flexible working hours, 30 days of vacation or that remote work is part of everyday life. But in our eyes, that's not a benefit, it's standard.

#### **Your contact person**


Send us your application, including your salary requirements and earliest possible starting date, directly through our online portal via the "**APPLY**" button. If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to contact **Jessica Loren Meyer.**  

*We ask for your understanding that* ***MATRIX42*** *can only accept applications online via the applicant portal in connection with our applicant management system due to the currently valid EU data protection regulations.*

#### **About us**


Our ambition is to be the European choice of Enterprise Service Management Software!  

By using our platform, customers can manage IT and business processes, assets, endpoints, and identities for improved productivity, agility, security, and employee experience. By enabling digital working environments and IT self-service through holistic integration and automated processes, we digitalize and automate our customers' everyday tasks. Join our diverse team of over 600 professionals spread across Europe!  

  

We deeply care about our people and the work we do. Our culture is built on our strong values, and customer success is our top priority. Start your personal development journey with us, no matter if it is about personal or professional growth, we want you to reach your full potential through personalized goals and a life that you love.  

We want to do the right things - and do them right!  

  

Remote work is an essential part of everyday life, though we also deeply value the magic that happens when we all come together. Do you want to be part of building the European leader in service management software, and work in a culture that inspires you to grow? At Matrix42, you can!

description:

title: Data Warehouse Engineer
description:
**About Etraveli Group**


Etraveli Group is the globally leading company for tech solutions and fulfillment capabilities for online sales of flights. We are here to solve complexity, by connecting millions of flights and travelers across the globe, from search and selection to trip and beyond. We hold consumer online travel agency brands like Mytrip, GoToGate & Flight Network and serve exclusively Booking.com with flights. Etraveli Group has also established strategic partnerships with companies like Skyscanner, Google Flights and TUI.


Every day we strive to make the world smaller for our customers and bigger for our people. Our diverse team of more than 2900 passionate professionals is what makes us the industry’s tech wonder and the best in the world at what we do. Our major offices are in Sweden (HQ), Canada, Greece, India, Poland.

**Do you want to be part of the next step in our journey?**


At Etraveli Group we use a lot of data for decision making processes, analysis and machine learning. Users of data can be found in different departments of the organization, like Finance, Business Intelligence, Data Science, Customer Services but even IT Development and Operations. Data is important to us and that is why we are now establishing a new data warehouse solution in order to improve our abilities and performance. Therefore, in alignment with the growing targets and needs, we are looking for experienced engineers to become part of our newly-constituted team in Gothenburg.


**Who You Are**


With the right skill set and motivation you will be setting up, maintaining and evolving our data warehouse solution as well as participating in driving a large portion of our future data engineering.


In this primarily technical role, there will be close interaction with database administrators and operations’ engineers, but there will also be collaboration with stakeholders from other parts of our organization (e.g data analysts, business intelligence teams and business stakeholders). The data sources we use are located both in cloud environments as well as on-prem, therefore we are aiming for an essentially hybrid solution. As a new solution that it is and decisions upon implementation will be taken along the way, this is a rare opportunity for someone who wants to participate in shaping a data warehouse solution from the bottom up. Working with us means you'll have access to a team of highly competent professionals and ample resources to foster your personal and professional growth. We face the challenges of the day working for a company that goes the extra mile to ensure that we have fun at, and outside, the office.

**Requirements**

**To thrive and succeed in this role we believe that you have/are:**

* A strong interest in setting up, maintain and evolve a data warehouse solution
* Ability to analyze and take on tasks, both individually and together with others
* Ability to design and implement tasks from scratch, individually gathering the necessary information where needed
* Previous knowledge and experience in working with data warehousing technologies and methods
* Previous knowledge and experience in working with data warehousing technologies and methods including information modeling
* Previous experience working with data processing and distributed query engines, like Spark, Dremio/Trino
* Previous experience working as a data engineer, with different ETL and CDC tools
* Previous experience working with multiple scripting languages, like Bash, Python, SQL, etc

**It is also desirable that your skills match one or more of the following:**

* Previous experience to ensure high-performance data processing with techniques like indexing, partitioning, and caching.
* Previous experience working with data integrations
* Previous experience working with data modelling for efficient query performance and quality
* Previous experience working as a database administrator
* Comfortable working with Linux, Docker, and preferably also Kubernetes

**Benefits**


At Etraveli Technology, you will be part of a group of +200 people, all with different cutting-edge skills and personalities. We believe that it is precisely the differences that make us a good team because we share the same ambition - we strive for the same goals, are passionate about what we do and work hard.


When working at Etraveli Group you will always feel that you are trusted and that you can rely on others to help you. To work together as a team and feel that you are challenged in a way that helps you evolve within your profession. You will have awesome colleagues together with whom you will solve complex problems in a fast-moving business.


But not just that.

* Brand New Office in the City, located in the heart of Gothenburg at Merkurhuset, close to public transport and great lunch spots
* Inclusive Culture Celebrating Diversity; a vibrant team representing 33+ nationalities and cultures as well as regular cultural events and celebrations to share traditions from around the world
* Afterworks & social gatherings to unwind, socialize, and strengthen team bonds
* Breakfast at the Office every morning to start the day right
* Conferences, Workshops and other opportunities for personal and professional growth
* Wellness Benefit; annual healthcare allowance for gym memberships, massages, or other wellness activities, as per Swedish Tax Agency guidelines.
* Comprehensive Pension and Health Insurance; full coverage through partners, ensuring quick assistance in case of illness or injury.
* Hackathons and Dev Weeks

*At Etraveli Group we value diversity; we pride ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds. During hiring, we are committed to ensure equality and promote diversity in the workplace at every selection stage. As such, we provide the same opportunities for all candidates regardless of race, religion or belief, gender, nationality, ethnicity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, or any other characteristic protected under any anti-discrimination law or regulation.*


Welcome to Etraveli Group.

title: Data Warehouse Engineer
description:
About Etraveli Group
  
Etraveli Group is the globally leading company for tech solutions and fulfillment capabilities for online sales of flights. We are here to solve complexity, by connecting millions of flights and travelers across the globe, from search and selection to trip and beyond. We hold consumer online travel agency brands like Mytrip, GoToGate & Flight Network and serve exclusively Booking.com with flights. Etraveli Group has also established strategic partnerships with companies like Skyscanner, Google Flights and TUI.
  
Every day we strive to make the world smaller for our customers and bigger for our people. Our diverse team of more than 2900 passionate professionals is what makes us the industry’s tech wonder and the best in the world at what we do. Our major offices are in Sweden (HQ), Canada, Greece, India, Poland.
  
Do you want to be part of the next step in our journey?
  
At Etraveli Group we use a lot of data for decision making processes, analysis and machine learning. Users of data can be found in different departments of the organization, like Finance, Business Intelligence, Data Science, Customer Services but even IT Development and Operations. Data is important to us and that is why we are now establishing a new data warehouse solution in order to improve our abilities and performance. Therefore, in alignment with the growing targets and needs, we are looking for experienced engineers to become part of our newly-constituted team in Gothenburg.
  
Who You Are
  
With the right skill set and motivation you will be setting up, maintaining and evolving our data warehouse solution as well as participating in driving a large portion of our future data engineering.
  
In this primarily technical role, there will be close interaction with database administrators and operations’ engineers, but there will also be collaboration with stakeholders from other parts of our organization (e.g data analysts, business intelligence teams and business stakeholders). The data sources we use are located both in cloud environments as well as on-prem, therefore we are aiming for an essentially hybrid solution. As a new solution that it is and decisions upon implementation will be taken along the way, this is a rare opportunity for someone who wants to participate in shaping a data warehouse solution from the bottom up. Working with us means you'll have access to a team of highly competent professionals and ample resources to foster your personal and professional growth. We face the challenges of the day working for a company that goes the extra mile to ensure that we have fun at, and outside, the office.
  
Requirements
  
To thrive and succeed in this role we believe that you have/are:
  
A strong interest in setting up, maintain and evolve a data warehouse solution
  
Ability to analyze and take on tasks, both individually and together with others
  
Ability to design and implement tasks from scratch, individually gathering the necessary information where needed
  
Previous knowledge and experience in working with data warehousing technologies and methods
  
Previous knowledge and experience in working with data warehousing technologies and methods including information modeling
  
Previous experience working with data processing and distributed query engines, like Spark, Dremio/Trino
  
Previous experience working as a data engineer, with different ETL and CDC tools
  
Previous experience working with multiple scripting languages, like Bash, Python, SQL, etc
  
  

It is also desirable that your skills match one or more of the following:
  
Previous experience to ensure high-performance data processing with techniques like indexing, partitioning, and caching
  
Previous experience working with data integrations
  
Previous experience working with data modelling for efficient query performance and quality
  
Previous experience working as a database administrator
  
Comfortable working with Linux, Docker, and preferably also Kubernetes
  
  

Benefits
  
At Etraveli Technology, you will be part of a group of +200 people, all with different cutting-edge skills and personalities. We believe that it is precisely the differences that make us a good team because we share the same ambition - we strive for the same goals, are passionate about what we do and work hard.
  
When working at Etraveli Group you will always feel that you are trusted and that you can rely on others to help you. To work together as a team and feel that you are challenged in a way that helps you evolve within your profession. You will have awesome colleagues together with whom you will solve complex problems in a fast-moving business.
  
But not just that.
  
Brand New Office in the City, located in the heart of Gothenburg at Merkurhuset, close to public transport and great lunch spots
  
Inclusive Culture Celebrating Diversity; a vibrant team representing 33+ nationalities and cultures as well as regular cultural events and celebrations to share traditions from around the world
  
Afterworks & social gatherings to unwind, socialize, and strengthen team bonds
  
Breakfast at the Office every morning to start the day right
  
Conferences, Workshops and other opportunities for personal and professional growth
  
Wellness Benefit; annual healthcare allowance for gym memberships, massages, or other wellness activities, as per Swedish Tax Agency guidelines.
  
Comprehensive Pension and Health Insurance; full coverage through partners, ensuring quick assistance in case of illness or injury.
  
Hackathons and Dev Weeks
  
  

At Etraveli Group we value diversity; we pride ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds. During hiring, we are committed to ensure equality and promote diversity in the workplace at every selection stage. As such, we provide the same opportunities for all candidates regardless of race, religion or belief, gender, nationality, ethnicity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, or any other characteristic protected under any anti-discrimination law or regulation.
  
Welcome to Etraveli Group.
  
As part of this recruitment process, we will be conducting background checks. You will be able to read more information and give your consent to this process in the application form.

title: Analytics Engineer
description:
We are Happy Socks, an innovative fashion company that specializes in designing and producing unique, high-quality fashion items. We sell directly to consumers through our online and physical channels, as well as wholesale to a range of partners. We leverage technology to drive business insights and operational efficiency. At Happy Socks, we are hard at work creating our new Data Platform! We are now looking to add a permanent Analytics Engineer to lead our growing data engineering team. This role will oversee the completion of the initial project, shape our overall data strategy, and guide data modeling and transformation initiatives. Our data team plays a crucial role in shaping our data-driven culture and enabling decision-making across the organization.


Role Overview:


We are looking for a strategic Analytics Engineer to lead our data engineering initiatives and team. In this role, you will oversee the design, implementation, and maintenance of scalable data pipelines and infrastructure including project managing the outcomes of 1-2 data engineers. A key aspect of this role is the ability to quickly build comprehensive mental models of all the data we have, translate business requirements into technical specifications, and guide your team in implementing solutions. You will work closely with analytics specialists, analysts, and other engineers to ensure clean, reliable, and well-structured data is available for business decision-making. You will also lead the planning, design, and architecture of the data foundations project, resulting in a comprehensive roadmap for our Data Platform.


Key Responsibilities:

* Architect and oversee the operational health of data pipelines and systems, establishing monitoring frameworks and quality standards.
* Project managing the outcomes of a small team of data engineers, providing technical guidance and ensuring best practices in implementation.
* Drive data quality initiatives and establish governance frameworks throughout all stages of data processing.
* Guide the design and implementation of scalable data pipelines to support ELT/ETL processes and data warehousing, working with various data sources and ingestion/transformation tools.
* Partner with analytics specialists, analysts, and other teams to translate business requirements into technical specifications.
* Oversee the maintenance and evolution of our Data Warehouse architecture.
* Define data modeling and transformation frameworks aligned with business processes, ensuring proper implementation by the team.
* Establish standards for serving data in downstream applications like reports or dashboards.
* Drive the implementation of best practices for versatility, reliability, ease of maintenance of the data platform as well as data governance, security, and compliance. Guide the optimization of data storage solutions, focusing on performance, cost, and scalability.


Requirements:

* Strong technical background with hands-on experience in data engineering, capable of providing technical leadership and mentoring.
* Proven ability to translate complex business requirements into technical specifications. Experience project managing technical teams and managing deliverables.
* Strong communication skills with the ability to bridge technical and business stakeholders.
* Strong knowledge of SQL and familiarity with programming languages (e.g., Python).
* Experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP) and understanding of data pipeline tools (e.g., Airflow, Fivetran).
* Familiarity with data transformation tools like DBT.
* Strong knowledge of data storage technologies such as Snowflake, relational databases, NoSQL, or data lakes.
* Ability to guide troubleshooting of data-related issues and optimize data flows.


Nice to Have:


Knowledge of GDPR regulations and experience in data privacy frameworks. Experience with data visualization and reporting tools like Sigma. Understanding of machine learning workflows and supporting data requirements. Previous experience in retail or e-commerce domains.


Most importantly, you have the personality to fit a somewhat crazy, fun work environment where we believe in color and playfulness, a place where you can expect the unexpected and you are a source of creative weirdness.

title: VP Sales - UCaaS Platform - Central Europe
description:
**We help Service Providers in Europe and the Middle East to grow their B2B with the SaaSiest UCaaS Platform on the planet! O****ur UCaaS platform integrates their fixed and mobile voice services, and serving small to large businesses with Fixed, Mobile, Phone system, AI, Integrations, Analytics, Collaboration, and Omni features. Telavox group is growing and profitable, with +1.6bsek in revenue and a team of +400 Telavoxers in nine countries.**  

  

**About the role**  

Our service provider customers are MNO’s and Cloud PBX & VoIP Carrier’s that distribute our UCaaS service combined with their product portfolio. We now seek to continue building our footprint and reputation amongst the Operator networks in Europe and for this we need a result-driven VP Sales UCaaS Europe to lead the way.
  

  

As VP Sales UcaaS at Telavox your main responsibility and mission is to drive revenue growth and expand the European market presence of Telavox mobile UCaaS solution for Telecom Operators.  

  

**Main responsibilities:**

* New business development and responsibility for the entire sales process from pipeline development to closing new deals.
* Partner with cross-functional teams, inside the Operator as well as Telavox, to drive a customer-centric product offering, and successfully deliver customer solutions.


The location preferred for this position is Central or Southern Europe.
  

  

**About you ‍**  

We are seeking a professional with deep expertise in telecom software solutions and a strong network across European Operators. You hold a Bachelor's in Business or Telecommunications, with an MBA preferred. You are fluent in English, with additional European languages as a bonus.
  

  

You bring a proven track record in sales, pipeline management, and service delivery within the European telecom market. As a person, you are resilient, customer-focused, results-driven, and excel at building relationships and driving business growth.  

  

**Key capabilities:**

* Market insight and network: Comprehensive understanding of European regulations and key players, with a strong operator network.
* Telecom expertise: In-depth knowledge of VoIP, SIP trunking, UCaaS, and MNO/Service Provider business models.
* Sales and Partnerships: Skilled in developing pipelines, negotiating complex contracts, and securing high-value partnerships.
* Technical knowledge: Proficient in solution selling and data-driven decision-making.

Service Delivery: Experienced in managing projects from contract to completion, ensuring on-time, within-budget delivery.  
* 

**Are you interested in joining Telavox? Apply now!**  

Reach out to Recruiter Hanna Lindkvist at Hanna.Lindkvist@telavox.com if you have any questions.

 **Learn more about what we do! ️**

title: Business Development Representative (BDR) – Nordics
description:
**Join Pexip – Where Innovation Meets Career Growth**

  



At Pexip, we empower businesses with cutting-edge video collaboration and communication solutions, enabling seamless, secure, and scalable interactions across the world. We work with some of the largest enterprises and government organizations, solving complex communication challenges with our innovative technology.



We are looking for a highly motivated Business Development Representative (BDR) to join our Stockholm team, focusing on the Nordic market. This role is perfect for someone eager to develop a long-term career in SaaS sales, working alongside industry-leading experts in a fast-growing company.

  


**Why Join Us?**


* **Fast-Track Your Career:** This is more than just a sales role – it’s a stepping stone into enterprise sales, with clear career progression and mentorship from top sales professionals.
* **Learn from the Best:** Work closely with experienced Account Executives, leadership, and a global network of sales and technology experts who will help you sharpen your skills and accelerate your growth.
* **Make an Impact:** You will be at the forefront of solving fundamental communication challenges for enterprises across the Nordics, helping them improve efficiency, security, and collaboration.
* **Be KPI-Driven & Mission-Focused:** This is a high-energy, target-driven role where you will play a critical part in building our sales pipeline, directly contributing to Pexip’s growth and success.

  


**What You’ll Be Doing**


* **Lead Generation & Prospecting:** Identify and engage potential customers through outbound outreach (cold calling, social selling, email, and LinkedIn).
* **Problem-Solving Conversations:** Understand customer pain points around communication and collaboration and position Pexip as the right solution.
* **Sales Pipeline Growth:** Qualify leads and schedule high-value meetings for Account Executives to drive sales opportunities.
* **Data-Driven Execution:** Track and optimize your outreach efforts in CRM tools like Salesforce to meet and exceed KPI targets.
* **Collaboration & Learning:** Work closely with Sales, Marketing, and Partner teams to refine messaging, sales tactics, and go-to-market strategies.

  


**What We’re Looking For**


* 2-3 years of experience in SaaS sales, meeting booking, or junior business development.
* Passion for solving real-world communication challenges through technology.
* Experience with outbound prospecting and cold calling in a B2B setting.
* Highly motivated, KPI-driven, and eager to build a career in sales.
* Strong communication skills, with the ability to engage senior stakeholders.
* Familiarity with Salesforce, sales automation tools, and prospecting techniques.
* Fluency in Swedish and English (other Nordic languages are a plus).

  


**What We Offer**


* **Career Acceleration:** Clear progression paths into enterprise sales and business development.
* **World-Class Training:** Learn directly from top sales professionals in SaaS.
* **Supportive Culture:** Work in a dynamic, team-oriented environment where your growth is a priority.
* **Competitive Salary & Commission:** Earn based on your impact and contribution.
* **Hybrid Work Flexibility:** Balance office collaboration with remote working.


If you’re driven by impact, excited about technology, and hungry to learn and grow, Pexip is the place for you. Join us and be part of something bigger – shaping the future of enterprise communication.



Apply today and let’s build something great together!

  


**In Pexip we strive to:**


* Put people and culture first in everything we do.
* Care about our health and take employee wellness seriously.
* Promote a flat organization and embrace freedom and responsibility, aligned to accountability and performance goals.
* Proudly play the role of a technology enabler in the innovation ecosystem of our industry and have a fantastic team of incredibly talented people working here. You will work with them on disruptive and ambitious projects that move our industry forward.
* Build a resilient and inclusive culture. We promote openness where people can grow, thrive, and succeed at work.
* Build a fun learning culture. That does not only mean cookies-in-the-jar but making everything we do every day enjoyable.

  


**Sounds interesting? We want to meet you!**

  


**About Pexip:**



Pexip enables enterprises and organizations of any size to deploy and use video-based communication and collaboration. The Company’s portfolio of products ranges from self-hosted software to cloud service video solutions. Pexip provides seamless collaboration between previously incompatible video and audio technologies such as professional video conferencing systems, Skype for Business, Microsoft Teams, Google Hangouts Meet, and WebRTC. Pexip’s software-based meeting platform can also be used as a foundation for service provider offerings.



Pexip has HQ in Oslo, Norway, with main offices in; London - UK, Herndon - US, Stockholm - Sweden, Paris - France and Sydney - Australia, as well as sales offices across the globe.



The Pexip culture builds on a strong foundation of solid values. We are passionate and love what we do. We believe in the power of video communication, and together we work to enable people to communicate better and more efficiently. At Pexip, work is not a place, but a part of your life, and something you enjoy to the fullest. Every day, we are committed to making work simpler, more productive, and more efficient for all our customers.



Pexip is an equal opportunity employer and evaluates applicants regardless of an individual’s age, race, color, gender, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, or veteran status. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Diversity and culture are what make Pexip so unique!
company_description: Pexip is a multinational corporation based in Oslo, Norway that develops Unified Communications software enabling human collaboration through the use of video, audio and web communication technologies

title: Identity & Access Management (IAM) Specialist
description:
*Are you ready to redefine the financial industry? Does a serious technical challenge make your heart beat faster? Do you give energy to those who work with you and are you looking for an energy boosting work environment? Then Nordnet is the place for you!*


**Your role**


Help us go towards cloud 2030. As a technical IAM specialist at Nordnet, you will play an important role in managing and enhancing the backbone of our access management platform, with a specialized focus on access management. Your responsibilities will include ensuring secure, efficient, and scalable solutions within our access management framework and working towards being fully cloud ready 2030.



A techie with drive. Your closest colleagues will be the Access Management Process Owner and other system specialists, and together you will collaborate to further improve the IAM experience at Nordnet. You like to be technically hands-on doing analysis, development, implementation and maintenance. The main systems you’ll be working with are IdentityNow, Entra ID/Azure and Active Directory.


*As Identity Access Management Specialist, you*

* Oversee day-to-day management and continuous improvement of Nordnet's identity management systems, ensuring they meet security, compliance, and user experience standards. From support requests to e.g. access certifications, role based access configuration, application integrations, SSO and new improvements.
* Work closely with the Access Management Process Owner and other system specialists to align identity management strategies with broader access management goals i.e. towards cloud solutions.
Stay informed of industry trends and best practices in identity management, proposing and implementing improvements to our platform. This of course includes a healthy budget for relevant events and/or education if needed.  
* 

**Background**


*You are well versed in the following*

* Identity and Access Management
* Microsoft Entra ID/Azure AD
* Microsoft Active Directory

*Good to have*

* Sailpoint IdentityNow Security Cloud and/or IdentityIQ
* Google Workspace and/or Cloud Identity
* Experience from implementing and operating IAM solutions
* Experience from banking and finance


You are fluent in English in writing and speaking.  



  

**We offer**


We offer you the opportunity to work in a Nordic environment with a strong focus on delivery, product development and technology. Our ambitions are high and you will embark on a fast and challenging journey together with a skillful team of sharp and committed colleagues.


Culture is built and cared for, each day by everyone. We’re proud of ours. Having a flat organization where anyone can talk to anyone creates a warm and friendly atmosphere worth protecting. We believe in a culture where every effort counts and where everyone is being recognized. A culture embracing our core values – passion, simplicity and transparency on all levels, no matter who you are or what you do.


We are over 900 employees in Stockholm, Oslo, Helsinki and Copenhagen.


Visit us on: www.nordnetab.com and https://career.nordnetab.com

 **Questions & applications**


If you have questions, please contact Talent Acqusition Partner, Keri Bergström Käll at keri.bergstrom.kall@nordnet.se.


Please apply today by using the button below – we will start interviewing immediately. Please note that we do only accept applications through our recruitment system, hence no email applications will be considered.


We want to inform you that Nordnet conduct credit, drug test and background checks as a part of the recruitment process.


We look forward to receiving your application.

title: SAP Plant Maintenance Project Manager

title: Data Protection and Compliance Analyst
description:
About Ekco
  
  

Founded in 2016 Ekco is now one of the fastest growing cloud solution providers in Europe!
  
  

We specialise in enabling companies to progress along the path of cloud maturity, managing transformation and driving better outcomes from our clients’ existing technology investments.
  
  

️ In a few words, we take businesses to the cloud and back!
  
  

We have over 1000 highly talented and supportive colleagues (and counting) across a number of regional offices in the UK, Benelux, Ireland, South Africa & Malaysia.
  
  

The role
  
  

As a Data Protection & Compliance Analyst, you will join a vibrant, growing organisation, driving compliance efforts and safeguarding data privacy within Ekco. Your primary focus will be on leading data protection assessments, managing regulatory compliance risks, and embedding robust data protection practices across IT systems and processes.
  
  

A strong understanding of GDPR, data protection regulations, and compliance frameworks is essential, supported by a proven track record in managing data protection programmes. This includes handling data subject access requests, managing data breaches, conducting privacy and transfer impact assessments, and maintaining records of processing activities. The ideal candidate will thrive in a proactive, detail-focused role, keeping pace with evolving regulations and best practices.
  
  

In addition to data protection responsibilities, you will support Ekco's broader compliance activities, contributing to the maintenance and improvement of the Integrated Management System (IMS), which encompasses compliance with ISO/IEC 27001, ISO 9001, ISO 14001, ISO 22301, ISO/IEC20000-1, and ISAE 3402, among others.
  
  

Key Responsibilities
  
  

**Data Protection Activities (Under the Guidance of the DPO):**  

Serve as a contact for data protection matters across the organisation.
  
Assist in managing and maintaining data protection policies and processes.
  
Conduct DPIAs and ensure privacy by design principles are applied in projects.
  
Handle data subject access requests and data breach management.
  
Deliver data protection training and awareness initiatives.
  
  

**Governance, Risk & Compliance Support:**  

Conduct risk assessments for data protection, IT governance, and compliance frameworks.
  
Analyse and evaluate policies and procedures to ensure compliance with standards (e.g., GDPR, ISO 27001, ISO 22301, ISO 14001, ISO 9001, ISO 20000).
  
Support audits and risk assessments by preparing documentation and facilitating reviews.
  
Monitor regulatory changes and update internal policies accordingly.
  
Support bids, tender opportunities and customer assurance activities.
  
Coordinate documentation for the IMS management review process.
  
Develop and deliver training programmes on GRC and regulatory compliance.
  
Generate regular reports on GRC activities, risks, and compliance efforts.
  
  

**Culture & Collaboration:**  

Foster a culture of risk awareness and compliance throughout the organisation.
  
Collaborate across departments to ensure adherence to best practices.
  
  

Key Requirements
  
  

**Skills & Abilities:**  

Professional-level English communication skills (written and verbal).
  
Exceptional problem-solving ability with adaptability under pressure.
  
Self-motivated and capable of delivering in high-pressure environments.
  
Detail-oriented with excellent presentation and organisational skills.
  
Strong teamwork and collaborative mindset, prioritising team success over personal goals.
  
Able to build and maintain effective relationships across all levels of the organisation.
  
Capable of working independently and collaboratively within a team.
  
Proficient in identifying and resolving potential issues proactively.
  
  

Benefits/Perks
  
  

️ Time off - 25 days leave + public holidays
  
x1 day Birthday leave per year
  
Company Pension Scheme (employer contribution 5%) + flexible salary sacrifice
  
Employee Assistance Programme (EAP) - access to dedicated mental health, emotional wellbeing and general advice
  
‍️ EkcOlympics - a global activity for fun!
  
Learning & development - Unlimited access to Pluralsight learning platform
  
A lot of responsibilities & opportunities to grow (also internationally)
  
  

Why Ekco
  
  

️ Microsoft’s 2023 Rising Star Security Partner of the year
  
VMware & Veeam top partner status
  
Ranked as 4th fastest growing technology company in the Deloitte Fast50 Awards
  
Ekco are committed to cultivating an environment that promotes diversity, equality, inclusion and belonging
  
We recognise the value of internal mobility and encourage opportunities for internal development & progression
  
Flexible working with a family friendly focus are at the core of our company values

title: Relationsbyggande Säljare B2B
description:
Vill du vara en del av en energifylld arbetsmiljö där sammanhållning och gemenskap står i fokus? Som Säljare för B2B erbjuder vi en spännande möjlighet för dig som brinner för försäljning att att ta nästa steg i karriären!
  
  

Ditt nya jag, i vårt lag
  
  

Vi på Telesales Företag är ett sammansvetsat team som fokuserar på att skapa starka och långvariga relationer med våra kunder, samtidigt som vi arbetar mot tydliga mål. Vi tillhandahåller Tres mobila lösningar till både befintliga och nya kunder och du kommer aktivt att bygga och hantera din egen kundbas för att säkerställa återkommande kunder. Vi ser till att du får alla förutsättningar och verktyg för att utvecklas i din roll som säljare, med kontinuerlig coaching och utbildning.
  
  

Några av våra medarbetare
  
Julia Maxén
  
Gruppchef
  
"Jag vill att mitt team ska få de bästa förutsättningarna för att göra sitt jobb på bästa sätt. Det är så vi utvecklar oss som team, men även utvecklar Tre framåt."
  
Henrik Sundvall
  
Digital projektledare
  
"Det absolut bästa med att vara projektledare på Tre är jag får jobba brett med kollegor från alla delar av organisationen och få lära mig nya saker varje dag. Jag har friheten att vara mig själv – och bli uppskattad för det!"
  
Jayasri Battola
  
Utvecklare
  
"The great work culture and the technology made me choose Tre. Working alongside great people in mixed team setups, with both experienced and new talents, along with the latest and greatest tools and technologies like Cloud and Azure."
  
  

Vi söker dig
  
  

Som har tidigare erfarenhet av att arbeta med försäljning och brinner för att skapa meningsfulla relationer. Du värdesätter samarbete och tar stort ägandeskap i dina arbetsuppgifter. Vi tror på att skapa en balans mellan service och skicklig försäljning, och vi värdesätter din förmåga att framgångsrikt bygga starka och långvariga relationer. Hos oss är det driv och vi söker dig som delar vårt fokus på mål.
  
  

Vi erbjuder dig
  
  

En gedigen introduktion och löpande utbildning för att ge dig de bästa förutsättningarna att lyckas i rollen
  
Jobb på heltid (måndag till fredag) med grundlön, obegränsad provisionsmöjlighet och en attraktiv kvartalsbonus
  
En roll på en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser (jajamen, även 2025 är vi utsedda till en av de bästa av Great place to work)
  
En företagskultur vi är mycket stolta över, som inkluderar roliga tävlingar, aktiviteter och awards.
  
  

Välkommen med din ansökan!
  
  

Vi tar emot ansökningar via denna annons och kommer hålla intervjuer löpande. Personligt brev behövs inte, men vi vill gärna att du svarar på några frågor vi ställer i samband med att du söker. Vi använder tester för att säkra objektiva bedömningar i samband med urval. Tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag. Bakgrundskontroll genomförs på slutkandidat.
  
  

Varmt välkommen till oss på Tre!
  
  

Vi har riktigt bra förmåner
  
  

Friskvårdsbidrag, föräldrarlön, pension & försäkringar enligt kollektivavtal
  
  

Flexibla helgdagar och fem dagar extra ledigt per år
  
  

Hundzon & gym i 3huset
  
  

Subventionerad lunch
  
  

Förmånliga rabatter på cyklar, kollektivtrafik och elbilar
  
  

Generösa bonusmodeller eller provisioner
  
  

Vi drivs av att hela tiden försöka göra saker bättre, på nya och annorlunda sätt. Vi ser oss själva som en avgörande del av Sveriges samhällsstruktur, eftersom vi vet att pålitlig uppkoppling är en viktig grundsten i dagens digitala värld.
  
  

Tre föddes som utmanare och är en organisation i ständig rörelse. Vi strävar efter att vara i framkant i allt vi gör. Vi är övertygade om att det är människorna och kulturen på Tre som är avgörande för vår utveckling.
  
  

När du startar din resa på Tre finns det oändliga möjligheter att växa och utvecklas med oss.
  
  

WE THINK LIKE CHALLENGERS - I en föränderlig värld, är vi på Tre nyfikna och ständigt öppna för nya lösningar. På Tre anpassar vi vägen framåt allt eftersom vi provar och lär oss vad som funkar bäst.
  
  

WE WORK LIKE CHAMPIONS - På Tre gör vi alltid vårt bästa. Vi känner ägandeskap för vår uppgift, sätter tydliga mål och håller fokus på det som gör mest nytta för affären.
  
  

WE ACT LIKE BUDDIES - På Tre är vi schyssta kollegor. Vi samarbetar med varandra över team och funktioner, vi bollar idéer, ger och tar emot feedback.
  
  

2003
  
Tre först i Sverige med videosamtal och strömning av mobil video. Att se personen som du ringer upp i ögonen är en helt ny upplevelse vid den här tidpunkten.
  
  

2006
  
Tre lanserar mobilt bredband som tredje operatör i världen. Under de kommande fem åren vinner Tre pris för Sveriges snabbaste mobila bredband.
  
  

2013
  
Tre’s systerbolag Hallon startas med en vision att vara den enkla mobiloperatören utan onödigt krångel.
  
  

2019
  
Ett händelserikt år! 3Världen lanseras som innebär att kunder kan surfa i 80 länder till samma pris som inom Sverige. Därefter lanseras 3Samla som gör att alla kunder kan lägga till fler användare till sitt abonnemang och sist men inte minst är Tre först i Sverige med ett lansera ett publikt 5G-nät.
  
  

2025
  
Tele2 Arena byter från 1 januari namn till 3Arena. Med vår starka passion för innovation, uppkoppling och upplevelser ska vi medverka till arenans och områdets utveckling.
  
  

Mireille Senghore | Kontaktperson

title: Patent Professional
description:
**Join our Team**
-----------------

 **About this opportunity**  

Today, Ericsson owns one of the ICT industry's most valuable portfolio of patents. The global patent portfolio consists of 60,000 granted patents within the areas of cellular technology, consumer electronics, cloud, networks and beyond. Ericsson’s Patent Creation Management is part of the global Ericsson GFGS IPR & Licensing Organization and is responsible for all inventions originating from all Ericsson R&D sites all over the world.  

We are now expanding our teams in Sweden and are looking for motivated patent attorneys (preferably qualified or partly qualified) looking to contribute to one of the industry’s largest patent portfolios. You will work for a company that is dedicated to research and innovation, leading the development of cellular technology including 5G, 6G and beyond.

 **What you will do**  

* Provide IPR support for Ericsson’s R&D operations wherein you will work closely with inventors and innovative technology in the area of 3GPP Radio standardisation. In this role you will in particular focus on building a world class patent portfolio related to 6G radio standardisation.
* Handling inventions in all stages from R&D project support, patent application filing and prosecution, and coordination of national filings up to grant in close cooperation with R&D, other patent professionals, and patent offices all over the world.
* Evaluate inventions and take value-based filing and prosecution actions including the drafting of claim charts.
* Participating in key projects supporting licensing and litigation such as business driven claim chart generation and rebuttal and participating in technical discussions.
* Collaborate and communicate with domestic and foreign outside counsel.
* Depending on your qualification and interest you will engage in patent portfolio management, oppositions and/or nullity actions to contribute to the value creation from our patents.
* Engage in working groups and projects to improve operations and strategies.
 **You will bring**  

* A degree in Engineering, Physics, Computer Sciences, or equivalent providing a strong technical foundation.
* Proven experience in patents such as Patent Attorney Qualification (also partly qualified) or working as a patent examiner or patent engineer & patent portfolio manager in the telecom sector.
* Understanding of telecommunication technologies, in particular radio air interface.
* A keen interest in technical, business and legal matters. Previous experience as an inventor, involvement in standardization, or project management will be an advantage.
* Analytical thinking and an eye for detail, paired with a solution-oriented approach.
* Adaptability in various situations and collaborative teamwork, with skills in coordination and communication.
* The ability to work independently and manage multiple tasks and activities as a team member. At Ericsson, we have a hybrid working environment which allows for flexibility to work remotely but also comes with an expectance to be in the office at least part of each week to meet colleagues in person.
* The people skills required to work with a diverse group of engineers, patent professionals, and paralegals located around the globe.
* The motivation to learn and improve internal processes and tools.
* Proficiency in English.
  

Please make sure to indicate in your application which location you are interested in joining.

**Application**  

We look forward to your application with CV in English. We target 60% work-from-the office.  

Last day to apply: 2nd of March, 2025  

Please note that we do not accept, proceed, or respond for applications sent via e-mail.


If you have specific questions, you are welcome to contact Sofia Sjögren Lindmark, Director Patent Unit Kista 3, at sofia.sjogren.lindmark@ericsson.com or Raheleh Rouhani, Sr. Recruiter at raheleh.rouhani@ericsson.com


Location: Stockholm, Linköping, Lund, Göteborg, Sweden

 **Why join Ericsson?**


At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.  

  

**What happens once you apply?**


Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.


Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.

**Primary country and city:** Sweden (SE) || Stockholm

**Req ID:** 761871

title: Chief Technology Officer
description:
We’re Talentium, a fast-growing startup revolutionizing human capital management. We’re looking for a Chief Technology Officer (CTO) who can balance strategic leadership with hands-on technical work. If you thrive in a fast-paced environment, love solving technical challenges, and have experience in SaaS or scaling companies in high-growth environments, we want to hear from you.
  
-
  
Key Responsibilities
  
* Define and execute the technical vision: Develop a clear roadmap for Talentium’s technology to support current goals and future growth.
* Lead and inspire the engineering team: Build, mentor, and manage a high-performing technical team, fostering a culture of ownership and innovation.
* Stay hands-on with development: Participate in system design, and problem-solving when necessary to set the standard for technical excellence.
* Oversee architecture and infrastructure: Ensure our systems are scalable, secure, and optimized for performance and reliability.
* Drive operational excellence: Manage sprint cycles, monitor progress, and ensure projects are delivered on time and to the highest standards.
* Collaborate cross-functionally: Work closely with the CEO, product managers, and other stakeholders to align technology with business objectives.
* Innovate with emerging technologies: Integrate AI, machine learning, and other advancements to maintain Talentium’s competitive edge.
* Troubleshoot and optimize systems: Oversee system reliability, quickly addressing any challenges to minimize downtime and improve performance.


**What we're looking for:**  

\*
  
  

* Experience: 7+ years in technical leadership roles, with proven success scaling SaaS platforms or working in high-growth environments.
* Technical expertise: Deep knowledge of modern programming languages, cloud platforms (preferably GCP), and scalable system design.
* Leadership skills: A team builder and mentor with a track record of fostering collaboration and accountability.
* Operational mindset: Skilled in managing sprint cycles, prioritizing tasks, and delivering on deadlines.
* Hands-on approach: Willing to dive into technical challenges, debug issues, or contribute code when needed.
* Problem-solving ability: Adept at tackling complex challenges and finding innovative, scalable solutions.
* Strong communicator: Able to bridge the gap between technical and non-technical teams with clear, concise communication.
* Prestigeless attitude: Comfortable balancing strategic leadership with operational execution.

title: Marketing & Content Interns
description:
- Devoteam G Cloud is an award-winning Google Cloud partner known for its innovative and collaborative culture. With a team of over 600 Google Cloud experts, we deliver cutting-edge solutions to businesses across the globe. Our Stockholm office is a hub for creativity and technological advancement.

  
We're looking for talented interns to join our team in **Stockholm** this spring ( **February - May 2025** ). Are you passionate about content, SEO, and design? Or do you thrive in the fast-paced world of marketing and events? We have exciting opportunities in two key areas:


* **SEO & Content:** Boost your skills in content creation, SEO, design, and event planning. Contribute to blog posts, social media content, website updates, and more.
* **Marketing:** Dive into social media management, email campaigns, market analysis, and event coordination. Help us reach new audiences and promote our services.

  
* Currently pursuing or recently completed a degree in marketing, communications, business, or a related field.
* Excellent communication and social media skills.
* Basic understanding of SEO, analytics, and content creation.
* Strong teamwork abilities and eagerness to learn.
* Ability to create visual content (designs, videos, etc.) is a plus.

  
- **What You Gain:**


	* **Hands-on experience:** Apply your skills to real-world projects and make a tangible impact.
	* **Mentorship:** Learn from experienced professionals and Google Cloud experts.
	* **Networking opportunities:** Build connections with leaders in the tech industry.
	* **Cutting-edge knowledge:** Gain insight into the world of cloud computing and the latest Google Cloud technologies.
	* **Personal and professional growth:** Develop your skills and confidence in a dynamic and supportive environment.**Additional Information:**

This is an **unpaid** internship opportunity based in our **Stockholm** office.


**Apply Now!**

Tell us which role you think you're best suited for (SEO & Content or Marketing) and submit your CV along with a motivational letter explaining why you're the perfect fit for Devoteam G Cloud!

title: Data Analyst
description:

 1. Use SQL (through Google Cloud Platform) and potentially further programming languages to gather, clean and prepare data for analysis.
 



 2. Data visualization in Power BI and Looker Studio.
 



 3. Present data and insights to stakeholders in a clear and simple way.

title: IT Director
description:
**IT Director – Shape the Future of IT at POC** 
  
 



  





 At POC, we are a safety and performance pioneer on a global mission: protect lives and reduce the consequences of accidents for athletes and anyone inspired to be one. Born and based in Stockholm, Sweden, we challenge the status quo with research, science, and cutting-edge technology to create safer, better-performing products. 
 



  





 Now, we are looking for an IT Director to lead and transform our IT function, driving innovation, efficiency, and value across the business. If you’re ready to shape IT strategy, work hands-on with technology, and turn ideas into action in a collaborative, fast-moving environment, this is your chance to make a real impact. 
 



  





  
 



**The Role** 




  





 We are looking for a strategic IT Director to lead and optimize our technology landscape, ensuring it drives business growth and value. This role is about maximizing the impact of IT investments, improving system efficiency, and strengthening IT security and reliability while ensuring seamless integrations, system performance, and cost-effective IT operations to support business goals. 
 



  





 Key priorities include enhancing IT architecture to support future scalability, streamlining integrations, and future-proofing systems for an eventual ERP replacement. You will also optimize existing set-up, outsourced services and internal expertise, ensuring IT resources are aligned with business needs while driving greater value. 
 



  





 With expertise in ERP, eCommerce platforms, B2B tools, and cloud services (Microsoft 365, Intune), you will lead critical system architecture decisions and oversee key projects like software migrations, system upgrades, and workflow automation. You’ll also play a pivotal role in improving communication and project management, ensuring IT initiatives are well-coordinated, minimize disruption, and secure strong user adoption. 
 



  





 Beyond strategy, you will manage a small, dynamic IT team, coordinate external vendors, and oversee smooth daily IT operations. This role is ideal for someone who thrives in a fast-paced, global environment, balancing hands-on problem-solving in a growing company with long-term IT vision to enable business success. 
 



  





  
 



**To be successful in this role, you are likely to have:** 
  
 


* A bachelor's degree or higher in computer science, information systems, or a related field.
* At least 10 years of relevant IT management experience.
* Have experience with leading a team (minimum 2-5 people), and enjoy doing so
* Strong proficiency in IT systems and infrastructure, with expertise in cloud-based environments (Microsoft 365, Intune), IT security, network administration, and system integrations across ERP, eCommerce, and B2B platforms.
* A strategic and analytical mindset, with the ability to translate business requirements into IT solutions and roadmaps.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to influence and engage stakeholders at all levels.
* A customer-oriented and collaborative approach, with the ability to foster a culture of continuous improvement.
* Proven ability to build and maintain strong relationships with business stakeholders, IT teams, and external vendors.
* Familiarity with ITIL frameworks and experience managing operations in a mid-size growth company.



  
 



  





**Why you should join POC** 
  
 



  




* You will be able to shape and evolve the department, working hands-on with technology while being deeply embedded in the business.
* The impact of your work will be tangible, moving fast from idea to execution to results.
* We are a collaborative, passionate team, where IT needs to be closely connected to the entire business. You will work alongside skilled colleagues who are just as eager to share knowledge as they are to push boundaries.
* While we take our work seriously, we believe in balance. Whether it's lunch rides, outdoor training sessions, or product testing, we embrace an active lifestyle. Plus, with a generous health allowance, insurance, and discounts on our award-winning products, you will experience POC’s mission firsthand - protecting lives and enabling performance.
* If you are looking for a place where your expertise makes a real impact, where IT is both strategic and hands-on, and where you are never far from decision to action, this is the role for you.



  
 



**What now?** 
  
 



  





 If you feel you are a great fit for this role, send your CV and cover letter to application@poc.com. Please apply via the e-mail and
 **not** 
 the built-in application function on LinkedIn as we will exclusively be looking at e-mail applications. We will review applications on an ongoing basis, although fully close the application window on 21st of February.

title: Infrastructure Engineer
description:
**Set off to your next adventure with us as an Infrastructure Engineer. We look for you with an analytical mind, eagerness to learn, and drive to excel across Sellpy’s technical infrastructure.** 




  





**We are proud to be one of the fastest-growing scale-ups in Sweden and the leading service for second hand goods in Europe. We’ve seen rapid growth during the last few years, and today we list half a million new items for sale every week!** 




  





 To accomplish our vision of empowering everyone to live circularly, we need fantastic employees who want to grow with us. That’s why we’re on the lookout for an Infrastructure Engineer to help us take Sellpy to the next level.
 



  





**Infrastructure Engineer at Sellpy** 




 In this role, you will gain broad exposure to all aspects of Sellpy’s technical infrastructure. Reporting directly to our CTO, you will work closely with them on a variety of tasks, ranging from cloud orchestration to network design. This is a demanding position that requires the ability to think and work both strategically and operationally. You will take ownership of our infrastructure, growing with the role and responsibility to optimise our cloud environment for performant and cost-effective scalability.
 



  





**In short, you will** 



* Design, deploy, and maintain scalable infrastructure solutions with AWS services like CloudFront, Lambda, EC2 and S3.
* Manage cloud services (e.g., AWS and GCP).
* Optimise our MongoDB database to enable efficient querying at scale.
* Manage on-premise networking hardware.
* Automate infrastructure deployment using tools like AWS CDK and CI/CD pipelines.
* Monitor system performance, ensuring reliability, uptime, and security.
* Collaborate with our Engineering teams to optimise infrastructure for applications.
* Troubleshoot and resolve infrastructure-related issues promptly.
* Ensure infrastructure adheres to compliance and best practices.
* Stay updated with new tools and technologies to improve infrastructure efficiency.



  





**Requirements** 



* At least 2 years of work experience in a similar role.
* Confidence to stand on your own feet, as you will take ownership of your tasks and drive them independently.
* The curiosity to explore unknown areas that you haven’t worked with before.
* Great communication skills in English.



  





**We’d be impressed if you have** 



* A bachelor's or master's degree in computer science or engineering.
* Experience working with AWS-services like CloudFront, S3 and EC2.
* Experience with MongoDB or SQL databases.
* Experience with logging and health monitoring solutions.
* Worked in a fast-growing, product-focused startup environment.
