title: Infrastructure & Cloud Engineer
description:
Join OX2 and use your skills to drive the great transition towards a sustainable future. OX2 is a professional and ambitious company committed to accelerating access to renewable energy to speed up the transition to clean energy. We offer a dynamic and inspiring workplace that enables seamless, cross-functional collaboration to achieve optimal results. At OX2, we empower you with the freedom and responsibility to make great things happen and create a lasting impact.
 



  





**About the Position** 




 OX2 is expanding geographically into new markets and adopting innovative technologies to drive our digital transformation. We operate in a hybrid environment that blends cutting edge cloud services with essential on premises systems. To support our growth, we’re seeking an enthusiastic and proactive Infrastructure and Cloud Engineer who will bridge these environments and lead initiatives that ensure our IT ecosystem is secure, scalable, and agile.
 



  





 This is a strategic role within our growing IT team, where you’ll work closely with business stakeholders, external partners, and internal teams. Reporting directly to the Manager of Infrastructure (IT/OT), you’ll be expected not only to provide technical expertise but also to take a leadership role in driving projects forward and delivering tangible results.
 



  





 Your Responsibilities Include:
 


* Develop and implement a strategic infrastructure plan aligned with business goals.
* Assess emerging technologies and industry trends to enhance on-premises and cloud environments.
* Design and architect scalable solutions across Azure, AWS, GCP, and on-premises systems.
* Act as a technical lead, driving projects from conception to optimization.
* Lead cross-functional projects using methodologies like Agile and Waterfall.
* Manage timelines, resources, and stakeholders to ensure on-time project delivery.
* Take full initiative and decision-making responsibility in complex projects.
* Oversee network design and management, including firewalls, VPNs, DNS, DHCP, and routing.
* Develop lifecycle management plans for networking solutions.
* Maintain and optimize cloud and on-prem environments for performance, security, and cost efficiency.
* Automate administrative tasks using PowerShell, Python, or other scripting languages.
* Improve Infrastructure as Code (IaC) practices for agile deployments.
* Implement and enforce security policies and compliance standards (ISO 27001, NIST).
* Manage identity and access solutions (Active Directory, cloud-based IAM).
* Design, implement, and test monitoring, backup, and disaster recovery solutions for business continuity.
* Promote a culture of continuous improvement and process innovation.



  





**We Are Looking for Someone Who:** 




 The ideal candidate possesses extensive technical expertise and hands-on experience with cloud platforms and hybrid environments, including Microsoft Azure, AWS, and Google Cloud Platform. You have a strong background in on-premises systems and networking technologies such as firewalls, VPNs, DNS, DHCP, and routing. Additionally, you bring a solid understanding of DevOps practices and orchestration through Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools. Proficiency in automation and scripting using languages like PowerShell and Python, along with familiarity with modern IT frameworks, further strengthens your skill set.
 



  





 Beyond technical expertise, the candidate demonstrates project management capabilities. You have a proven ability to lead cross-functional projects from inception to completion. A proactive and self-driven mindset is key.
 



  





 A natural curiosity for emerging technologies and a commitment to continuous learning are fundamental traits of this role. The candidate is passionate about exploring innovative solutions and staying up to date with industry trends.
 



  





 In terms of education, a Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Computer Science, IT, System Administration, or a related field is preferred, though equivalent work experience is also valued. Relevant certifications, such as those from Microsoft, AWS, or Google Cloud, are considered a strong advantage. Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English are required, while fluency in Swedish is a plus.
 



  





**Does this sound interesting? We welcome your application!** 




 If you have questions about the position, please contact Charlotta Skogar at charlotta.skogar@novare.se or 0761-66 48 78. Interviews are conducted continuously, so please send your application as soon as possible.

title: Uppsökande säljare inom IT-hårdvara med fokus på nya kunder
description:
Nu söker vi en driven nykundsäljare med erfarenhet inom IT-hårdvara som vill bli en del av Iver och som vill vara med och bidra till bättre IT-lösningar som gör skillnad för våra kunder! Vi söker dig som har en förmåga att göra komplex IT enkel och som gillar att upprätthålla värdefulla kundrelationer. På Iver är lagandan stark och nu har du chansen att bli en del av vårt framgångsrika säljteam inom Iver. Är du vår nya kollega?
   

  

**Om Rollen**
 Ivers erbjuder bland annat en komplett livscykelhantering för datorer och mobila enheter – från logistik och asset management till återbruk och hållbar återvinning. Tjänsten erbjuder en komplett arbetsplats med konfigurerade och färdiginstallerade datorer och/eller mobila enheter med möjlighet att skräddarsy support, administration av applikationer, uppdateringar och policys. Det är en flexibel och skalbar lösning för våra kunder, som är enkel att skala upp och ner.
   

  

 Affären växer och vi satsar på att utveckla området inom Iver. Vi söker en engagerad och målinriktad säljare som brinner för att hitta nya affärsmöjligheter och skapa långsiktiga kundrelationer inom IT-hårdvara. Du kommer att ha en nyckelroll i att leda hela säljcykeln med allt från att identifiera affärsmöjligheter, kvalificering, utveckla lösningen, skriva offerter, prissättning, skapa presentationer för ledande befattningar, förhandla och stänga affärer.
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifter**
* Aktivt och uppsökande bearbeta nya kunder inom olika branscher och segment.
* Bygga och utveckla kundrelationer från första kontakt till långsiktiga samarbeten.
* Identifiera kunders behov av IT-hårdvara och presentera skräddarsydda lösningar som skapar värde och effektivitet.
* Leda presentationsmöten, demonstrationer och förhandlingar med potentiella kunder.
* Arbeta självständigt för att nå och överträffa individuella försäljningsmål.
* Samarbeta med vårt tekniska team för att säkerställa att våra lösningar möter kundernas krav och behov.
* Regelbundet rapportera och följa upp försäljningsaktivitet och resultat.


**Vad erbjuder vi dig?**
 Iver - We empower our Nordic society. Hos Iver får du möjlighet att arbeta med den senaste tekniken och vara med på en spännande tillväxtresa. På Iver är vi inkluderande och strävar efter genuint samarbete där vi arbetar mot gemensamma mål. Inom Iver finns stora möjligheter till utveckling och vi står bakom dig när du vill lära dig mer – inom ditt specialområde, ledarskap eller nya områden. Hos Iver är du också en del av ett ambitiöst och innovativt företag, vilket innebär att förbättra, testa, utvärdera och våga ändra hur vi gör saker är viktiga ingredienser och vi är övertygade om att det är så vi utvecklas.
   

  

**Din profil & Bakgrund?**
 För att lyckas i rollen hos oss tror vi att du har dokumenterad framgångsrik erfarenhet av uppsökande försäljning inom IT-branschen, gärna inom IT-hårdvara. Du brinner för att göra affärer genom personligt engagemang, innovativa lösningar och kompetens i framkant, med målet att vara en långsiktig och hållbar partner. I rollen kommer du att möta kunder och nyckelpersoner i ledande befattningar och behöver ha förmågan att snabbt bygga förtroende. Vi lägger stor vikt vid personlig lämplighet och vill att du utvecklas tillsammans med oss, både som säljare och medarbetare för att bidra till arbetsglädje, vår tillväxt och ett bra kundbemötande.
   

  

**Vi Söker Dig Som**
* Är van att skapa nya affärsmöjligheter genom proaktivt prospektering och kallringning.
* Har en god teknisk förståelse för IT-hårdvara och kan snabbt sätta dig in i kunders behov av produkter och relaterade lösningar.
* Är en självständig, målmedveten och resultatinriktad person som trivs med att jobba i en snabb och föränderlig miljö.
* Är van att arbeta med CRM-system och följa upp aktiviteter och resultat på ett strukturerat sätt.
* Talar och skriver flytande svenska och engelska.
* B-körkort.


**Placeringsort**
 Iver finns på 25 platser i Sverige och Norge. Denna tjänst utgår från vårt kontor i Solna men du kommer att bearbeta affären inom hela vår marknad.
   

  

**Sök till oss!**
 Urval sker löpande, tjänsten kan tillsättas före sista ansökningsdag. Iver eftersträvar en jämn könsfördelning och värdesätter etnisk och kulturell mångfald. Önskad start är snarast eller enligt överenskommelse. Sista ansökningsdag är 2025-03-16. Du är välkommen att kontakta Henrik Olsson (henrik.olsson@iver.se) vid eventuella frågor eller funderingar kring tjänsten. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

**We empower our Nordic society** 
 . Iver är en ledande nordisk helhetsleverantör av molnbaserade IT-tjänster med spetskompetens inom drift, cybersäkerhet, cloud och innovation.
   

  

**Våra tjänster är kritiska inte bara för våra kunder – utan för digitaliseringen av samhället i stort.** 
 Vi säkerställer att sjukvården har tillgång till rätt patientdata, att samhällskritiska system aldrig ligger nere och att flygplanen landar säkert. Som en lyhörd och affärsnära helhetspartner möjliggör vi våra kunders innovation – idag och imorgon.

title: Data Engineer
description:
My client is a leading European IT services provider, offering innovative and high-quality technology solutions to businesses across various industries.
 



  





 With over 9000 employees, this organisation has a strong focus on digital transformation, delivering end-to-end services ranging from cloud computing, data analytics, and IT infrastructure management to software development and system integration.
 



  





 The company prides itself on its family feel and customer-centric approach, working closely with clients to understand their unique needs and provide tailored solutions that drive efficiency and business growth.
 



  





 This organisation have offices across Europe – including significant operations in the Benelux and Nordic regions.
 



  





 As a result of growth they are looking for talented Data Engineers and Consultants to join the growing practice in Sweden which currently employs around 60 people.
 



  





**What You'll Do:** 




  




* Design and build robust data pipelines using Microsoft Azure technologies.
* Develop and optimize data storage solutions using SQL Server, Azure SQL, or Cosmos DB.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate data from various sources.
* Implement scalable data processing and analytics solutions.



  





**Skills We're Looking For:** 




  




* Proficiency in Microsoft Azure (Azure Data Factory, Azure Databricks, Azure Synapse Analytics).
* Strong SQL programming skills and experience with relational databases.
* Familiarity with data modeling, ETL processes, and data warehousing concepts.
* Ability to work in an agile environment and manage multiple priorities.



  





**Why Join Us:** 




  




* Opportunity to work on innovative projects using cutting-edge Microsoft Technologies.
* Collaborative and inclusive work culture that values creativity and growth.
* Competitive compensation package with excellent benefits (including wellness allowance, insurances and 30 days vacation).



  





  





*Thank you for your interest in this opportunity. If your application is successful, we will contact you to discuss the position in more detail within 48 hours of receiving your CV. Please assume your application has been unsuccessful if you do not hear back from us within 48 hours.*

title: Marketing & Communications Coordinator
description:
**About Us**
 We are the independent expert in assurance and risk management. Driven by our purpose, to safeguard life, property, and the environment, we empower our customers and their stakeholders with facts and reliable insights so that critical decisions can be made with confidence.
   

  

 As a trusted voice for many of the world’s most successful organizations, we use our knowledge to advance safety and performance, set industry benchmarks, and inspire and invent solutions to tackle global transformations.
   

  

**About Business Assurance**
 We help companies ensure compliance, build high-performing management systems, and meet competence needs within a wide range of industries. DNV helps companies understand Working with us, you can be involved in technically challenging and innovative projects worldwide demanding a broad variety of expertise. Our strong focus on research and innovation opens an array of opportunities, and allows you to engage in projects which develop next generation solutions. and manage their risk picture through our management system certification and training portfolios.
   

  

**About The Role**
**Are you ready to transform communication into a powerful tool for business success?**
 As our
 **Marketing & Communications Coordinator** 
 , you will be at the forefront of crafting and executing communication strategies that not only support lead generation but also elevate our brand in Sweden. If you have a talent for translating strategic objectives into compelling narratives, this is your chance to make a significant impact!
   

  

 In this dynamic role, you'll manage lead generation and nurturing across social media, email campaigns, and website, in a multi-channel approach that ensure alignment with our brand's voice. you'll lead the creation and distribution of impactful marketing assets, including white paper, newsletters, presentations, and digital content.
   

  

 Additionally, you'll play a key role in internal engagement, event coordination, and PR efforts, driving visibility for DNV Business Assurance across the industries in focus.
   

  

 This is your chance to collaborate with key stakeholders in an international environment and elevate our messaging to new heights, shaping how we connect with the customer and reinforcing our commitment to excellence.
   

  

**Your Responsibilities**
* Develop and Implement: Design and roll out communication strategies and initiatives across digital and physical channels to boost performance and lead generation in a multi-channel approach.
* Collaborate for Impact: Partner with Sales, Business Development, Operations, and other internal stakeholders to launch targeted campaigns that deeply resonate with specific market segments, in alignment with the global strategy.
* Lead Initiatives: Execute go-to-market communication plans, including engaging events, impactful webinars, co-branding activities, content marketing, and vibrant digital/social campaigns.
* Drive Continuous Improvement: Monitor and analyze key metrics to optimize strategies, ensuring sustained growth and effectiveness.
* Budget Management: Oversee the local communication budget, ensuring the successful execution of plans aligned with corporate guidelines.


 What we offer
   

  

* A stable environment within a world-leading company in business assurance.
* The opportunity to make a real impact, working with a dynamic, hands-on team.
* Hybrid working options from our Swedish office.
* Competitive compensation package with flexible work arrangements.
* Excellent learning opportunities and access to cutting-edge tools and platforms.


 DNV is an Equal Opportunity Employer and gives consideration for employment to qualified applicants without regard to gender, religion, race, national or ethnic origin, cultural background, social group, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, age or political opinion. Diversity is fundamental to our culture and we invite you to be part of this diversity.
   

  

**About You**
**What You Bring:**
* Educational Background: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in marketing communications discipline
* Experience: A minimum of 3 years in a similar role
* Digital Expertise: Strong understanding of digital, web and social media marketing techniques, including email marketing, digital campaigns, content marketing and web-based campaigns.
* Technical Skills: Familiarity with marketing tools such as Optimizely CMS, Oracle Sales Cloud CRM, Eloqua, GoToWebinar, Canva and other content platforms preferred.
* Channel Experience: Hands-on experience with go-to-market channels, including events, digital, social, and email marketing.
* Industry Knowledge: Familiarity with the certification market is a plus.


**Your Soft Skills**
* Adaptable & Proactive: Thrive in dynamic environments by taking the initiative and adjusting to changing circumstances.
* Collaborative Spirit: A natural team player with a knack for building strong, productive relationships.
* Customer-Centric Focus: Always prioritise the customer experience in every effort you undertake.
* Organisational Skills: Highly organised and adept at managing multiple projects effectively under pressure.
* Results-Driven: Passionate about delivering impactful communication that drives measurable outcomes. Adaptable and able to take initiative in dynamic environments.

title: AI Engineer
description:
**About us** 




 Avy is transforming the housing experience by enabling property companies to provide a modern, seamless service for their residents. Our platform helps reduce operational costs, create new revenue streams, and enhance tenant satisfaction - all through an intuitive digital experience.
 



 For over six years, Avy has been shaping the digital housing experience together with its customers, partners, and employees. As the leading Tenant Experience platform in the Nordics, we reach more than 400,000 households - approximately 20% of all tenants in Sweden. Our mission is to push boundaries and redefine what it means to live in a rental home - making it more sustainable, seamless, and secure.
 



  





**Role Description** 




 As an
 **AI Engineer** 
 at Avy, you will be at the forefront of integrating artificial intelligence into our platform, driving innovation and optimizing our business operations. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to design, develop, and deploy AI-driven solutions that enhance automation, decision-making, and user experience. With expertise in generative AI and Machine Learning, you will explore cutting-edge AI technologies, create prototypes, and implement applied AI/ML solutions on top of the rest of our platform and it's features.
 



  





 Your
 **impact** 
 on our platform and our end-users (~20% of rental tenants in Sweden) is going to be
 **instant** 
 !
 



  





 Areas where we are investing most of our applied AI efforts today are our vertically focused AI Copilot which is fine-tuned for property industry and is helping both property owners and tenants in their every-day lives.
 



 Another area is Insights where we are applying advanced ML techniques in order to go beyond classical BI and enable our users to leverage AI and ML on top of the data they create and consume in our platform.
 



  





**This role requires creating Applied AI/ML solution
 
 in Golang.**




  





**Qualifications:** 



* **Bachelor’s, Master’s or PhD degree** 
 in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence, or a related field.
* Experience in utilizing AI technologies in every-day work
* Fluency in using AI code assistant
* Experience writing production-ready Golang code
* Proven experience with generative AI and deploying AI models into production.
* Experience working with various NLP, LLM and related machine learning concepts
* Programming skills in Python, TensorFlow, PyTorch, or similar AI frameworks.
* Experience with cloud-based AI solutions
* Knowledge of big data processing, optimization techniques, and model scalability.
* Ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams, including engineers, designers, product managers or business developers.
* Strong problem-solving skills and a passion for staying up to date with the latest AI advancements.
* Experience with responsible AI practices, including model interpretability, bias mitigation, and data privacy.
* Familiarity with both open-source and proprietary AI solutions is a plus.
* Excellent communication skills and the ability to present AI concepts to stakeholders effectively.



  





**What we offer:** 



* Opportunity to shape the technical direction of a fast-growing prop-tech scale-up
* Collaborative and innovative work environment
* Competitive salary and benefits package
* Professional development opportunities
* Chance to work on cutting-edge technologies and solve complex problems



  





**Location (on-site):** 




 Stockholm, Sweden
 



  





*For this position, Avy is working with internal recruitment resources and is not accepting external agencies. Those kind of requests will not be answered.*

title: Mid-Senior Full Stack Engineer
description:
**About Sinch**
 Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses — including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others — rely on Sinch's Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
   

  

 Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
   

  

 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple", and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation!
   

  

**Description**
 Develop, architect and scale the core infrastructure for Sinch's web applications. Be part of in a small cross functional team that sets its own objectives and goals with responsibility for every stage of product development life cycle from planning and design to implementation, testing, deployment, monitoring and maintenance, you build It you run it.
   

  

 Your work will be focused around the common platform used to that makes up the core of the product line; The code you write will be consumed by used by many different teams and is a key enabler in the product line. You will solve problems across the enterprise, focusing not only on how to deliver a great product today but setting the foundations for the future.
   

  

**Tech Stack:** 
 NodeJS, Java, React, Typescript
   

  

**Requirements**
* A strong software engineering background
* In-depth knowledge of the web platform and ecosystem
* Expertise in modern front-end technologies.
* Solid track record working with Typescript in a professional or open-source setting.
* Experience building services on the backend
* Fluency in English


**Good to have**
* Experience using design systems
* Experience making architectural decisions that have high impact
* Experience with Web components and the latest Web APIs
* Experience with AWS, Kubernetes and other cloud native technologies


**Our Hiring Process**
 We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
   

  

 We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: https://www.sinch.com/careers/. No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!

title: Salesforce Developer
description:
As a Salesforce developer, you will play a crucial role in supporting all Salesforce users within Strawberry to deliver on the business strategy of the company. You will be involved in the continuous improvement, customization & support of Salesforce
   

  

 This role will give you an opportunity to work across different business entities in Strawberry helping them to reach their strategic goals.
   

  

 If you are passionate about technology, development & to grow your skill set towards the Salesforce platform this is a great opportunity to join a team devoted to reshaping the future for our customers, employees & guests at Strawberry.
   

  

**What Your Responsibilities Will Be**
* Design, code, and implement Salesforce applications.
* Ability to brainstorm with Salesforce Architect to implement the best solution, following best practices and reaching development goals.
* Test the stability and functionality of the application.
* Troubleshoot and fix bugs.
* Write documents and cross-train technical skills towards our Salesforce staff.
* Maintain the security and integrity of the application software.
* Perform reviews on Salesforce data and security.
* Assist with the integration of Salesforce with other systems.
* Keep abreast of new Salesforce features and functionality and provide recommendations for process improvements.


**What Qualifications And Skills We Require**
* Proven experience with 3-5 years as Salesforce platform development & Programming skills
* APEX, Javascript, LWC, and Sales Cloud experience
* Advantage: Service Cloud and CPQ experience
* Experience with Salesforce.com developer toolkit including Apex Classes, Controllers and Triggers, visualforce, Force.com IDE, Migration Tool, Web Services & visualstudio.
* Proficiency in SOQL, Java, JavaScript, and HTML, and familiarity with SQL and databases.
* Ability to work collaboratively in a diverse team environment.
* Detail-oriented and self-motivated, with a passion for continuous learning and staying up-to-date with Salesforce advancements.
* Strong analytical skills to assess business requirements, identify customer problems, and develop effective solutions within the Salesforce platform.
* Exceptional problem-solving skills to troubleshoot and fix bugs, ensuring the smooth operation of Salesforce applications and platforms.
* Clear communication skills for explaining complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders, and for working effectively within a team of other developers and project managers.
* Ability to manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously, demonstrating a strong sense of prioritization and organization.
* Experience with Agile methodologies and working within Scrum teams is Preferred
* Salesforce certification, such as Certified Platform Developer I and II, is highly beneficial
* BSc degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or relevant field.
* Fluency in English mandatory, preferred to have Norwegian/Swedish


**Start:** 
 As soon as possible
   

  

 The role is to be based in Strawberry head office in Solna, Sweden
   

  

 If you have any further questions about the role please contact:
   

  

 CRM & Loyalty Platform Owner: ove.gundersen@strawberry.no
   

  

**NB!** 
 We are not interested in any consultancies for this position as the current ones are to be replaced with internal resources and we do not sponsor any visa applications

title: Tjänstearkitekt It-verksamhetstjänster
description:
Vill du vara med och forma framtidens digitala samhälle? Nu har du chansen att kliva ombord på vår resa mot en innovativ och digitaliserad framtid, där vi inte bara stärker It-tjänster och drift för våra egna system utan även för andra statliga myndigheter. Vi bygger en ny dynamisk enhet full av kompetens och driv, och vi vill att du ska vara med och göra skillnad. Är du redo att vara en del av något stort? Var med och gör samhället möjligt!
   

  

**Om jobbet**
 Som it-arkitekt hos oss får du en central roll i att driva den tekniska utvecklingen framåt. Du kommer att vara länken mellan teknik och verksamhet samt vägleda utvecklingsteam och beslutsfattare mot framtidens lösningar. Ditt fokus kommer ligga på it-verksamhetstjänsterna, där du blir en viktig del av vårt arkitektteam på vår enhet Skatteverkets Tekniska Tjänster (STT). Vi har ett uppdrag att leverera stabila, samordnade och kostnadseffektiva tekniska tjänster inom it utveckling, infrastruktur och it-drift. Vi tillhandahåller it tjänster för Skatteverket och våra samverkansmyndigheter. Enheten har även det övergripande ansvaret för Skatteverkets gemensamma målarkitektur.
   

  

 Du kommer att ha ansvar för att ta fram nuläges- och nylägesbild av arkitekturen för området genom roadmaps och tjänstemodeller, göra omvärldsanalys av relevant verksamhet och teknik samt att ta fram förslag och beslutsunderlag till områdesspecifika arkitekturbeslut. Du kommer även att ta fram och underhålla arkitekturroadmap och säkerställa att arkitekturen följs.
   

  

 Hos oss får du en flexibel och stimulerande arbetsmiljö där vi uppmuntrar till egna initiativ och idéer. Med stor frihet och ansvar kombinerar du en meningsfull arbetsvardag med balans mellan jobb och fritid. Du kommer att få möjlighet att utvecklas både i bredd och på djupet – och inte minst vara en del av en arbetsplats där vi har roligt tillsammans och samtidigt skapar verklig samhällsnytta.
   

  

 Här kan du läsa mer om hur det är att jobba med it hos oss och ta del av vad några av våra medarbetare berättar om sina jobb: Jobba med it hos oss
   

  

 Din placeringsort är Sundbyberg.
   

  

**Om dig**
 För att göra ett bra jobb och trivas hos oss på Skatteverket behöver du vara lyhörd, tänka nytt och ta ansvar. I arbetet är gott omdöme och förståelse för rättssäkerhet och säkerhet viktigt. Du ska också leva upp till vår medarbetarpolicy
   

  

 I det här jobbet ska du:
   

  

* ha god kommunikationsförmåga
* ha ledarskapsförmåga
* ha god samarbetsförmåga
* ha ett strukturerat arbetssätt och god leveransförmåga
* ha helhetssyn
* ha god problemlösningsförmåga, se mönster och kunna göra avgränsningar.
* ha god förmåga att kommunicera på svenska och engelska i tal och skrift.


 Du ska även ha:
   

  

* relevant högskoleutbildning om 180hp/120p inom it eller annan utbildning i kombination med arbetslivserfarenhet som arbetsgivare bedömer relevant för rollen
* flerårig aktuell och relevant arbetslivserfarenhet av att leda och stötta andra arkitekter och team i arkitekturella förändringar
* flerårig aktuell och relevant arbetslivserfarenhet av It-arkitekturarbete inom komplexa It-organisationer, som tex. myndighet eller annan stor organisation.


 Det är önskvärt att du har aktuell kunskap och arbetslivserfarenhet av agil utveckling. Det är också önskvärt att du har en certifiering eller dokumenterad utbildning inom It-arkitektur samt kunskap om ServiceNow eller liknande ITSM-verktyg/arbetssätt. Det är också önskvärt att du har kunskap om övervakning/observability.
   

  

**Bra att veta**
 Anställningen är tillsvidare och kan inledas med provanställning i sex månader.
   

  

 En anställning hos oss kan innebära placering i säkerhetsklass. En säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) kan därför komma att genomföras före beslut om anställning. För en del av våra arbetsuppgifter i säkerhetsklass krävs svenskt medborgarskap.
   

  

 På skatteverket.se/jobb kan du exempelvis läsa om vår samhällsbärande roll, fördelarna med att jobba hos oss och hur det går till när du söker våra jobb.
   

  

 När du ansöker bifogar du ditt cv. Vi använder inte personligt brev i våra rekryteringar och du ska därför inte bifoga det i din ansökan.
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

 Skatteverket har en samhällsbärande roll. Vårt arbete berör alla privatpersoner och företag och genom vårt uppdrag bidrar vi till ett väl fungerande samhälle. Vår utveckling är kunddriven och vi samverkar med andra för att skapa effektiva lösningar. Tillsammans gör vi samhället möjligt.
   

  

 Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Sundbyberg | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2025/119 | Kontakt: Violet Sabetkar, sektionschef violet.sabetkar@skatteverket.se, Maria-Claudia Sun Han, hr-specialist maria-claudia.sun.han.cordova@skatteverket.se, | Facklig företrädare: Jeanette Forsgren, ST jeanette.forsgren@skatteverket.se, Göran Sundwall, Soac goran.sundwall@skatteverket.se, | Publicerat: 2025-02-14 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-03-09

title: Restaurang Onboarding Specialist
description:
**Onboarding Specialist – Bli en nyckelspelare i restaurangbranschens digitalisering!** 

  





**Qopla AB** 
 hjälper restauranger att effektivisera sin verksamhet genom smarta kassalösningar, expresskassor och onlinebeställningar. Med över
 **1 500 partners i Sverige** 
 är vi en snabbt växande aktör, och nu söker vi en
 **strukturerad och tekniskt kunnig Onboarding Specialist** 
 som vill vara med på vår resa.
 



  





 I denna roll blir du
 **den första kontakten för våra nya restaurangpartners** 
 och ansvarar för att de får en smidig start med vår plattform. Du ser till att våra lösningar konfigureras utifrån deras behov, utbildar dem i systemet och följer upp för att säkerställa en framgångsrik onboarding.
 



  




**Vad du kommer att göra** 

 ✔
 **Välkomna nya restaurangpartners** 
 och guida dem genom hela onboardingprocessen.
 



 ✔
 **Anpassa och konfigurera deras system** 
 – bygga menyer, sätta upp betalflöden och optimera deras inställningar.
 



 ✔
 **Installera och testa hårdvara** 
 (kassasystem, kvittoskrivare m.m.) – både på distans och på plats vid behov.
 



 ✔
 **Utbilda och supporta** 
 kunder i vårt system, både individuellt och genom manualer och guider.
 



 ✔
 **Följa upp och säkerställa att restaurangerna lyckas** 
 genom att finnas tillgänglig för frågor och stöd.
 



 ✔
 **Rekommendera och sälja in tilläggstjänster** 
 som förbättrar kundens upplevelse.
 



  




**Är det här du?** 

 ✅ Erfarenhet av
 **kundservice, onboarding eller teknisk support** 
 – gärna inom SaaS, foodtech eller betalningslösningar.
 



 ✅
 **Teknisk förståelse** 
 och lätt för att lära dig nya system.
 



 ✅ Kommunikativ och pedagogisk – du kan förklara teknik på ett enkelt och tydligt sätt.
 



 ✅ Strukturerad och lösningsorienterad – du får saker att hända och ser till att inget faller mellan stolarna.
 




 ✅ Social kompetens som ingen annan!
 




 ✅ Erfarenhet från restaurangbranschen? Det är en bonus, men inget krav!
 



  




**Vad vi erbjuder** 

 🚀
 **En roll med stor påverkan** 
 – du blir en nyckelperson i hur våra kunder lyckas.
 



 🎯
 **Personlig utveckling** 
 – du får chansen att växa med oss i en snabbväxande bransch.
 



 🤝
 **Ett engagerat team** 
 – vi är ett sammansvetsat gäng med passion för tech och restauranger.
 



  





 Vill du vara med och digitalisera restaurangbranschen? Skicka in din ansökan idag!

title: Cybersäkerhetsspecialist till Swedavia Stockholm Arlanda Airport
description:
**Swedavia söker en entusiastiska Cybersäkerhetsspecialister till vår Cybersäkerhetsenhet.
   

  

 Swedavias uppdrag är att äga, driva och utveckla 10 av Sveriges flygplatser, som t.ex. Arlanda, Landvetter och Sturup.**
**Vad innebär rollen?**
 Flygplatser har en komplex IT-miljö, med system och lösningar med allt ifrån IoT/OT till Cloud, vilket behövs för att kunna bedriva flygplatsverksamhet (Airport Operator). Förutom traditionell Office-IT, så finns till exempel även energi- och bagagesystem samt autonoma fordon.
   

  

 För att hålla Swedavia och våra resenärer säkra så kräver det att vi jobbar aktivt med att förebygga och identifiera hot mot vår verksamhet och IT. Vilket gör att vi både måste se helheten men samtidigt inte förbiser detaljerna.
   

  

**Ditt uppdrag**
 Som Cybersäkerhetsspecialist med inriktning på Vulnerability Management hos Swedavia kommer ditt huvudfokus vara att identifiera, analysera och hantera sårbarheter inom vår IT-infrastruktur.
   

  

**Du kommer att:**
* Genomföra regelbundna sårbarhetsanalyser av Swedavias hårdvara, mjukvara och IT-arkitektur för att proaktivt identifiera potentiella säkerhetsrisker.
* Utveckla och implementera strategier och processer för Vulnerability Management för att effektivt hantera identifierade sårbarheter.
* Samarbeta med olika team för att säkerställa att sårbarheter åtgärdas i enlighet med Swedavias säkerhetspolicyer och standarder.
* Stödja riskanalysprocesser genom att tillhandahålla detaljerad information om sårbarheter och deras potentiella inverkan på organisationen.
* Kontinuerligt följa upp och rapportera om framsteg och effektiviteten i hanteringen av sårbarheter till relevanta intressenter.


 I denna roll är det viktigt att du håller dig uppdaterad med de senaste trenderna och utvecklingen inom cybersäkerhet, särskilt inom området för sårbarhetshantering. Din expertis kommer att vara avgörande för att stärka Swedavias förmåga att skydda sig mot cyberhot och säkerställa en säker och pålitlig drift av våra flygplatser.
   

  

**Din profil**
 Vi fäster stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper och söker dig som är initiativrik, självgående och van att ta eget ansvar. Du har ett stort intresse och engagemang för Cyber/IT-säkerhet och digital utveckling. Du är analytisk och strukturerad med en förmåga att se till helheten men samtidigt inte förbise detaljerna.
   

  

 Vidare har du en god förmåga att resonera kring teknisk cybersäkerhet ur ett holistiskt perspektiv.
   

  

 Du har praktisk erfarenheter och kunskaper inom cyber/IT-säkerhet (t.ex. så som Applikationssäkerhetstester, Sårbarhetsanalyser, Konfigurationsgranskningar, Intrångstester) samt från att ha jobbat med cyber- och/eller informationssäkerhet med erfarenhet från säkerhetsarbete baserat på metoder, ramverk och lagstiftning (t.ex. IS027000-serien, GDPR och Säkerhetsskyddslagen). Vi ser gärna att du även har erfarenhet från säkerhetsarbete från verksamhetskrav såsom riskanalyser, informationsklassning och incidenthantering.
   

  

 Det är meriterande om du har högskoleutbildning inom datateknik eller informationsteknik, samt har IT-säkerhetsrelaterade tekniska certifieringar från ISACA, SANS, OSSTMM är meriterande.
   

  

 Du har en god förmåga att kommunicera på svenska och engelska i såväl tal som skrift och får gärna ha erfarenhet av hålla utbildningar och föreläsningar.
   

  

 Swedavia är en säkerhetsklassad, alkohol- och drogfri arbetsplats.
   

  

 Vi kommer att lägga stor vikt vid personlig lämplighet.
   

  

**Vad erbjuder vi dig?**
**Välkommen till en unik arbetsplats där världen möts varje dag!**
 Vi erbjuder en betydelsefull och utvecklande roll i en organisation som präglas av hög professionalism, ett öppet och inkluderande arbetsklimat samt ett starkt fokus på affärsutveckling. Hos oss får du uppleva den dynamiska atmosfären och pulsen som bara en flygplats kan erbjuda.
   

  

 Vi värdesätter olikheter och mångfald – det är en av våra största styrkor och en förutsättning för att kunna fortsätta utvecklas som ett hållbart och innovativt företag.
   

  

**Vid frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta philip.rauf@swedavia.se**
**Sista ansökningsdag är den 5 mars, urval sker löpande och annonsen kan stängas tidigare så tveka inte att söka redan idag!**
**Hur är det att arbeta på Swedavia?**
 Vårt fokus är att möjliggöra hållbart resande och uppmuntra nytänkande för att skapa en välkomnande, trygg och inkluderande arbetsgemenskap där du kan växa och göra verklig skillnad – läs mer här! Jobba hos oss | Om Swedavia
   

  

 Då flygplatser är en säkerhetsklassad verksamhet genomgår samtliga kandidater som går vidare i rekryteringsprocessen en bakgrundskontroll. För vissa tjänster även en säkerhetsprövning. Swedavia är även en drogfri arbetsplats med nolltolerans mot droger. Drogtester genomförs före anställning och sker slumpmässigt under anställningen.

title: Apptio Solution Consultant Sweden
description:
**Introduction**
 At Apptio, we empower organizations to optimize their financial operations and align technology investments with business goals. The Apptio platform is at the forefront of transforming how businesses manage IT and financial landscapes, and we are looking for a Presales Solutions Consultant with focus on the Benelux.
   

  

 Why Apptio?
   

  

 At Apptio, We Foster a Culture Of Continuous Growth, Inclusivity, And Customer-centricity. As Part Of Our Team, You’ll Be Encouraged To
   

  

* Embrace a Growth Mindset: We continuously evolve and encourage our team members to explore new ideas and learn from every experience.
* Lead in Ambiguity: In a fast-paced industry, agility and problem-solving are essential. We value those who can thrive in dynamic environments and take ownership of their work.
* Focus on Customer Success: Everything we do centers around delivering value to our customers and helping them achieve their business goals.


**Your Role And Responsibilities**
 The Solution Consultant works in the field sales team and drives revenue by supporting new sales opportunities. You are great at discussing how cloud and other IT spend can be allocated and optimized using our SaaS-based products. Your solution-based discussions, presentations, demos, and technical validation activities show how we deliver business value. You will lead the solution design and be technically responsible for sales wins.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Discovery: Work closely with the sales team to identify potential sales opportunities, conduct in-depth discovery sessions with prospects to uncover their IT business management challenges, and understand their vision for a solution.
* Advise: Act as a trusted advisor to customers and prospects, guiding them on how to leverage Apptio’s suite of solutions to solve their business and technical challenges, and achieve their financial and operational goals.
* Product Presentations & Demonstrations: Deliver tailored presentations and live or remote product demonstrations that showcase Apptio’s ability to meet Cloud Cost Management and FinOps challenges, directly addressing the prospect’s pain points and demonstrating Apptio’s value.
* Technical Solution Design: Lead the design of customized solutions, delivering in-depth overviews of ApptioOne's architecture and proprietary capabilities. Provide clarity on how our solutions deliver unique value in the marketplace.
* Technical Validation Events: Manage and execute technical validation events, where you’ll collaborate with customers to use their data in showcasing how Apptio’s solutions can solve their specific challenges.
* RFI/RFP Responses: Take ownership of responding to RFIs and RFPs by developing clear, accurate, and timely responses that showcase Apptio’s unique capabilities and fit with the prospect's needs.
* Knowledge Sharing: Collaborate with and share your expertise with the Apptio Presales team, both informally and through formal training sessions, to ensure a collective advancement in knowledge and skills.
* Educate and Evangelize: Promote Apptio’s solutions and share industry insights by speaking at public, customer, and marketing events such as conferences, webinars, and executive briefings.
* Collaboration & Customer Support: Be the trusted advisor for cloud and financial management solutions, coaching customers, market partners, and colleagues toward value-based decisions with a consultative approach.
* Customer Advocacy & Feedback: Provide ongoing feedback to product management and engineering teams, ensuring customer needs and market demands are represented in Apptio’s product development roadmap.


**Required Technical And Professional Expertise**
* Educational Background: A bachelor’s degree in finance, business administration, information systems, or a related field.
* Experience & Expertise: 5+ years of experience as a Solutions Consultant or Sales Engineer, working with and selling to IT organizations across various industries and sizes.
* Financial Knowledge: Strong understanding of financial concepts like profitability analysis, cost allocation, and financial planning. Familiarity with accounting principles and business process optimization is essential.
* Enterprise Software & IT Frameworks: Familiarity with enterprise software (e.g., SAP, Workday, ServiceNow, Oracle) and key IT management concepts such as IT Financial Management, Service Management, Agile development, and Value Proposition.
* FinOps and Financial Modelling Skills: Hands-on experience with financial modeling tools and familiarity with cloud solutions (AWS, Google Cloud, Azure)
* Certifications: Certified FinOps Practitioner with experience in financial operations; ITIL or equivalent certification is a bonus.
* Technical Validation & Solution Design: Proven ability to design and validate technical solutions that address customer needs, particularly in IT and financial management.
* Communication & Languages: Fluent in Swedisch and English


**Preferred Technical And Professional Experience**
* IT Industry Knowledge: A solid understanding of IT organizations, including experience selling to IT decision-makers across industries.
* Analytical & Technical Abilities: Proficiency with APIs, Python, or other scripting tools to enhance analytical tasks and solution design.
* Additional Languages: Proficiency in any other European language is a plus.

title: Linux Engineer
description:
Ericsson is a world-leading provider of telecommunications equipment and services to mobile and fixed network operators. Over 1,000 networks in more than 180 countries use Ericsson equipment, and more than 40 percent of the world's mobile traffic passes through Ericsson networks. Using innovation to empower people, business and society, Ericsson is working towards the Networked Society: a world connected in real time that will open opportunities to create freedom, transform society and drive solutions to some of our planet’s greatest challenges.
   

  

 Grow with us
   

  

 Our team in Ericsson is responsible for a Yocto-based distribution used internally in our company. We are now looking for Linux software engineers with a solid understanding of Linux, experience working with Yocto, and ideally a strong background working in the Linux kernel. In this role you will be a highly-valued member of a tightly knit team of senior engineers. We work in a hybrid model and the primary location can be Stockholm (Kista). Other cities in Sweden can be considered as well.
   

  

 Areas where our team works and your skills would be valuable include:
   

  

* Contribute to and interact with upstream open-source communities including but not necessarily limited to the Linux kernel & Yocto communities, potentially driving strategic activities for Ericsson in these projects
* Implement and maintain Linux kernel extensions
* Interact with technical staff in the organization(s) using our Yocto-based distribution
* Setup and configure board support packages (BSPs)
* Develop and configure system tools, bootloaders, etc.
* Testing of our distribution
* Bring up prototype boards and hardware in collaboration with hardware and embedded systems software development teams inside Ericsson
* Analyze and develop software in C and C++ for multi-threaded real-time systems
* Debug and resolve field issues


 Join our Team
   

  

 Successful applicants will ideally have:
   

  

* M.S. Degree in Computer Science or Computer Engineering or equivalent experience
* Solid experience in Linux kernel development
* Experience working with Yocto and in the Yocto community
* Experience contributing to the Linux kernel community (please reference patch submissions)
* Experience working with new silicon introduction in embedded Linux environments
* Experience and proficiency in open-source community norms and behaviours, such as Linux kernel developers, and associated system tool communities
* Strong communication skills


 Location: Stockholm, Sweden
   

  

 Contact: Recruiter - Anu Hirvikallio anu.hirvikallio@ericsson.com
   

  

 ]]>

title: Customer Service Specialist
description:
*Are you a student looking for a part-time job during your studies?* 




*Are you a native English speaker?* 




  





  





  





  





**ABOUT THE COMPANY** 




 GANT is the future of American Sportswear and has been a pioneer of preppy style since 1949. Founded by the Gantmacher family in the college town of New Haven, Connecticut, GANT revolutionized the way the world dresses by creating American Sportswear icons. Today we continue to challenge convention and make clothes for the courageous, the curious and the creative - a community of people who believe you should never stop learning.
 



 GANT enjoys a global presence in over 70 markets, with 600 stores, 4,000 selected retailers and with a team of 1500 employees globally. We strive to become the employer of choice within premium lifestyle brand and are always looking for new passionate people to join their team.
 



  





**ABOUT THE ROLE** 




 As a Customer Service Agent for the Central Europe markets you will support customers mainly over phone and email. You will help GANTS customers before, during and after a purchase on Monday-Friday 9-17. You will be the first personal contact point to the brand. It will be possible to work half days as well as full-time during summer and winter sale periods.
 



  





**RESPONSIBILITIES** 



* Support customers with queries in relation to orders, products, stores or loyalty programme, to name a few, within the tonality guidelines, which is done primarily via Service Cloud.
* Report any issues to the E-Commerce teams and the Customer Service Manager
* Handover cases and issues handled to the inhouse team



  





**WHO ARE YOU?** 




 To be successful in this role we believe that you speak the German language fluently. Any additional languages are of benefit such as German, Spanish or Swedish. It is an advantage if you have previous experience in customer service or working in digital platforms.
 



 But most importantly we believe that you are:
 



 • A solution-oriented fast learner who can handle digital platforms
 



 • Service minded and friendly
 



 • Communicative and not afraid to ask for help
 



  





 Does this sound like something for you? We look forward to your application.
 



  





  





**OTHER INFORMATION:** 




**Start:** 
 May 2025
 



**Location:** 
 Stockholm, Hybrid solution
 



**Employment form:** 
 This is a part-time consultancy position where you will be hired as a consultant through A-hub.

title: Microsoft Dynamics 365 Functional Specialist
description:
**Role:** 
 Microsoft Dynamics 365
 **Functional Specialist**
 Location:
 **REMOTE** 
 , but will need to travel every 3-6 months for 1-2 weeks onsite
   

  

 The D365 Functional Specialist serves as the subject matter expert for Microsoft Dynamics 365 applications, bridging the gap between business requirements and technical solutions. This role focuses on analyzing business needs, configuring D365 modules, and delivering functional solutions to optimize operations and achieve organizational goals.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand and document requirements, pain points, and objectives related to integrations needs.
* Review Functional design documents and provide the necessary feedback to implementation team and stakeholder.
* Understanding of Azure and D365 Environments from integration perspective
* Support Product Owner to approve FDD documentation
* Conduct workshops and process mapping sessions to identify gaps and opportunities for process improvement.
* Translate business requirements into functional specifications for D365 related to integrations
* Stay updated on D365 updates, new features, and industry trends to recommend enhancements.
* Proactively identify areas for system optimization and improvement in alignment with business goals.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive innovation and streamline operations.
* Dealer Management System knowledge is added advantage


**Skills And Qualifications**
* Experience: Proven expertise in configuring and supporting Microsoft Dynamics 365 modules
* Knowledge: Strong understanding of business processes in Finance
* Analytical Skills: Ability to analyze complex business requirements and translate them into effective D365 solutions.
* Communication: Strong interpersonal and communication skills to engage with stakeholders at all levels.

title: Data Engineer - Apotek Hjärtat
description:
**Here’s How a Data Engineer Works at Apotek Hjärtat:**
 As a Data Engineer, you collaborate closely with Data Analysts within our Data & Analytics department. Additionally, you will engage in cross-functional collaboration with teams including developers, engineers and architects. Together, we aim to build a solid foundation for our AI and Data Journey at Apotek Hjärtat.
   

  

 You will be a part of establishing the new data platform on Azure. This includes developing data integration, data modeling processes and integrating data from various sources such as databases, API’s, streaming platforms (e.g. Kafka) and other external sources. You will design, build, and maintain scalable data pipelines for efficient data ingestion across multiple domains. You will be using Databricks and Azure products in an agile way of working while ensuring seamless integration with other platforms such as GCP. You build it – you run it.
   

  

**Who are we looking for?**
 We are expanding our team and looking for both junior professionals with a few years of experience as Data Engineer and senior experts who want to contribute to building the future of our data platform. We believe in collaboration, innovation, and a culture where everyone has the opportunity to grow and make an impact.
   

  

**Role**
 As a Data Engineer, you will play a key role in taking our new data platform to the next level. To succeed in this role, you should have:
   

  

* A relevant engineering background
* Experience in building and optimizing data pipelines and data lakes/warehouses in a cloud environment (GCP, Azure, or AWS)
* Proficiency in Python or SQL
* Experience with Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools like Terraform (considered a merit)
* A valid work permit for Sweden or EU citizenship


**About Apotek Hjärtat**
 At Apotek Hjärtat, we have a meaningful mission – to help people feel better. With 400 pharmacies across Sweden and an e-commerce platform, we are always close to our customers. As part of ICA Gruppen, we offer great opportunities for both personal and professional growth in a culture built on trust, care, and innovation.
   

  

**Apply Now**
 For any inquiries about the position, please contact the hiring manager, Karl Berthén, Manager Data & Analytics, karl.berthen@apotekhjartat.se. For questions regarding the recruitment process please reach out to Sanna Smidvik, Talent acquisition partner, sanna.smidvik@apotekhjartat.se. Apply as soon as possible, but no later than 2025-03-12. If the role requires it, you will need to undergo work psychological tests and background checks before employment. All external assistance with recruitment is declined.

title: Inside Sales Account Manager
description:
**Bli en del av vårt vinnande säljteam!** 




  





 Som
 **Inside Sales Account Manager** 
 på vårt nordiska huvudkontor i Bromma kommer du att spela en avgörande roll i vår fortsatta framgång. Du kommer att driva hela säljprocessen, från att identifiera kundbehov för både nya och befintliga kunder till att ta fram rätt lösning och stänga affärer. Med telefonen som ditt främsta verktyg jobbar du för att bygga långsiktiga relationer med våra kunder och säkerställa kundnöjdhet. Du kommer att få god användning av din administrativa förmåga och hantera administrativa uppgifter kopplade till försäljningsprocessen.
 



  





**Är du en driven säljare med ett vinnande leende?** 




 Vi söker dig som brinner för försäljning och som har en förmåga att skapa engagerande kundsamtal. Du är målmedveten, resultatfokuserad och har lätt för att bygga förtroende. Hos oss får du möjlighet att utvecklas i en dynamisk miljö med öppna karriärvägar.
 



  





**Din profil:** 



* **Erfarenhet:** 
 3 års erfarenhet från en kundorienterad roll, exempelvis som innesäljare eller kundservicemedarbetare
* **Kommunikation:** 
 Flytande svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift.
* **Kundfokus:** 
 Ett genuint intresse för att hjälpa kunder att hitta rätt lösningar.
* **Resultatorienterad:** 
 Du sätter höga mål och arbetar målmedvetet för att nå dem.
* **Relationsbyggare:** 
 Du är en naturlig nätverkare och bygger långsiktiga relationer med dina kunder.



  





**Vi erbjuder:** 



* **Utvecklingsmöjligheter:** 
 Chansen att växa inom företaget och utveckla din säljkarriär.
* **Ett starkt team:** 
 Du blir en del av ett engagerat och framgångsrikt säljteam och har kollegor runt dig med gedigen kunskap och erfarenhet.
* **Konkurrenskraftiga förmåner:** 
 Förutom en fast lön erbjuder vi ett attraktivt provisionsupplägg.



  





**Känner du igen dig?** 
 Tveka inte att skicka in din ansökan!
 



  





**Om Oss** 




 Sharp erbjuder lösningar för digitala arbetsplatser. Med vår gedigna erfarenhet, lokala förankring och breda kunskap levererar vi helhetslösningar för organisationer, oavsett bransch eller storlek. Det handlar om datorer, digitala möten och säker dokumenthantering till kompletta mötesrum, IT-drift, arbetsplatshantering och betallösningar. Vi säkerställer att företag alltid har rätt förutsättningar, utbildning och verktyg för att öka samarbete, kommunikation och säkerhet.

title: Manager for Quality, Strategy & Processes within Aftermarket Technology
description:
Transport is at the core of modern society. Imagine using your expertise to shape sustainable transport and infrastructure solutions for the future? If you seek to make a difference on a global scale, working with next-gen technologies and the sharpest collaborative teams, then we could be a perfect match.

 **Do you want to have fun, develop and deliver in a truly global and diverse team combining technology and business? Are you looking for an impactful position creating customer value?**

  

Aftermarket Technology (AMT) is a global entity working to secure customer loyalty and to maximize the uptime of the vehicles for Volvo Group Trucks brands. Customers’ success is our focus.

  

For each vehicle launched on the market, we engineer solutions securing workshop autonomy, maintenance efficiency and maintenance effectiveness. We deliver Diagnostic solutions, operations and procedures, Spare Parts assortment and information, Repair and Maintenance Solutions, Service Planning, Special Tools and Standard Times. We are engaged in future technologies for both vehicles and uptime services. We are focusing on truck as a software, electromobility, automated vehicles, connectivity, digitization and predictive care for our customers.  

  

We are accountable for the maintainability of the vehicles: with a clear repair strategy in mind we influence the design and the technology choices. We make our vehicles and components easy to diagnose, maintain and repair. We improve the vehicle uptime, customers’ success and thus the Volvo Group profitability.  

  

Join Our Team as the **Manager for Quality, Strategy & Processes within Aftermarket Technology**! Are you ready to take on an exciting leadership role that drives continuous improvement and significantly impacts our company's success? As the Manager for Quality, Strategy & Processes, you are given the opportunity to shape and drive the development of Aftermarket Technology together with leadership team and a global organization of skilled, dedicated to excellence, committed colleagues.

 **What You Will Do:**  

* **Lead and Collaborate:** Build a robust network and foster collaboration across Group Trucks Technology, the Truck brand organization, and business partners to achieve our strategic objectives.
* **Drive Strategy & Portfolio Management:** Oversee the complete Aftermarket Technology function, ensuring alignment with set goals and objectives.
* **Lead Operational Excellence towards Quality and Safety:** Work closely with various departments within GTT and truck brands to ensure that quality reports and customer issues are addressed with utmost care and diligence. Promote proactive safety and quality initiatives.
* **Enhance Aftermarket Services:** Manage second and third-line support for aftermarket services, utilizing advanced analytics to continuously improve the quality of our aftermarket deliveries.
* **Stakeholder Management:** Effectively manage stakeholder expectations while striving for operational excellence in aftermarket technology.
* **Support Compliance:** Ensure compliance and proactive development in the area of electric technical safety.
* **Cultivate a Growth Mindset:** Foster an inclusive work environment and innovative culture that attracts and retains top talent. Inspire your team to excel in a global setting.

  

**Who You Are:**  

You are a passionate leader who thrives at the intersection of people and technology. Your approach is rooted in simplicity, empowerment, and accountability. You are dedicated to growing competencies, knowledge, and professionalism within your team, always with a customer success mindset.  

  

We believe you are an experienced and inclusive leader who inspires teams to deliver high-quality results on time. Your strong customer orientation and proven ability to build high-performing teams will be vital in driving our success.  

  

As a mentor and coach, your empathetic and integrity-driven leadership fosters trust, collaboration, and creativity. You bring a proactive attitude, structured mindset, and expertise in change management to implement processes and drive continuous improvement. You envision yourself thriving in a fast-paced international environment, where your excellent communication skills and passion for product safety and quality can shine.  

  

You live the Volvo Group Values with high integrity and trust. Your negotiation, networking and perseverance skills will be key assets to interface with engineering, sales colleagues and GTX departments.  

  

**Qualifications:**  

* Master’s degree in engineering or equivalent.
* Several years of experience in product development, preferably within the automotive industry.
* Proven experience in leading teams in an international and multi-site environment.
* Experience managing external collaborations with partners and service providers.

  

**Join us and be a part of our journey towards excellence in the Aftermarket Technology Field**.  

  

**Position reports to:**  

Vice President Aftermarket Technology  

Main location for this position will be Gothenburg Sweden. **Curious? Don’t hesitate to reach out!**  

If you have questions regarding this role, please contact Hiring Manager Dinesh Babu, dinesh.babu@volvo.com  

We look forward to your application! Please apply no later than the 2nd of March 2025.

  

We value your data privacy and therefore do not accept applications via mail.

 **Who we are and what we believe in**  

Our focus on Inclusion, Diversity, and Equity allows each of us the opportunity to bring our full authentic self to work and thrive by providing a safe and supportive environment, free of harassment and discrimination. We are committed to removing the barriers to entry, which is why we ask that even if you feel you may not meet every qualification on the job description, please apply and let us decide.

  

Applying to this job offers you the opportunity to join **Volvo Group**. Every day, across the globe, our trucks, buses, engines, construction equipment, financial services, and solutions make modern life possible. We are almost 100,000 people empowered to shape the future landscape of efficient, safe and sustainable transport solutions. Fulfilling our mission creates countless career opportunities for talents with sharp minds and passion across the group’s leading brands and entities.

 **Group Trucks Technology** are seeking talents to help design sustainable transportation solutions for the future. As part of our team, you’ll help us by engineering exciting next-gen technologies and contribute to projects that determine new, sustainable solutions. Bring your love of developing systems, working collaboratively, and your advanced skills to a place where you can make an impact. Join our design shift that leaves society in good shape for the next generation.

title: Failure Analysis Engineer
description:
**Description**


**The Opportunity**


At Hitachi Energy AB protection and control development center for transmission applications, we are looking for an experienced failure analysis engineer who wants to become part of the Supplier Quality team in Västerås, Sweden.


Together with the development teams you will be responsible for the root cause analysis of relay protection (IED) hardware and its subcomponents. Root cause analysis may be initiated by internal as well as customer cases. Analysis performed will often be base for a customer response to the failure. As failure analysis is strongly connected to testing, it is beneficial if you have experience in test setup management and programming of test environments.

  

We are looking for a passionate failure analyst who is eager to learn from our experienced staff, but also a driving force that will push our boundaries forward. You are result oriented, responsive and have a high sense of ownership for quality. You need to be a good communicator and have strong people and leadership skills, as you will collaborate with many different stakeholders across different functions and cultures.

**How you’ll make an impact**

* In-depth design-level root cause analysis of Relion- relay protection (IED) hardware, partially application functions and software.
* Identification of needed expertise support.
* Defect management including analysis of failure statistics.
* Management of and improvement of test equipment including test setup programming.
* Documentation of analysis results, including report creation RCA and 8D.
* Improvement of test methods and responsible for the test equipment used by the FA team.
* Continuously improve on FA process to reduce analysis lead time.

**Your background**

* You hold a Master’s degree or higher in hardware engineering or equivalent. Previous work experience within ABB/Hitachi Energy Relion portfolio and power systems is highly beneficial.
* Technical background in electronics development and/or industrial electronics.
* Technical knowledge on Relion series product is mandatory.
* You are a great team player with a high degree of initiative and excellent leadership skills.
* Experience with JTag, LabView, CAN or Keysight VEE is qualifying.
* You are fluent in spoken and written English. Fluent in Swedish is beneficial.

**What we offer**

* Collective agreement
* Occupational health care and wellness allowance
* Fantastic career opportunities within Hitachi Energy, both in Sweden and globally
* Training and courses that contribute to personal and professional development
* Diversified company with over 70+ nationalities represented within the Swedish organization
* Supplementary allowance during parental leave
* Benefits portal with over a thousand benefits and discounts

**More about us**


Welcome to submit your application! Recruiting Manager Basavaraj MM, basavaraj.mm@hitachienergy.com will be able to answer your questions regarding the position.


Other questions can be directed to recruiter Michael Blomberg, michael.blomberg@hitachienergy.com.

title: R&D Engineer - Analog Electronics Hardware Design
description:
**Description**


**The opportunity**


Do you have a deep interest in technology and would like to join a multinational organization with lots of development opportunities? Join Hitachi Energy as a R&D Engineer with focus on Analog Electronics Hardware Design and work in a team which is dedicated to creating a future where innovative digital technologies bring cleaner energy to more people. Take a leap in your career and seize this opportunity!


In this role you will be part of MACH Products, in Ludvika. The MACH Control & Protection Platform R&D department is a part of HVDC, Hitachi Energy and is responsible for the development of state-of-the-art control system platform for HVDC and FACTS applications. The MACH C&P department in Ludvika has around 70 employees, focusing mainly on Hardware and Software design working in close collaboration with the global MACH C&P organization.


The HVDC technology has been on the market for the past 60 years and is used, among other things, to transmit power over long distances with minimal losses, using overhead lines, underground and submarine cable systems.

**Your responsibilities**

* You will be responsible for the development and maintenance of valve electronics products which constitute the hearth of a HVDC – High Voltage Direct Current system
* The work requires deep understanding of analog and/or power electronics both theoretical as well as practical tasks. Requirement management, development of design specifications and documentation are part of the work tasks as well
* You will have the responsibility to create robust designs within the cost and time limits with a product lifecycle management perspective
* We work in a modern environment where both rapid prototyping and productification takes place. To our help we have tools and labs for the complete electronic hardware development cycle, from early prototype testing to final system verification. You will have the responsibility of your design in all these steps
* You will be living Hitachi Energy’s core values of safety and integrity, which means taking responsibility for your own actions while caring for your colleagues and the business

**Your background**

* You have already obtained a wide knowledge within the area from a university education preferably in electrical engineering and/or power electronics fields, Master’s or higher degree is a plus
* You have 8+ years’ experience on developing analog/power electronics hardware, you have 5+ years of experience with industry standard schematic capture and PCB layout tools
* You have proven experience on discrete analog electronics design, e.g. transistor level design of analog front end/output stages, amplifiers, comparators, converters and gate drivers; experience on simulation and measurement techniques with proven experience in making correlation between the theoretical and practical domains; theoretical knowledge and practical experience on EMI, EMC, grounding and low noise analog electronics design on board level
* Proficiency in board bring-up and debugging skills; Experience with lab equipment and test setups for analog signal measurements; Experience on product/system verification and environmental testing
* Proven understanding and real-world application of DFx (DFM, DFA and DFT); Practical knowledge in manufacturing of PCBs and PCBAs; Experience on engineering best practices related to analog/power electronics design, test, and integration
* Ability to prepare well organized documentation for designs, verification/production tests and manufacturing
* Knowledge of electronic hardware development life cycle and obsolescence management; Experience on working with multi-functional hardware, software, and system architecture teams
* Ability to write test software for hardware verification is a plus; Experience with PLM tools is a plus; Experience from reliability analysis such as MTBF, FMEA and FTA is a plus.

**What we offer**

* Collective agreement
* Flexible working time
* Health care and wellness allowance
* Fantastic career possibilities within Hitachi Energy both within Sweden and globally
* Mentor to support you throughout onboard phase
* Various trainings and education supporting employee development
* Diversified company with over 70+ nationalities working in Sweden
* Supplementary compensation for parental leave
* Employee Benefit Portal with thousands of discounts and perks

**More about us**


Applications will be reviewed on an ongoing basis, so don’t delay – apply today.


Recruiting Manager Naman Raval, naman.raval@hitachienergy.com will be happy to answer your questions regarding this position.


Union representatives - Sveriges Ingenjörer; Mikael Hjort, +46 107-38 25 73; Ledarna: Frank Hollstedt, +46 107-38 70 43; Unionen: Fredrik Holmgren, +46 107-38 21 85. All other questions can be directed to Lead Recruiter, Agata Koper, agata.koper@hitachienergy.com
