title: Full-stack developer in fast growing AI mental health startup
company_industry: Technology, Information and Internet and Hospitals and Health Care
description:
**This is your chance to be part of something huge from the start!**
 Plussa is on a mission to improve the lives of millions of families worldwide. Our AI-powered app offers employers the most cost-effective way to support working parents. We’ve just secured our pre-seed funding, and hiring our first in-house developer,
 **you** 
 !
   

  

**Why Plussa?**
* Be part of a fast-growing team on track for VC-backed international expansion.
* Work with founders experienced in startups and scale-ups who believe that the key to success is the ability to have fun while working hard to build successful products.
* We value your potential more than your past—if you’re ambitious and eager to make an impact, we want you on our journey.


 J
   

  

 oin us to shape the future of mental health and revolutionize support for working parents!
   

  

**Your Role at Plussa**
 As our first in-house developer, you’ll take charge of everything tech at Plussa. Here’s what that looks like:
   

  

* Strategic Planning: Collaborate with our founders to design and evolve Plussa’s tech stack & architecture.
* Product Development: Drive data-driven improvements, fix bugs, add new features based on user feedback, and enhance the UI.
* Backend & Deployment: Maintain a robust backend, manage app releases on the App Store and Google Play, and update our website.
* AI Integration: Improve Plussa’s AI functionality while staying ahead of rapid advances in generative AI, LLM models, data security, and data collection.
* Future-Proofing: Ensure our technology remains agile and scalable to accommodate future growth and innovation.


 We’re expanding quickly, and there’s potential for you to become our CTO or tech lead. Until then, you should be ready to handle all things tech—or learn fast. If you’re excited to take on a dynamic role where you will have the opportunity to reach your full potential, we want you on the Plussa team.
   

  

**What We’re Looking For**
 We need someone who can write clean, efficient code and build great products with:
   

  

* Node.js
* React Native & ReactJS
* Pinecone & DynamoDB
* AWS
* LangChain
* OpenAI API
* Contentful


 We also integrate with external solutions like
 **BankID** 
 and
 **Kaddio** 
 , and we’ll keep adding new APIs—so you should be ready to learn quickly.
   

  

 Plussa is evolving fast, and we want you to be excited about solving future challenges using new tools and technologies.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 Joining Plussa at this early stage means you’ll have a direct impact on how our business evolves. You’ll work closely with our leadership team, shape our future direction, and rapidly develop your skill set along the way. Here’s what you can expect:
   

  

* Competitive Package: Salary + equity based on your experience, output, and potential
* Flexibility: Hybrid-remote work policy
* Professional Growth: Personal learning budget and access to coaching
* Parental Support: Parental pay top-up
* Wellness Allowance: Stay healthy and happy
* Top-Notch Setup: The hardware and environment you need to excel
* Open to Suggestions: If you think something’s missing, let us know!


**Role Details**
* Type: Full-time, permanent (6-month trial period)
* Start Date: ASAP
* Location: Norrsken House, Birger Jarlsgatan 57C, central Stockholm—become part of an ecosystem that offers social events, networking, and seminars

title: Manual QA Engineer (temporary position)
Full stack developer to Digital Dealer at Scania IT
description:
Join us now!
   

  

 Scania is currently undergoing an exciting transformation from a traditional truck manufacturer to a provider of complete sustainable transport solutions. IT is a crucial part of this transformation as Scania’s success depends on flexible and efficient IT solutions that support current and future business requirements.
   

  

 Our product Digital Dealer is used by our retailers and service advisors all around the world. By using new modern technologies, we establish effective resale operations by providing accurate and optimized information to our service employees.
   

  

 We believe you are
   

  

 A person who enjoys working in a team that takes full responsibility for developing and deploying our application, Digital Dealer, to production.
   

  

 You are comfortable with development practices such as test automatization, pair programming, and version control.
   

  

 We also believe that you have previous experience working with back-end development, but front-end and AWS development are also very relevant. But most importantly, you are passionate about technology and continuous learning.
   

  

 What can you expect of us?
   

  

 As part of one of our Teams, you will have the chance to work with bleeding-edge technologies while pushing the boundaries of what is possible when building and delivering fast and reliable software.
   

  

 We equally encourage and value innovation with modern technology as we refine our current software stack to make sure our entire application and practices are always challenged and up to date.
   

  

 In this role, you will be sharing the responsibility of maintaining and developing some of the micro frontends together with some microservices, that make the entire application. Digital Dealer is entirely cloud-based, deployed in Kubernetes in AWS by GitLabCI pipelines, with React micro-front-ends and backed with Kotlin micro-services.
   

  

 As a team, we generally work remotely, except for a few days a week when we enjoy each other’s company face-to-face at the office in Södertälje, Stockholm, or Kungens kurva. While we expect everyone to be independent and take ownership of their learning, we are always working closely together sharing the knowledge and decisions between us, and thus we believe your personality plays a big role in your value to the team.
   

  

 Software stack
   

  

 We generally work with the following technologies:
   

  

  

* Backend Development (Kotlin, Kafka)
* Frontend Development (React, CSS)
* AWS (Kubernetes)
* Testing (Storybook/Junit)
* End to End testing (Kotlin)
* Logging (Kibana & Elasticsearch)
* CI/CD (GitLab-CI)


 We offer
   

  

 Joining us at Scania means working for an established industry leader with a great opportunity to grow both within the team and individually. Together with a diverse group of skilled and dedicated colleagues, you will work on difficult challenges to revolutionize the transport industry.
   

  

 Scania provides benefits such as a results bonus, company pension, flexible working hours, subsidized canteen, parental leave covered up to 90%, and much more. If you live in Stockholm, we also offer the Scania Job Express, a direct bus service between Stockholm City, Liljeholmen, and Södertälje.
   

  

 For further information
   

  

 For questions regarding the position, please contact Fredrik Hed (Engineering Manager), at +46855381753, or Ericka Guimarães Saulo (Group Manager), at +46704586491.
   

  

 Application
   

  

 If you are interested and feel you have a fair share of what is mentioned above, please apply!
   

  

 Selection and interviews will take place throughout the application period. Please apply no later than 2025-03-10.
   

  

 Your application should include a CV and degree certificate. Instead of a cover letter, please answer the questions stated when you submit your application. A background check might be conducted for this position.

title: Embedded Software Engineer
description:
We’re looking for an
 **Embedded Software Engineer with RISC-V expertise** 
 to develop cutting-edge avionics, satellite systems, and secure embedded platforms. Join our client in Stockholm and work on state-of-the-art aerospace technology!
 



  





  





**About the Role:** 




  





 Develop and optimize real-time embedded software for RISC-V-based aerospace systems. Work on low-level firmware, bootloaders, and real-time operating systems (RTOS). Implement secure and fault-tolerant computing architectures for mission-critical applications. Develop software for satellite communication, radar systems, and avionics control. Ensure compliance with safety and security standards. Optimize software for low-power, high-performance, and radiation-hardened environments.
 



  





  





**Required Skills:** 




  




* Strong experience in embedded software development (C/C++, assembly)
* Deep understanding of RISC-V architecture (toolchains, ISA extensions, security features)
* Experience with RTOS (e.g., FreeRTOS, Zephyr, VxWorks) or bare-metal programming



  





  





**Considered a plus if you have one or more of the following:** 




  




* Knowledge of hardware-software co-design, SoC architectures, and FPGAs
* Familiarity with aerospace communication protocols (MIL-STD-1553, SpaceWire, CANaerospace)
* Experience with cybersecurity and encryption in embedded systems

title: QA Engineer
description:
**Why Join Us?**
 At Tobii Dynavox, we empower people with disabilities to do what they once did or never thought possible. We call this mission Power to Be You. Our assistive communication technology helps our customers express themselves, connect with the world, and pursue independence, whether through everyday activities like ordering food or extraordinary feats like running a company. Working at Tobii Dynavox, you’ll become part of a team that spans the globe, with offices in the US, Sweden, France, the UK, China, and beyond.
   

  

 To learn more about what we make possible, meet some of our customers or take a look at some of our solutions.
   

  

 We’re at an exciting stage in our journey—growing rapidly and expanding our Product & Development team in Stockholm to build a vibrant hub for innovation, product design, and technology. This is a unique opportunity to join a thriving organization where you can help shape the future of assistive communication, defining how we work and delivering impactful solutions for our users.
   

  

 We are building a culture of empowered, collaborative teams who are passionate about helping individuals with disabilities find their voice and connect with the world. Our teams thrive on trust, collaboration, and a positive environment where everyone lead and contributes. We deeply understand the people we serve, empathize with their challenges, and use our expertise to make a real difference.
   

  

 As a
 *QA Engineer* 
 , you will play a vital role in ensuring the quality and reliability of our hardware and software products, collaborating across teams to deliver solutions that empower individuals with disabilities to connect with the world.
   

  

 In this role, you will:
   

  

* Provide third-tier product support with deep product knowledge for internal teams, partners, and customers.
* Track, manage, and resolve hardware and software product issues, driving continuous quality improvement.
* Conduct hardware and software deployment testing, including company and third-party software integrations.
* Develop, refine, and maintain QA test plans to uphold the highest product standards.
* Collaborate with Projects and Application Development teams to replicate customer issues and use cases.
* Implement and document best practices to meet design requirements and deliver high-quality solutions on schedule.
* Balance independent tasks with team coordination, fostering collaboration across departments.


**What We're Looking For:**
 We are looking for someone who has:
   

  

* A bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a related field, or equivalent work experience.
* 3+ years of experience as a Quality Assurance Engineer or in a related role.
* Proficiency in QA tools like TestRail and platforms such as iOS, Windows, Android, and web applications.
* Experience with Azure, AWS, Git, TeamCity, GitHub, and Jira.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills for collaboration across teams.
* A strong attention to detail, organizational skills, and understanding of QA methodologies.


**Our Values:**
 At Tobii Dynavox, our mission guides what we do, and our values guide us in how we do it. Across the organization, we are committed to being Collaborative, Considerate, Curious and Courageous. We build a trusting environment where every team member prioritizes our customers with empathy and insight. Bold ideas and learning lead to impactful solutions. Driven by curiosity, we continuously challenge the status quo to create meaningful, customer-focused solutions for our customers.
   

  

**What We Offer:**
 At Tobii Dynavox, we believe in empowering individuals – including our employees - to reach their full potential. Here’s what makes us unique:
   

  

* Purpose-Driven Work: Join a company that transforms lives by giving a voice to those with communication challenges. Every day, your work makes a meaningful and concrete impact.
* “Yes, and...” Flexibility: Build a rewarding career AND enjoy time with loved ones. We offer flexible work options so you don’t have to choose between personal and professional goals.
* Growth and Development: Whether you’re advancing your skills or growing your career, we invest in your future with training, learning opportunities, and internal growth paths.
* Inclusive and Supportive Culture: Work in a collaborative, caring environment where diversity and individuality are valued. You’ll feel connected to both your team and our global community.
* A Global Leader with Heart: Be part of an innovative, forward-thinking company that combines experience and cutting-edge solutions with a mission to change lives.

title: Analytics Engineer
description:
We are Happy Socks, an innovative fashion company that specializes in designing and producing unique, high-quality fashion items. We sell directly to consumers through our online and physical channels, as well as wholesale to a range of partners. We leverage technology to drive business insights and operational efficiency. At Happy Socks, we are hard at work creating our new Data Platform! We are now looking to add a permanent Analytics Engineer to lead our growing data engineering team. This role will oversee the completion of the initial project, shape our overall data strategy, and guide data modeling and transformation initiatives. Our data team plays a crucial role in shaping our data-driven culture and enabling decision-making across the organization.
   

  

**Role Overview**
 We are looking for a strategic Analytics Engineer to lead our data engineering initiatives and team. In this role, you will oversee the design, implementation, and maintenance of scalable data pipelines and infrastructure including project managing the outcomes of 1-2 data engineers. A key aspect of this role is the ability to quickly build comprehensive mental models of all the data we have, translate business requirements into technical specifications, and guide your team in implementing solutions. You will work closely with analytics specialists, analysts, and other engineers to ensure clean, reliable, and well-structured data is available for business decision-making. You will also lead the planning, design, and architecture of the data foundations project, resulting in a comprehensive roadmap for our Data Platform.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Architect and oversee the operational health of data pipelines and systems, establishing monitoring frameworks and quality standards.
* Project managing the outcomes of a small team of data engineers, providing technical guidance and ensuring best practices in implementation.
* Drive data quality initiatives and establish governance frameworks throughout all stages of data processing.
* Guide the design and implementation of scalable data pipelines to support ELT/ETL processes and data warehousing, working with various data sources and ingestion/transformation tools.
* Partner with analytics specialists, analysts, and other teams to translate business requirements into technical specifications.
* Oversee the maintenance and evolution of our Data Warehouse architecture.
* Define data modeling and transformation frameworks aligned with business processes, ensuring proper implementation by the team.
* Establish standards for serving data in downstream applications like reports or dashboards.
* Drive the implementation of best practices for versatility, reliability, ease of maintenance of the data platform as well as data governance, security, and compliance. Guide the optimization of data storage solutions, focusing on performance, cost, and scalability.


**Requirements**
* Strong technical background with hands-on experience in data engineering, capable of providing technical leadership and mentoring.
* Proven ability to translate complex business requirements into technical specifications. Experience project managing technical teams and managing deliverables.
* Strong communication skills with the ability to bridge technical and business stakeholders.
* Strong knowledge of SQL and familiarity with programming languages (e.g., Python).
* Experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP) and understanding of data pipeline tools (e.g., Airflow, Fivetran).
* Familiarity with data transformation tools like DBT.
* Strong knowledge of data storage technologies such as Snowflake, relational databases, NoSQL, or data lakes.
* Ability to guide troubleshooting of data-related issues and optimize data flows.


**Nice To Have**
 Knowledge of GDPR regulations and experience in data privacy frameworks. Experience with data visualization and reporting tools like Sigma. Understanding of machine learning workflows and supporting data requirements. Previous experience in retail or e-commerce domains.
   

  

 Most importantly, you have the personality to fit a somewhat crazy, fun work environment where we believe in color and playfulness, a place where you can expect the unexpected and you are a source of creative weirdness.
   

  

 Happy Socks aims to spread happiness by turning an everyday essential into a colorful design piece. The business is built on foundations of rigid quality standards, craftsmanship and creativity that are transferred into the products by a talented team of creatives. The products feature endless variations of models and designs, using a broad spectrum of color combinations and original patterns.

title: QA Engineer
description:
*Digital Customer Offering (DCO) is a business function within Fortum Consumer Solutions, where business and technology come together. At DCO, we create superior digital offerings and experiences for our 2,4 million consumer and enterprise customers. We innovate and find new ways to digitalize our offerings and processes. We collaborate closely with our stakeholders and external partners. Through cross-functional collaboration, agility and sustainability focus, we strive to make our customers’ increasingly digital lives easier with our services. We serve clients in the Nordics as well as Poland and Spain.*
 We are looking for a talented and passionate individual to join our newly formed Secure Operations & Data Solutions team. As a QA Engineer, you will be at the heart of our mission to deliver top-notch software products. Your role is crucial in ensuring the quality and reliability of our offerings. You will collaborate closely with our talented development team to identify and resolve issues, create and execute comprehensive test plans, and continuously improve our testing processes.
   

  

**In this role, you will:**
* Collectively be responsible for team delivery and performance
* Identifiy appropriate tests to be executed from technology perspective and business perspective
* Analyse and review test basis, map test basis to test cases, designs test cases, execute test cases and reports results
* Develop test code for automated software tests that can be built into continuous integration or automatically executed (For QA with test automation skills)
* Collaborate with developers to resolve issues and improve software quality
* Participate in code reviews and provide feedback on quality issues
* Stay up-to-date with industry best practices and emerging technologies


**To excel in this role, you should have:**
* A bachelor's or master's degree in computer science or another relevant field
* At least 2 years of experience in digital development with a successful track record, focusing on QA
* Knowledge of test management tools
* Familiarity with Agile development methodologies
* Familiarity with CI/CD tools and processes


 We are excited to hire 2 people for this position. If you are eager to contribute to our innovative team, we would love to hear from you!
   

  

**Ready to Join Us?**
 Don't miss out on this exciting opportunity! Submit your application by 07.03.2025 at the latest. have any questions or would like to learn more about the position, feel free to reach out to Antti Heimonen via email: antti.heimonen@fortum.com. We're here to help and look forward to hearing from you!
   

  

 To be selected for the position, the applicant must go through background clearance and a health examination including drug testing.
   

  

**We are Fortum**
 Fortum is a Nordic energy company. Our purpose is to power a world where people, businesses and nature thrive together. We are one of the cleanest energy producers in Europe and our actions are guided by our ambitious environmental targets. We generate and deliver clean energy reliably and help industries to decarbonise their processes and grow. Our core operations in the Nordics comprise of efficient, CO2-free power generation as well as reliable supply of electricity and district heat to private and business customers. For our :5 000 employees, we commit to be a safe, and inspiring workplace. Fortum's share is listed on Nasdaq Helsinki. fortum.com

title: Python Backend Engineer
description:
**Python** 
**Backend Engineer – Treebula** 




 We are looking for a skilled Python Backend Engineer to help shape the future of Treebula, Sweden’s leading digital marketplace for forest owners. At Treebula, we leverage cutting-edge technology to provide innovative tools for forest owners to manage their land, optimize timber sales, and explore renewable energy opportunities.
 



 As part of our team, you will play a key role in architecting, scaling, and optimizing our backend systems to ensure a robust, high-performance platform. Your work will directly impact thousands of users, helping us drive towards a sustainable and carbon-neutral future
 



  





**As a** 
**Python** 
**Backend Engineer at Treebula:** 




 You will collaborate closely with frontend engineers, designers, and product teams to design, develop, and maintain core features of our platform. You will work with Python/Django to build scalable services, optimize database performance, and enhance API reliability. Your role will involve solving complex challenges, from handling large forestry datasets to ensuring system scalability and resilience as we grow.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Design, develop, and optimize scalable backend services using Python and Django.
* Ensure high performance and reliability of our PostgreSQL database through efficient indexing, query optimization, and data structuring
* Collaborate with frontend engineers to provide well-structured, high-performance APIs.
* Improve system architecture and scalability, ensuring the platform can handle increasing data volumes and user growth.
* Implement best practices for security, monitoring, and cloud-based deployment on AWS.
* Participate in code reviews, technical discussions, and mentoring to help grow the team’s capabilities.



  





**Qualifications** 

 :
 



* 5+ years of experience in backend development, with a strong focus on Python and Django.
* Experience designing and optimizing scalable architectures and high-traffic APIs.
* Strong understanding of PostgreSQL and database optimization techniques.
* Familiarity with AWS, Docker, and cloud-based deployment best practices.
* Ability to debug and optimize backend performance and troubleshoot scalability bottlenecks.
* Strong collaboration skills, with experience working closely with frontend teams and designers.



  





**Bonus Points For:** 



* Experience working with map applications or Geographic Information Systems (GIS).
* Knowledge of data pipelines, backend event tracking, and logging best practices.
* Strong experience with asynchronous processing and task queues (Celery, RabbitMQ, or similar).
* Familiarity with machine learning and AI-powered data processing.



  





**Why Join Treebula?** 




 At Treebula, you'll be part of a team that's not just building great technology, but also making a real impact on the environment. We value innovation, collaboration, and sustainability, offering you the opportunity to grow your career while contributing to a greener planet.

title: Function Developer within Engine Variable Valve Control
description:
Scania is undergoing a transformation from being a leading supplier of trucks, buses, and engines to providing complete and sustainable transport solutions. Together with TRATON and our sister brands MAN, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International, we are working to shape the future of mobility with innovative and environmentally conscious solutions. Our values – customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste – are at the heart of everything we do. Together, we are at the forefront of creating a sustainable future.
   

  

**Role Summary**
 Do you want to join the lead in technology development, be part of a world class company and join the internal combustion engine development where changes really do have an impact? Then this opportunity is for you.
   

  

 Even with new technologies, like electrification, around the corner, the bigger part of the Scania fleet still rely on internal combustion engines so every improvement to fuel consumption and emissions really do matter. With this assignment, you will have the possibility to really make a difference. If you succeed, we succeed so let’s take the next step towards the future together!
   

  

**Job Responsibilities**
 You will be part of an agile team within variable valve control where you and your supporting colleagues are the experts. Your work will span over the full development process from requirements, concept development and implementation to testing, documentation and verification. As part of the global organization of engine control system in the Traton group you will often work in cross-functional teams who delivers to international customers both within and outside Scania.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 In order to be successful in this position, we believe you are a responsible and open minded team player who takes on new challenges with curiosity and engagement. You find it easy to communicate in English both verbally, and in writing. You enjoy a mix of practical testing and analytic work. Creativity, problem solving and critical thinking is highly valued as we often discuss the challenges to find solutions together. You are part of contributing to the team deliveries.
   

  

 You probably have a background working within control system as a software developer, tester, or function owner; and you are now looking forward to expanding your knowledge and responsibilities within an international organization.
   

  

 You have a B.Sc. or M.Sc in the fields of embedded systems, mechatronics, physics or relevant work experience. However, your attitude, mindset, and personality are of equal importance.
   

  

 It is extra merit if you have experience with agile methodologies and have had a role, like Scrum master, leading work in an agile environment.
   

  

**This Is Us**
 In the Engine Control Systems department we are responsible of the development of control systems for combustion engines for various powertrains in the Traton group. An intensive technical development is ongoing to bring our already world leading engine platform to the next level in our sustainable transport solutions. We, Engine variable valve control, are an agile team consisting of individuals from different parts of the world with different backgrounds and experiences. For us diversity, inclusion and having fun together is highly important.
   

  

 A crucial part of the ongoing technology shift happens in the gas exchange system, were we have our biggest responsibility. By controlling gas flow with the engine internal valves, we can achieve both improved fuel efficiency and an even better experience for the driver. The gas exchange system is central in the next generation of the world’s leading engine for heavy vehicles.
   

  

 We stay ahead by exploring new technologies like artificial neural networks and state of the art control theories in our embedded product. Innovation is key to stay ahead of the competition and we prosper in a work environment where flexibility goes hand in hand with responsibility.
   

  

 In the team we own and drive our own changes from idea to final implementation. This includes driving development of new or improved functions. We implement our own changes in the control unit, plan and carry out test and calibration in engine test cells and vehicles. We follow up and act on deviations from tests, fleets and customers.
   

  

 We have a supportive mindset in the team where we help each other, discuss, review and code with colleagues in the group.
   

  

**Scania Offers**
 We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, Scania supports your career growth both locally and internationally.
   

  

 Benefits include training at our health center Gröndal or wellness allowance, result bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. Scania also hosts events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job express buses.
   

  

**Application**
 Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes. Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2025-03-02.
   

  

 Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.
   

  

 If you have questions or would like more information, please contact: Fredrik Löwgren, Manager Engine Variable Valve Control (ENEFV) at 076 - 529 40 47 or fredrik.lowgren@scania.com
   

  

 We look forward to your application!

title: Lead Software Engineer
company_industry: Hospitals and Health Care, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Software Development
description:
**We don’t just build technology. We build hope for everyone dealing with cancer.**
**What You’ll Do At Elekta**
 Are you passionate about developing cutting-edge software that makes a real positive impact in people’s lives? Join our team and play a key role in developing the real-time embedded software that controls multiple axes in our radiation therapy devices to safely deliver radiation to patients.
   

  

 As a
 **L** 
**ead Software Engineer** 
 , you’ll be involved in every stage of the development lifecycle—requirements, design, implementation, and testing—while leveraging your strong C++ skills to build secure, modern, and maintainable solutions. You’ll be a part of a dynamic team of 15+ engineers, split into two agile Scrum teams, where you’ll contribute to developing new product features for our Linear Accelerator machines and radiation therapy product portfolio. You’ll work across a range of devices, from full-fledged Linux systems to bare-metal microcontrollers, utilizing various communication protocols and design patterns.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
 Your responsibilities will include, but are not limited to:
   

  

* Software implementation, primarily in C++, including unit and integration tests
* Designing architecture and creating detailed documentation
* Reviewing code and software related artifacts
* Mentoring colleagues and sharing knowledge
* Staying updated on technical and clinical advancements in the field
* Understanding and adhering to the Elekta quality system, introducing improvements to its effectiveness.


**What You Bring**
 We are looking for a proactive and collaborative software engineer with a can-do attitude and a systems-thinking approach. Your ability to drive results, collaborate effectively within a team, and contribute to a supportive and fun work environment will be key to your success in this role.
   

  

 We believe you should also have:
   

  

* A university degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or a related field.
* Proven experience in software engineering within a product development organization.
* Strong C++ skills, with a passion for writing clean, safe, and maintainable code.
* Solid understanding of software architecture for large-scale projects.
* Professional proficiency in English.
* Experience in regulated industries, such as medical technology, is a plus.


**Additional merits** 
 include experience with or strong interest in one or more of the following:
   

  

* Real-time systems
* Control theory, e.g., servo control
* Fieldbus communication technologies (CAN, EtherCAT)
* Board Support Package development (e.g. DMA, UART, USB, Ethernet)
* ZeroMQ, Protobuf
* Unit testing framework, like Catch2
* CMake and build systems in general
* CI/CD integration
* Linux
* Yocto
* Development of test frameworks, simulators and/or emulators.


**Why should you join Elekta?**
 In this role, you will work for a higher purpose: hope for everyone dealing with cancer and for everyone, regardless of where they are in the world, to have access to the best cancer care. Additionally, our benefit package includes:
   

  

* 30 paid vacation days/year, additional 4 Elekta days off /year (plus bank holidays).
* Attractive defined contribution pension scheme.
* Private Medical Insurance.
* Lunch Benefit.
* Contribution to wellness activities.
* Hybrid work option (you are required to work on location at least 3 days a week).


 If you thrive in an environment where innovation, teamwork, and high standards come together to make a real impact, we’d love to hear from you!
   

  

**Hiring process**
 We look forward to hearing from you! Please submit your application in English via the 'Apply' button.  Applications will be reviewed on an ongoing basis until the deadline on the
 **2nd** 
**of March 2025** 
 .
   

  

 For questions regarding the role or special assistance, please contact the responsible TA Partner Maria Strelkova at maria.strelkova@elekta.com. Please note that we don’t accept applications or provide individual application feedback via e-mail.
   

  

**We are an equal opportunity employer**
 We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other status protected by law in the locations where Elekta operates.
   

  

**About Elekta**
 As a leader in precision radiation therapy, Elekta is committed to ensuring every patient has access to the best cancer care possible. Elekta is a proud innovator and supplier of equipment and software used to improve, prolong, and save the lives of people with cancer and brain disorders.
   

  

 More than 6,000 hospitals worldwide rely on Elekta technology. We openly collaborate with customers to advance sustainable, outcome-driven, and cost-efficient solutions to meet evolving patient needs, improve lives and bring hope to everyone dealing with cancer. To us, it's personal, and our global team of 4,700 employees combine passion, science, and imagination to profoundly change cancer care. We don’t just build technology, we build hope.
   

  

 Elekta is headquartered in Stockholm, Sweden, with presence in more than 120 markets and listed on Nasdaq Stockholm. For more information about opportunities at Elekta, please visit elekta.com/company/careers.

title: Engineering Manager
description:
**The Seller domain at Hemnet ensures the seller's experience is top-notch! We provide insights, services, and products to maximize exposure and enable successful property sales. We’re now looking for an Engineering Manager who can guide our teams in making technical decisions and shaping strategy to provide the highest value possible to our customers.**
**Role**
 In close collaboration with our Head of Engineering, you will oversee and drive the performance of multiple teams within the Seller domain. Your role will include:
   

  

**👥 Leadership & Team Development:** 
 Leading and mentoring teams with a focus on growth, continuous improvement, and skill development through regular 1:1s, performance management, and coaching.
   

  

**🧭 Technical Strategy & Delivery:** 
 Ensuring high-quality, sustainable delivery of product changes in a fast-paced, iterative environment, where testing and continuous integration are naturally embedded in development.
   

  

**🛠️ Scaling for Success:** 
 Playing a vital role in recruiting, building, and scaling teams to maintain a transformative and resilient organization.
   

  

**Who You Are**
**Background:** 
 A leader with a technical foundation, ideally from tech-native, mid-sized companies where you’ve honed your skills across different environments.
   

  

**Experience & Mindset:** 
 Skilled in managing continuous improvement and rapid-release cycles. You bring a pragmatic, flexible approach with an inner drive to deliver, make decisions, and adapt to new challenges.
   

  

**Leadership Style:** 
 You embody a coaching, supportive, and collaborative leadership style that encourages autonomy and self-management. You lead with curiosity and a strong commitment to fostering an engineering-centric, team-first culture.
   

  

**Your Competencies**
* Proven experience in personnel management, performance growth, and team coaching.
* Strong technical background, ideally with hands-on experience as a software engineer.
* A pragmatic, “doer” mentality with confidence in decision-making.
* A Computer Science degree or similar is a plus, but not required.


**Your career at Hemnet**
 If you’re ready to take on a key leadership role in a forward-thinking, customer-centric domain, this is the perfect career step for you. Here, you’ll find a supportive environment that fosters your professional development, with plenty of opportunities for learning, collaboration, and fun along the way. As Sweden’s most popular property portal, Hemnet has been part of life’s major milestones since 1998, helping millions find their homes. In an environment that combines the stability of an established company with a culture that values every voice, you will help shape the future of property sales across Sweden.
   

  

**Ready to join us?**
 We look forward to your application! Please answer the questions below and submit your CV and we will get back to you as soon as possible. We’re reviewing applications as they come in, so don’t wait too long!
   

  

 Shape your role, explore your curiosity, and express your creativity at Sweden's no. 1 property platform.
   

  

 Enjoy lab weeks, competence days, dev brekkies, brown bags, meetups and lots of cake.
   

  

 We tailor the tools to the task, with quick iterations and a strong focus on high quality.
   

  

* Ruby-on-Rails, JavaScript, Node.js, Typescript
* Next.js, Nest, React.js
* Postgres
* GraphQL
* GCP, AWS
* Docker


 Hemnet is Sweden’s largest property platform. Since the start in 1998, we have been the natural meeting place for real estate agents, property sellers and buyers. Hemnet offers the majority of properties for sale on the market; the largest number of potential buyers; products through which sellers are able to influence the selling of their property - and products that give real estate agents the opportunity to strengthen their brand. We are one of Sweden’s largest sites and apps, and one of the most popular property platforms in the world based on population.
